Reviews.Title: “Great Bay View (South Tower) but stay away from the Train side”
Reviews.Author: Tantien
Reviews.Content: If you're cruising out of this port of San Diego, then do what we did, we booked a room for two for about $112 and then upgraded for $40 to a 5th floor room that had the Harbor View--ask for the South Tower. This did two things: (1) got us away from the train noise that everyone had complained about if you stay in the other tower that faces the train tracks with all the incessant dinging of the crossing rails and the blowing of the train horns, and (2) got a great view of the harbor in a serviceable (but dated) room, with a balcony. In fact, we woke the next morning to find the ship we were to sail on pointed directly at us, since it docked on the same pier we were facing. You also have a view of the Midway Museum located a few piers to the left. So this hotel has a great location if you save yourself the aggravation of the noise by asking for a harbor view in a high room.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: Bruce K
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel primarily due to it's convenient location relative to the sites we were seeing. I wasn't expecting a superior experience, but that's EXACTLY what we received. I would definitely stay here again. The staff was pleasant and helpful. The room was comfortable with a great view. The restaurant served us a great dinner and the rates were very reasonable. If you don't mind huge cruise ships blowing their horns during night arrivals/departures (I thought it was pretty cool, actually) then I'd be hard-pressed to believe you wouldn't enjoy this hotel every bit as much as we did. Thanks, folks, for the great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great View”
Reviews.Author: Judy H
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in this Hotel during our USA vacation (from Australia). Couldn't really fault this Hotel. Exceptionally quiet room, very clean and comfortable and a great view of the Bay. The concierge was extremely helpful with booking tours etc. and the free shuttle bus was great. We used this service a couple of times. Had no trouble with parking at the Hotel during our stay. Would be more than happy to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “They could have cared less...”
Reviews.Author: rconsobe
Reviews.Content: From start to finish, they could have cared less about customer service or us simply as a guest. When checking in they did not have the room type we had reserved yet did nothing to compensate or even apologize. We were simply told nope, not available and then smiled at us like we were idiots standing in front of them at the desk. We then went to the concierge after reluctantly accepting our unacceptable room to ask where we might find some suitable dining, to be snapped at by a rude, extremely disrespectful woman with a french accent, who again made us feel like we were bothering her and how dare we do so. I was so put off by her rudeness that I was about to call a manager over when my traveling companion simply pulled me away and reminded me that the management and front desk really wouldn't care. As in the other reviews we had the noisiest night I have ever had in any hotel and in addition, it got extremely cold that evening and the hotel was absolutely freezing and no heat on anywhere. The following morning we go to the restaurant for our "free breakfast" to find out its really not free, even though the room was booked that way, its simply a $10 voucher off the price of your breakfast check!!! We would have run from this hotel screaming at the first encounter with the front desk if we were not exhausted from traveling all day and were not boarding a cruise ship across the street early the next morning. If you care anything about service, comfort or your own well being, steer clear of this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location but that's all”
Reviews.Author: SMSLMS
Reviews.Content: Although we often visit San Diego we stayed here on this occasion only because we were just here for a couple of days before boarding a ship and the location seemed convenient. Everything started out ok, easy check-in, pleasant staff at the front desk. Once in the room we found that the balcony door was stuck and would only open a few inches. It also would not close properly. That night was very windy so we were awake most of the night listening to the door rattle. We could also hear everything that went on in the hallways. We had booked a room that included breakfast, so the next morning went down to the restaurant with our coupon. After being seated, the waitress came by and on seeing the coupon, grabbed our menus and told us we didn't have any choice about what we would be served other than the manner in which our eggs would be cooked. She also made it very clear and I do mean VERY clear that the coupon did not include her tip. Great start to the day, but when we returned to our room it got better yet, since our keycards wouldn't work. The maid was in the hallway and when we told her the problem she said there was nothing she could do and the problem was caused by carrying the keycards close to a cell phone. Interesting observation inasmuch as my wife's keycard was never near her phone and I don't carry a cell phone. To rectify the problem we had to go back down to the front desk. There were only two people on duty to handle people checking in and out and no one who could handle this sort of problem. As a result we had to wait in line for over half an hour to address the issue. When we did manage to speak to someone she couldn't understand how this could happen and seemed to think we didn't know how to work a door handle. We told her the maid's story about the cell phones and suddenly all was clear for her, yes indeed the problem was caused by cell phones. The fact that I don't carry one and that my wife's phone was never near the keycard didn't matter, the problem had been solved. All we had to do was go back to our room and she would send someone up to deal with the matter. I indicated that I wasn't too pleased to have to wait in a line for over half an hour to discuss the problem and that I wasn't going to stand around in the hallway waiting for someone to show up. She then decided that she could issue new keycards. We returned to the room and miraculously the cards worked. We got ready to go out, waited around a bit, but no one ever did show up at our room, at least not while we were there. Went out for the day and also went out for dinner that evening. That night we again could hear everyone entering and exiting their rooms, every noise in the hall as well as the ship arriving and a variety of announcements made by the ship's staff. Next morning same rigamarole re breakfast although different waitress who didn't make an issue out of her tip. Easy check-out via voicemail. The quality of the room, the decor and the service for the price charged will ensure that we don't ever return to this hotel. Oh, there was also an issue controlling the water temperature in the shower, but we won't go into the details of that.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic View”
Reviews.Author: Idahogranny
Reviews.Content: The view of the bay is fantastic -- cruise ships docking directly in front of my balcony, sailboats on the bay and planes taking off and landing. The rooms aren't big but are very comfortable and clean. The only drawback was a very poor "business center." An unexpected event occurred which required me to download an email but there's only ONE free computer for the whole hotel complex (three towers)! And it's in the middle of the lobby (no privacy and very noisy), sitting up on a very high counter. Since numerous guests were printing their boarding passes, there was a long line of people waiting to use the computer and being only 5' 3", I couldn't see the keyboard!

Reviews.Title: “A little gem.”
Reviews.Author: Richard L
Reviews.Content: This was the second hotel of a three week family trip to California that started in San Diego and finished in San Francisco from where we flew home to the U.K. It's sometimes difficult to say what ingredients go together to make a particular experience exceed expectation or make a particular point in time special, but we will always hold fond memories of the few short days that we spent at this hotel - they were amongst the best for the whole of the trip. Okay if you are looking for a flash glass clad exec hotel with all of the mod cons, and we stayed in one or two of those too, then you might look elsewhere. If you're looking for a great hotel, in a great location, with a great little pool, that doesn't have the corporate feel to it every inch - say a nice place for a family holiday, then look no further. We had two rooms during our stay - we moved for a better view of the harbor once a room became available - they were both furnished to a high standard with comfortable beds. The staff were very welcoming and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “great location for outbound cruise passengers”
Reviews.Author: flyngirlCA
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night before our cruise. There were many good things about the hotel - the front desk staff was courteous, the restaurant/bar in the lobby was really fun and the food was good. The bell staff arrived promptly to take our bags and us over to the cruise ship terminal. I'm sure that after a lot of cruise passengers they have this down to a science. The room was average - average cleanliness, space and amenities. The property could use an update but they have a prime location on the water and probably won't be spending the money anytime soon. There seems to be a big descrepancy between the room quality depending on what tower you are in. We had a great view of the harbour and downtown...ask for a higher floor.

Reviews.Title: “Average at best”
Reviews.Author: lbell69
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2 nights for business. There lobby was nice but the room was average. The bathroom had no vent, the room had no mini bar or fridge, the light bulb was out in the bathroom vanity, water pressure was low and faucet took a long time to heat up for hot water--had to let it run for 10 minutes. My room was company paid on a company cc however they required my personal credit cc, when I refused they asked for $80 cash deposit. Was given crappy located room due to disagreemt with desk staff.

Reviews.Title: “It's your typical dated Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: fletchjhome
Reviews.Content: The frustrating problem with Holiday Inn is the wide range of quality from property to property. This one is one that is very dated but clean, and friendly staff. The view from the higher floors is great.

Reviews.Title: “Very Long Night”
Reviews.Author: whirlpool75
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights here before and after a cruise .Were in 2 different rooms and towers but same result ..Matresses on beds were old lumpy and very hard ..Spent most of the night sleeping in the chair ..Also the sliding door to the balcony in the South Tower room would not close or lock ...Location is great for cruise ship and staff was friendly but this hotel needs alot of TLC !!

Reviews.Title: “GOOD VALUE”
Reviews.Author: chin1ger
Reviews.Content: we stated in this for 3 nights prior to our cruise. we were in the front building with about 8 floors and a small balcony facing the street and bay. we saw 2 cruise ships come in. hotel is a little tired but very clean. noise from street was no problem. good restaurant and bar in hotel. stall was very friendly and assisted us as needed. great location to walk to many attractions. for a fun day trip try the " COASTER ". is is a local comuter train located in the santa fe railroad station about 4 blocks away. would stay here again if in san diego.

Reviews.Title: “Best stop prior to cruise”
Reviews.Author: GatorVictoria_BC
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for one night prior to our cruise and we found the location perfect for walking to nearby sites as well as just crossing the street to board our ship the next day. The hotel does have an free airport shuttle which goes every half hour but we ended up taking a taxi since we arrived in the parking lot just in time to see the shuttle go down the ramp. The taxi cost $10 plus only took about 10-15 minutes to the hotel and really gave us a jump to start visiting the San Diego area. Upon our arrival, yes the hotel does look a little tired from the outside but when we eventually got to our room we found it to be clean and the room was more than ample with pleasant decor. We arrived about noon and were able to check-in right away. The only down side was the room did not have a bar fridge which would have been welcome as we had bought some water and drinks for the room. Our room was on the thrid floor at the end of the hallway so we found it to be quite quiet. We did not find the trains to be noticeable that we couldn't sleep. We did not have an opportunity to try the pool but the water was quite warm so it must be heated. The best part I thought was the balcony off our room which we sat to have morning coffee and watched the hustle bustle at the cruise dock. It gave us a good vantage point to see when it would be right to head over. Why would anyone sign up for the hotel to pier shuttle from the hotel - it literally took us about 10 minutes to walk across the street - deposit our luggage at the pier and walked straight into the boarding gates. We were able to walk over to the US Midway quite easily and stopped to have lunch at the new deli just a block from the hotel, I believe it was called Halswells. Food was reasonable and more than ample to the point we were able to share an entree quite easily between us. We also have our dinner down at the Elephant & Castle in the hotel and found the burgers to be filling. Our waiter was most efficient considering the area and patrons he was caring for. Best sense of humor we have seen in a while - good ambassador. We also found the hotel within walking distance (25 minutes) to the main downtown Horton Plaza shopping mall. Just on the other side of the mall is a full grocery store called Ralphs where you can pick up snacks, deli stuff, liquor/beer if you want. The weather was just beautiful when we were there in mid March so it was quite lovely to walk at night. Felt very safe.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the Water”
Reviews.Author: LoveVacayLife
Reviews.Content: This hotel was close to the bay and pretty clean. It was just an average hotel room though. At night we heard several trains in the distance making it hard to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy inside and out.”
Reviews.Author: YankeeJetSetter
Reviews.Content: I stay at this place often because my company has selected it as our hotel of choice for doing business in San Diego. I have had rooms in all 3 buildings, facing in both directions, so I feel I have had a good cross-section of rooms. I don't dislike the area (across from cruise ship terminal on the waterfront), but I don't rest well there. The rooms seem poorly insulated and I have had stays where I can hear every single word in the room next door. People who stay there are often going to or coming from cruises. So, they are whooping it up. It doesn't matter who they are or what age they are..they all seem to bang around and to talk loud...it's even worse when they are out on the balcony. Also you get outside noise a lot; amazingly loud commuter trains on the city-facing side (from about 5am until after midnight - it's unbelievable), people's voices in the swimming pool area echo (it's between the two main buildings and a bunch of rooms face that area), and even the rooms that face the waterfront expose you to the bells from the USS Midway, people and traffic on the sidewalks along the front of the hotel, and, worst of all, the blowing of cruise ship horns. I had to stay there during the holidays once, and there is a huge loud party on the docks right in front of the hotel. It was a difficult night. The good news is that the staff seems to know about the noise problems and is not shy about sending Security to noisy rooms, so kudos to them for that...if you get the frat boys or the family from Haites in the room above you, they will definitely go knock on the door for you, and if they have other rooms available, they will move you. So don't hesitate to complain to the management if you can't get any rest! Some other observations: If you are looking for a stylish place to stay, this is not it. If you need a tub, you're out of luck (shower only). Rooms are dated, and, lastly, you'd think that a big hotel chain like HI would realize that people need electrical outlets! All the rooms are short on electrical outlets and have multi-plug extensions on the few available ones...they are so heavily overloaded that there's no room for a large or adapter-sized plug (as in apple iphones and other devices)...and you usually have to crawl under the desk to even access the outlet expander. I often carry a netbook, too, and really need two handy plugs and I have NEVER found a room with this convenience. I end up having to plug my electronics in at the bathroom sink! Yikes. Then there's the food issue - aside from a deli between the buildings, there is no place to eat inexpensively (a bar/restaurant which is part of a pub chain is located on the property...limited menu), and Anthony's Seafood is across the street (good food but not cheap), and there is a small walk-up with burgers and quick stuff at the cruise terminal...but besides those limited options, you're going to have to hunt elsewhere for eats. So, bottom line, if sleep, rest, quiet, reasonable and varied dining options, are your thing, I would find somewhere else to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Closest Hotel the the Cruise Ship Terminal”
Reviews.Author: manycruises
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn Bayside is an old hotel but has been renovated many times and is a comfortable place to stay. It is located across the street from the cruise ship terminal as well as the Maritime Museum and the ferry dock for the Coronado Ferry.. The rooms are plain but very adequate, and the beds are comfortable. The on site restaurant is very small, especially for breakfast on the mornings cruise ships are in port. Two other restaurants are located within half a block of the hotel. The hotel provides a free airport shuttle service and also shuttle service to the cruise ship terminal. However, it pays to be the first one in line to sign up for the shuttle to the cruise ships or you will find yourself waiting until 1:00 p.m. for your ride. One passenger I met arranged to have her luggage delivered by the hotel to the cruise ship. She walked across the street and joined her ship. Her luggage never came. She did not understand that the hotel wanted her to be with her luggage when they delivered it at 3:00 p.m. to the ship. She did not receive her luggage until five days later in Guatemala, at a huge shipping cost. If you want a convenient and clean but not fancy place to stay in San Diego, I recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “very accommodating”
Reviews.Author: centralcoaster_11
Reviews.Content: i visited this hotel just one week after major surgery and they were most accommodating. i have never stayed in an accessible room before and theirs was very clean and easy to get around. i especially appreciated the upholstered chair and footstool they brought to my room and the bellman who loaded my car as i was leaving could not have been nicer. i will choose this hotel again next time i have to go to san diego. another plus--right across the street from good seafood at anthony's restaurant!

Reviews.Title: “Older property...near airport...cruise ships across street”
Reviews.Author: Reg61
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the HIOTB in March for a convention. On the plus side, was a free airport shuttle, on the minus side, it is very near the airport. Continually heard the coming and goings of airplanes. Also the South Tower (where I stayed) is right across the street from the Cruise Ship dock. Not a problem if you are coming or going on a cruise ship, except for the occasional times that the ships blow their horns! Finally I was there during an unseasonable cold spell with strong winds. The sliding glass door in the room was so decrepit that the wind blew right in all around the opening. Kept the room so cool I had to put the heat in the room up to 76! The property has CLEARLY seen better days. The neighborhood (if you can call it that) is not inviting and it is a bit of a hike to the trolley around parking lots, etc that are not very friendly at night. Plus side???? the restaurant/bar (Elephant and Castle Pub) has a nice selection of beers and a good happy hour special (imported draft beer for $4.25). Skip buying anything in the gift shop, fairly well appointed, but there is a CVS Drug store 3 blocks away on ASH street. BTW, why did I choose this hotel? It was the only one that would honor the government per diem when I did my registration for my meeting.

Reviews.Title: “It's an amazing place in a stunning city location.”
Reviews.Author: RJD62
Reviews.Content: Get a balcony room overlooking the bay, and watch the sun go down in style. Service cleanliness and comfort are all first rate too.

Reviews.Title: “Dilapidated hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nuket W
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel returning from Alaska cruise last October. Hotel's location is perfect, right across from the cruise terminal, but hotel is very dated, rooms and general areas all need desperate decoration. When we were there they were replacing some of the carpets on the corridors and a new lift was installed. They have a so called English pub downstairs, you would not want to go in there, carpets were so dirty, I have never seen anything like it in my life. they have never ever been cleaned. But that is the only place to have breakfast, unfortunately we had to go in there. Staff in the Pub was not friendly either and wellcoming either. Overall this hotel was a very bad experience. Avoid at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Precruise overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: downeyb
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideally located for an overnight stay before leaving on a cruise. The on-site restaurant is clean, reasonably priced and not fancy. Staff here were friendly and helpful. There is a shuttle over to the cruise ship terminal but honestly, if you're able just walk over. The line up for signing up for the shuttle was ridiculously long considering it's less than a five minute walk. You're also just around the corner from the train station and within walking distance of Little Italy, the Horton Centre and some other attractions. The room was clean, comfortable and quiet. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: aw0rld2travel
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn on the Bay faces the San Diego Harbor. Directly in front of the hotel is the Star of India (Maritime Museum). PLUSES: 1. The hotel is conveniently located to the cruise terminal. It would be an easy walk provided you do not have too much luggage. There is a cruise parking area located very close to the hotel. 2. The hotel offers a free shuttle to the airport, seaport village, Horton Plaza, and Balboa Park (leaves at 9 or 11 AM and returns at 4:20 PM). 3. The rooms are large. The room we had was remodeled and included a large walk-in shower (no tub), king size bed, chair with ottoman, desk area, dresser and large flat screen TV. Our room was clean and odor-free. 4. The H.I. restaurant (Elephant & Castle) has a good happy hour ($ 4.50 beer/wine/mixed well drinks) from 4 - 7 PM. There is a wide selection of beers available. MINUSES 1. Parking (self or valet) is expensive. Neither parking area is fenced or secure. 2. Rooms facing the bay have a lot of road noise. North Harbor Drive is a busy road and the traffic can be heard all night. Rooms that face to city have the train tracks close by so you hear the train whistles and the railroad crossings. 3. The hotel is actually three buildings. The front building faces the harbor, the back building is a multi-story (lower floors face the front building, upper floors face the harbor or the city.) 4. There are limited places to eat within walking distance. A Ruth Chris Steakhouse is next door; a Denny's is 2 blocks away (but you have to cross a busy street to get there).

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Shaun M
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Holiday Inn hotels all over the world, and this one ranks second to bottom in terms of its overall experience. The front of house staff were great - friendly, knowledgeable and efficient and the hotel location is perfect. Arriving in the room was the first disappointment. Although the room was clean and the bed comfortable, the decor was dated and after an 11 hour flight from London, we just wanted a hot shower before sleeping. The water pressure in the shower was poor and it seemed as if there were only two temperature settings - scalding hot or freezing cold. There was no safe in the room, nor was there an in-room bar - things that we have come to take for granted in IHG hotels in Europe. At $22 per night, we found that the car parking was extortionate, but at least we were prepared for that. The biggest shock was at breakfast next morning. We had booked a room on the IHG website at a rate which was supposed to have included breakfast. Imagine our shock to discover that the breakfast included was only up to the value of $20 per room (per room - not per person)! It is served in a separately operated restaurant/bar off the main lobby and the buffet, to which we have become accustomed, was non-existent. The restaurant charged for absolutely everything on an a la carte basis and we soon exceeded the $20 and had to pay the difference. Having paid for a room with breakfast included, we were disgusted by this. The food was good and we ate on the terrace outside but even that experience was spoiled by two pigeons on a nearby table devouring the remains of another couple's food. In conclusion, if you're looking for a good hotel, go elsewhere. We chose this one because our previous Holiday Inn experiences have been good, but don't waste your money on it. There are a lot of other hotels to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for departing cruisers”
Reviews.Author: Roger J
Reviews.Content: Right across the street from the cruise ship terminal and shuttle service makes boarding easy. Also, good airport shuttle connections too. Restaurant is noisy but the food is fine. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Pros & Cons”
Reviews.Author: Lisa4_travels
Reviews.Content: I wish I could give this place a better review. The location was great. Right on the waterfront and about a mile from the gaslamp district. We had a drink in the bar and the bartender was very friendly. We checked into our room and in order to check out the view we pulled the curtains back from the patio doors and left them open while we went out exploring. Totally our fault. When we got back, the sun beating through the doors had sent the temperature soaring and unfortunately the air conditioner only blew hot air. When I went to report it, I found that BOTH of the phones in the room were broken! If you choose to book here, PLEASE find out the status of the huge construction project taking place in front of the hotel. It was loud and ugly and prevented us from opening our patio doors. Also, they start work early, even on Saturdays.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best San Diego Hotels!”
Reviews.Author: NPSmith92392
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Holiday Inn On the Bay for three out of the 9 years I have visited San Diego for the San Diego Comic Con, and it seems the hotel gets better each year. The first year I wasn't thrilled with the night clerk and service at that time, but since then it has been a great experience! Very awesome location, right across from one of the best fish restaurants in San Diego (Anthony's Fish Grotto) as well as the bay which has docked the legendary Star of India ship, one of the most haunted ships in the USA. I am planning to go to San Diego once again in July, and I am hoping to get a reservation with Holiday Inn!!!

Reviews.Title: “A nice surprise with great staff”
Reviews.Author: DebiLovestoTravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the night before our cruise. This is the best location for cruisers as it is right across the street from the cruise ship terminal. It is also well located, if you do not mind walking a few blocks, to Horton Plaza, Gas Lamp, Seaport Village and Little Italy. A special mention to the concierge desk. They were flooded by dozens of people wanting to drop off or pick up luggage, obtain visitor info or answers to questions. We waited at least 10 minutes to drop off our bags. I was very impressed by how pleasant, respectful and patient they all were. Not everyone in line was very nice yet they treated everyone well. Kudos to them all! Here are the pro's and cons: PROS Great staff - every staff person we encountered was friendly, helpful and very patient: front desk, concierge, gift shop, housekeeping you name it. Nice property amenities - pretty pool, self laundry, better than usual gift shop, three restaurants on site and others close by. Location - as mentioned above good location View from room - we splurged on a bay side room. It is really cool to sit on our balcony and watch the cruise ships come in and leave. You can also see airplanes do the same thing. We saw dolphins following a boat out of the harbor in the morning! CONS Price - we booked through the hotel website as there were no deals on the usual hotel sites. Paid $160 for our bay view room. Room - we were on the third floor of tower three. It was bit noisy especially from the construction next door. While the room was large it seemed a bit dated. No microwave or fridge though there is s safe. Crowds - this is a place popular with cruisers. Cruise ships hold lots of people and it seemed that everyone on both our ship and the other ship that was in port were at the hotel. There were lineups to check in and to the concierge. There seemed to be people everywhere all of the time. I recommend this hotel if you are leaving or coming back from a cruise or plan to visit the USS MIdway or like watching the ships and planes or like a retro-vibe. There are better locations if you want to spend your time at the Gas Lamp area or if you want a "cool" hotel. This hotel feels like a little resort in the middle of a City. A nice surprise with staffed by great people.

Reviews.Title: “Memorial Day - In San Diego”
Reviews.Author: nunillo
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my wife in this hotel during the Memorial Day weekend 2011. The location is great, you can walk downtown, little italy or just by the bay. Is one of the best location hotel I've stayed in US. The hotel is good for all ages, you can see a lot of families with kids by the pool. We really had a good time in the city. Is blocks away from the lightrail station to go to Sea World and Old Town. We really really enjoyed the weekend in San Diego. Looking forward to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Cruisin" Fun”
Reviews.Author: Patricia S
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because it was on the bay and had several nice restaurants. To my surprise, it was across the street from the Carnival Cruise Terminal that we needed the next day. Our room on the bay was SUPER. Although close to the airport, unless you are on the balcony, the noise was not bad. The staff was extremely friendly and check-in was a breeze.We ate in the Elephant & Castle restaurant and the food + service was great. Although alittle pricey, it was worth it!! The gift shop was really nice and the location was one of the best.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, for the price”
Reviews.Author: jeff672
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Holiday Inn-On the Bay for 2 nights from February 16th thru the 19th as a 2 day getaway for me. This Holiday Inn is actually a complex, where you do your check-in in what I think was an original building with rooms, and they also have 2 other towers with rooms as well. One of the towers is attached to the old building, which was separated by conference room facilities, the other is not. Check In-I arrived around 2pm thursday afternoon, and while there was a line to check in, there were 5 people checking people in, so the line moved very rapidly. They gave me my room key, a code for the wireless internet, and a 10% discount coupon for a deli that is on the complex. They also give you shuttle pick-up times for the airport, the zoo, sea world, and a couple other locations. Shuttles are free. The room-I have read other reviews about the rooms here at the Holiday Inn, and I have to say, they are pretty spot on. I got the king sized bed, which I found firm, but not overly hard. They give you 4 square pillows, 2 firm, 2 soft. The chair, tables, and dresser are straight from the late 70's or early 80's. Yes, they are dated, but they serve their function. It's a Holiday Inn, what do people expect, Pottery Barn furniture. There was a 32" LCD TV with about 30 channels along with the standard pay per view movies, which ran around $17 a pop. The room has its own thermostat, which ran smoothly and quietly. People have said about the thin walls. While I didn't hear any noise from my next door neighbors, I definitely heard the Amtrak train blowing it's horn every 30-45 minutes. Yes folks, I had a city view room with the Amtrak station only 1 block away, and its a very busy station. In addition to Amtrak, there was the local commuter train, and the red trolley line. And I have to admit, it got a little irritating. Hint, keep your balcony room locked, as all balconies are attached to each other, and it would be easy for a not so nice person to come from a different room from the outside to get into your room, if your balcony door was left unlocked. The Bathroom-I was up on the 12th floor of the tower that was attached to the first building, I didn't find problems getting hot water, but I found the water pressure being a little lacking. Same for the toilet, when you flushed, it took forever to complete the cycle. The bathroom was equipped with a shower only, which is not a problem for me. My opinion is, unless its a whirlpool tub, why bother. Standard sink, and hairdryer hanging on the wall. There was also a ironing board located in the bathroom closet. Hotel Overall-I don't know if it was color scheme, but the hotel just looked old. The hotel has a swimming pool and also a workout gym. The hotel also has a Elephant and Castle attached to the hotel, but is not a part of Holiday Inn. I ate there, and had fantastic meals. The Hotel also has room service, which I was told, comes out of a different kitchen. There is also a Ruth's Chris' steakhouse restaurant on the complex. As a stated earlier, I got a code at checkin for wireless internet, which was free for my entire stay, which was a pleasant surprise. I had no problems connecting, and had good coverage. The hotel is directly across for the cruise terminal, the maritime museum, and the Midway museum. The Carnival Spirit and Holland America's Statendam were leaving on my first night. The hotel is also within walking distance to the Gas Lamp Quarter section of San Diego. In Conclusion-Would I stay there again, given the price, it was a good value overall, even with hearing the train horns.

Reviews.Title: “The bed are VERY small”
Reviews.Author: LESMEX
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ugly inside and the rooms are ugly too, the worse is that if u don't book trough the hotel they will give you a double bed and each bed is smaller that a queen bed, the SMALLER BEDS I have seen in my life. they wil tell you " you book for the best available all kin beds are reserved" Gym is horrible the machines look like torture machines. Old and uncomfortable impossible to work out!

Reviews.Title: “We had a very nice stay here”
Reviews.Author: nonstop_8
Reviews.Content: I felt this hotel is a very good value. The location is great. Room rates are not out of line. The front desk was very friendly on check in. They let us check in early. I found the other employees to be very friendly. They have a good restaurant and bar with friendly employees. They also have a nice gift shop. There is a computer in the lobby where you can print off your boarding passes if needed. In the morning there is a small kiosk open at one end of the lobby if all you want is coffee and a pastry. The sitting area of the lobby is nice and open with good light coming in. The rooms are typical Holiday Inn, nothing too fancy--a little dated. The bathroom was designed wierdly with the way the door opens into the room. Also the closet in in the bathroom (??). If you get a high room, the view is nice. We would definately stay here again because of the value and location right on the harbor. You can walk to several different attractions and to things in the downtown area. Very close to the trolly stop. It is close to the airport so you get a fair amount of plane noise, but once I got used to it, I never thought about it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in just the right place”
Reviews.Author: catstheword
Reviews.Content: This hotel is overlooking the harbour of San Diego and is convenient to the trolley, seaport village, maritime museum(right across the street, USS Midway. Shuttle is convenient to airport and other sights in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy”
Reviews.Author: Susan8715
Reviews.Content: Great location,very good shuttle service. Clean rooms but worn. Would stay here again anytime and would recommend to friends because of the location to many of the local attractions. Also close to trolley and bus lines and the ferry.

Reviews.Title: “Overall an Ok Hotel, but feel like I was racially profiled!”
Reviews.Author: Sawdoff
Reviews.Content: Im upset that I made this reservation a long time ago, called the service desk and they kept trying to transfer me to someone else instead of helping me. Now that I have checked in I had reserved a water side view room, and because I am a Priority Club member, asked that I be accomodated in a high room for the total bay view.. I paid the money! Well, I checked in and they sent me to a 4th floor room that had the worst view in the hotel, totally obstructed by trees! Wtf? Good job Holiday Inn on treating your Club members so well. If I had been a 6'2" whiteman who was well dressed and flashed a platinum card, I would have had the Royal treatment. I don't like to use the racial card, but you can feel it when someone gives you bad vibes. I complained and was moved to the 11th floor which was more to my liking.. The property is otherwise nice, and the rooms are ok. Location is paramount..

Reviews.Title: “Great location, poorly maintained”
Reviews.Author: klaggs
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel to see if it would work if we decided to take a cruise next year. After reading other reviews, most of the negative comments were confirmed. We had a nice bay side view on the South Tower. Big complaint -there was no hot water ( not even enough to have anything but a cold shower). One elevator was not working - which was ok since there were not many patrons the night that we stayed. Since the hotel was old the walls are thin and the airport was very noisy. This isnt the hotel's fault but the front street was ripped up for major construction and they were jackhammering and running equipment from the morning until 5 pm. This hotel will work if you want to be as close as possible to the cruise ship terminal - you can easily drag your suitcases across to the terminal. Dont stay on the bay side stay on the city side, the bad view will pay off as it will be less noisy. The staff was nice, friendly and quick. The restaurants in the hotel seemed nice but there was no breakfast. Nor was there a fridge in the room. Given the above issues I do not know why the Holiday Inn does not start upgrading this hotel as it has the potential to be a winner. At least provide fridges and a free breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fair hotel”
Reviews.Author: Robin B
Reviews.Content: Pro: The location. you are right across the street from the bay. If you don't like the food offered in the hotel there are two more restaurants just across the street and it is just a short walk to the USS Midway and Seaport Village. The trolley tour also has a ticket booth and stop just across the road. The area is well lit and I felt quite safe walking back at night. The staff were friendly and helped me when ever I had any issues. The room was of a fair size and it had the best shower of all the hotels I stayed in on the trip. The pub "The Elephant and Castle" is also quite good and they do a very nice steak at a good price. Cons: It is close to the airport and where cruise ships dock so it could get noisy for some people but personally I found the noise level acceptable. Not all the balcony rooms get a great view. My view was of half of the pool and the exercise centre. But then if I wanted to see the bay all I had to do was go down the elevator and cross the road. There are some homeless people who gather beside the bay but I never felt uneasy at any point. Overall: Exciting place to stay? No. But a good place to stay while exploring San Diego? Yes. Especially if you can get a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Don"t waste your money!”
Reviews.Author: Sandi W
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very dated and dirty. We stayed in the third tower, very inconvienient. Parking was 22 a day-ridiculous. Our beds were uncomfortable, and the room was small with 2 queen beds. We had no hot water the first morning the mainternace people came and fixed it right away but it never really quite worked properly. The staff was robotic and unfriendly. There were homeless people sleeping below our balcony and we believe we witnessed soomeone who had possible stolen a roll along suite case and was going through it under neath a light in the parking lot on ther ground! Also it was very overpriced. This was one of the worsst hot.els I have stayed at in a long time. I would not recommend this to any cruise ship travelers who are staying even for one night. There are plenty of other hotels and other Holiday Inns within blocks. Oh and did I mention there was major road construction right below our windows first thing every morning! The view was nice but did not make up for the horrible stay.Don't waste your money!

Reviews.Title: “Precruise hotel”
Reviews.Author: grahame20
Reviews.Content: The only good thing about this hotel is the extremely convenient location directly opposite the cruise terminal. Stayed one night on 13th Jan 2012 The room was disappointing, the hotel dated and dreary the view was over the car park. That said it was clean enough and provided you aren't expecting too much then it did the job.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for a pre-cruise hotel”
Reviews.Author: pegcruiser
Reviews.Content: We also stayed one night on Jan 13, 2012 before the ms Oosterdam. We took the hotel shuttle from the airport which runs every 1/2 hour (or so). Just make sure you are near the beginning of the line in order to get a seat. Check in was OK but there were only two agents on duty and with a shuttle just arrived, there was a bit of a wait. Staff were friendly and accommodating, especially the young lady we dealt with in the gift shop. We had a bay view room so we had to take our luggage into another building, about 50 yards from the main hotel. There are two lobby elevators and one panoramic (outside) elevator with fantastic views of the bay and the port. The room itself is really nothing special. It has a separate dressing area, hair dryer and sink, coffee maker, full bath and a closet opposite the sink. There is a queen bed, pillow menu, phone, flat screen TV and a desk if one wants to use a PC, etc. WI-Fi is included. There is a small balcony with furniture and a great view of the bay and your cruise ship; it literally docks opposite this hotel tower. There are a number of dining options on site, including a steak house, an Elephant and Castle restaurant, and a coffee bar (continental breakfast) in the lobby. We had supper across the street at Antonio's (seafood) and breakfast at the Elephant and Castle; we can strongly recommend both. There is an excellent gift shop which is very well stocked for souvenirs, snacks, papers, sundries and those last-minute things you forgot to pack. There is a shuttle to the cruiseship terminal on embarkation day but one has to sign up for it between 8 and 10 a.m. same day. As we were only about 100 yards from the Terminal, we just hooked up the luggage and walked across the street (use the pedestrian crosswalk, of course). All in all, a good stay and the convenience factor for cruise ship passengers is unparalleled.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hernandezmm
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel but costly. Nice rooms, excellent staff.

Reviews.Title: “Upscale Effort for a Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: JudyMarieBee
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a weekend to see my son present at a conference at the Convention Center. The location of the hotel is very nice. It is so convenient to everything, and we loved the walk to Seaport Village. The front desk staff was extremely helpful in getting our rooms closely located to my son as he had arrived two days prior to our family. The only complaint that we all had was the noise from the city (especially the train horns at all hours of the night). Overall, we enjoyed our stay and would stay there again, hopefully next time we will be boarding one of the cruise ships to paradise!

Reviews.Title: “Not fancy but gets the job done”
Reviews.Author: LoveNYCandABQ
Reviews.Content: A hotel stuck in the 80's decor of seaside kitsch. Could use a complete walls-out renovation. However, if you want basic amenities and a good location as your base to explore downtown and the harbor areas of San Diego, it's a good value. You don't really need a car--you can walk to the train station and catch one of the city's great trolleys to anywhere you'd like to go. We used it daily and bought a pass for $20. Went to Petco Park for baseball games, to Old Town for browsing and shopping, even jumped off at different stops to explore other parts of the city. Hotel is across the street from Anthony's our favorite local seafood place, the ferry to Coronado, historic sailing vessels like the USS Midway carrier, and more. Nice walking paths long Harbor Drive to look at the sailboats and fishermen on the piers. A few blocks' walking takes you to the heart of downtown, or you can always take the trolley to the Gaslamp Quarter. Hotel--not the greatest, but it gets the job done because of the location and generally low prices.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Leelee63
Reviews.Content: Our 4 day stay here was really enjoyable. Our room was on the 9th floor and overlooked San Diego Bay, and it was lovely to sit on the verandah as the sun was going down, drink in hand, watching the boats..... we even had the "Rotterdam" cruise ship pull into harbour directly across from us! The staff here were very nice, and the rooms were clean and comfortable. On-site parking (for a fee) was convenient, and very easy to access. Breakfast in the Elephant & Castle was delicious and very well priced. The location is great.... good shoping within walking distance, and easy access to the freeway. There are several restaurants within walking distance and the stroll along the foreshore at night is very enjoyable. The Inprepid warship museum is just down the road (worth a visit), and the cruise ship terminal is just across the road, so a great overnight stay if you're going on a cruise!!! This Holiday Inn is exceptionally well priced for it's services and location. I'd recommend this to anyone planning a trip to beautiful San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great views of the Harbour..”
Reviews.Author: cyberdoc1
Reviews.Content: if you get a harbour view room. Worth paying the extra for the sunrise and sunset. Rooms are smaller compared to other similar hotels but the lobby service was efficient with speedy check in and automatic check out. There was a coffee bar in the lobby area and an adjacent bar/resturant-"The Elephant & Castle" where we meet some very friendly Americans. Close to Gas Light Quarter and USS Midway Museum (walking distance). Good choice if short stay in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy the bay at a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: JoeEm2anuelLara
Reviews.Content: Excellent view of the SD's bay, great breakfast and awesome place to have a beer by the end of the day. The rooms are not brand new, but you can really feel like if you're at home at some point, since the environment if more than friendly. More than enough to workout by the morning with a couple of fitness rooms, and nice outdoor pool. Good and fast laundry and dry clean services, and well equipped biz center for excecutives. This hotel offers the best combination on a great location for much less than others on the same area; actually the main reason why I rate it as excellent. The restaurant bar, which is actually a very nice PUB, the Elephant & The Castle is just a great place to finish the day, and take a look on the pics the family took during the day, make a catch-up of the day with friends, or wrap up a biz day with the peers or your boss. Although the parking is charged, you can feel safe, and much better, your car will really be close to your room at any time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: redladya
Reviews.Content: Hotel was nice, location was great-directly across from cruise ship terminal, Coronado Ferry, & close to Gaslamp. Breakfasft in the restaurant (Elephant & Castle IIRC) was also nice. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Older hotel, nice views from the glass elevator.”
Reviews.Author: BigLakeCountry
Reviews.Content: Arrived late, so not a lot of choices for rooms. Also a large convention in the area, I should have booked in advance, but didn't know what day i would be in San Diego. Great location for people going on a cruse. Some nice views from the glass elevator, and probably some of the rooms, however ours looked at the parking lot.

Reviews.Title: “Probably stay elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: chhall
Reviews.Content: Greeted nicely as Gold Priority member but then let down after that. Waiting endlessly for lifts as only ever one working at a time! Booked a Bayside view room and the view was great, but room was not, no fridge, worn carpet, bathroom was big but also included the wardrobe and very small vanity. Room was next to service lift which was very noisy and I suspect being used by guests as well due to only ever one lift working at a time which was very frustrating and a nightmare at times. Woken early with banging from service lift being used after being kept awake most the night listening to person next door snoring, how thin are those walls! On the upside the attached pub was great for food.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great stay.”
Reviews.Author: kmldkl
Reviews.Content: We chose the Holiday on the Bay because of the location to the cruise terminal. We stay for 3 nights before our cruise to Hawaii and paid extra for a bay view room which was great. We took the free shuttle from the airport and did not have to wait long for the shuttle. Check in was fast and friendly and being we already had bay side room I ask for one with a view of the bay and was given one on the 11th floor which had a great view of bay. The room was nice and clean, we did not stay in our rooms that much other than to sleep and cleanup. The only problem we had was that we couldn’t call out to an 800 number on the phone but a call down to the desk and they would dial out for us. They offered to send someone up to fix the phone but we told them they could fix it after we checked out. I guess noise doesn’t bother us, it didn’t wake us up at night, when I did hear it I went to the balcony to watch the planes take off or land. We tried the Elephant & Castle Pub at the hotel twice, too long of a wait for our drink at the bar, the bartender was too busy. We went across the street to Anthony's Fish Grotto, excellent service and the food was great. We would go over to the bar for cocktails and appetizers, they have a special price for appetizers at the bar for happy hour, and then we would sit at a table for dinner. On the day of the cruise we could see the lineup for the cruise ship from our balcony and we just waited in our room until the line was gone and then we walked over and got right on the ship with not much waiting. I gave the hotel 5 stars because it had everything we wanted, clean room, friendly service and location. We definitely would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: redBerry30
Reviews.Content: Awesome location, good service, nice clean soft beds, free shuttles to sightseeing places and to/from airport, restaurant/pub/steakhouse inside the hotel, very near to public transportation stops : our 4 night stay in "On The Bay" was perfect. I have no complaints. We got everything what we paid for.

Reviews.Title: “Good bayside hotel in the heart of San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Peter W
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated right across from the cruise ship terminal, so an excellent pre cruise location as you can walk across to check in! Spent three nights in tower 3 (yes, 3 towers and a multi storey parking garage). Large room, king size bed, coffee making equipment, balcony with chairs. No fridge in room or an in room safe. The location is not very peaceful as it is adjacent to San Diego main station - drivers here seem to blast their VERY loud sirens almost constantly as they move across the numerous level crossings in the area. Room servicing did not happen until around 3pm, about the time I come in from walking and want to lie down! Elephant and Castle authentic English pub, within hotel, serves good pub food. Excellent free wi-fi in the room - probably the quickest I have ever experienced in a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location near the cruise ship terminal”
Reviews.Author: Batonwaver
Reviews.Content: The property is an older Holiday Inn and somewhat quaint in that respect. It is well maintained in most aspects. Our room 647 was quite large with an equally large bathroom. A flat panel TV that actually receives high definition signals is in the room. The cruise ship terminal is across the street making for an easy transfer to catch your cruise. The hotel will actually take you across the street in their van if your luggage is excessive. Other free transfers include shopping trips, the San Diego Zoo and the airport. All seem to run right on time. A lot of the clients are airline personnel so they must have a good reputation of on time shuttles. A few items need attention. During our four days at the property only 3 of the 4 elevators that service our tower were working. The customer computer in the lobby was always "out of order" which plays havoc with trying to get airline boarding passes. The thermostat in our room never would move from 72 degrees. The weather was nice during our stay so this was not a big problem. There is a pub restaurant off the lobby that serves three meals a day and acts as a sports bar. There are many excellent restaurants in the area including Anthony's Fish House across the street and a Ruth's Chris Stark House next door to the property. All in all a good choice and our rate was $104.00 a night which was very good in this part of San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “After a long trip it was nice to sleep here”
Reviews.Author: margreet71
Reviews.Content: It was a nice hotel. A pity that we did not have a nice view but it was very pleasant that we could walk to our cruise boat Zaandam. We did not like the breakfast in Elephant & Castle as we booked a room for 2 nights with breakfast. The breakfast was only for $ 10,-- and it was not possible to have a proper breakfast under $ 20.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Views! Walk to your cruise ship...”
Reviews.Author: Pleasant1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn for one night before our cruise. We had a balcony room that faced the harbor. We spent most of our time outside watching the harbor traffic and enjoying the sun. In the morning we had a room service breakfast and looked out at our cruise ship - the Celebrity Century across the street. Our room was large and clean. The breakfast was very tasty - the omelets were great! Staff at the front desk were friendly and allowed us to check in several hours early. We had dinner at the British themed pub "Elephant and Castle" and enjoyed that. I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “HI on the Bay is a Keeper!”
Reviews.Author: Bradford B
Reviews.Content: I have stayed there for years, booked many conferences & small seminars, eaten in the restaurants, I really know the hotel VERY well as a result of 10+ years dealing with their fine staff. Great renovations to rooms and an excellent location, walking distance to museums, bayside eateries & touristy sites lining the Embarcadero. Whether on business travel and needing a venue to meet at or simply staying with the family and requiring lodging & accommodations to handle all that, the Holiday Inn on the Bay is really a dependable bet and a very good value. A special thanks to Robert in Banquets, Judy & Brandy in Catering Sales and the fine staff in the Elephant & Castle pub. - B. Barrett, CMP

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location for boarding the Cruise Ship”
Reviews.Author: nannygoatjunction
Reviews.Content: We booked simply as it was the closest we could get to walking to the Cruise Terminal. We arrived at the Airport thinking we could get a shuttle to the Hotel, this was probably possible but we did not have the Hotel Phone Number and it was very confusing for us, so we just hopped in a taxi. No real problems there. The Service Counter Staff were efficient but very, very impersonal. Not even a hello, how was your flight (ect). Just love feeling like that statistic! Asking to use the internet was like pulling teeth and then told "only for 5min" Yep, was pretty happy about that. The room was neat, clean and servicable, as expected. We did not realise we needed to book to use the shuttle service to the Ship and thus we missed out. Being our first time and obviously knowing where we were headed, it is shame the staff did not show some gumption or personality and offer information.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for a short stay.”
Reviews.Author: Arleighk
Reviews.Content: I just stayed here for 2 nights. The location and view are great. The rooms are small but clean and they do have balconies. The beds and pillows are mediocre however. They do have good prices though and a fun pub with good food and prices. The pool area is small but clean. I wouldn't stay here for a week but it's good for a few days.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised, Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: QuinceyCanada
Reviews.Content: After reading all the negative reviews on this property, I must say I wasn't sure what I was getting into. Our family of four (2 teenagers included) fit quite well in this hotel and had a great stay. Shuttle - arriving at the airport we waited maybe 10-20 minutes. Had a friendly personable driver. We took the shuttle to the zoo also and to the airport. Very handy and free :) We could have taken it to Horton Plaza also but we walked as the weather was so nice. Front Desk - everyone was always very helpful. I must have spoken to at least 7 different staff at the front desk during our 4 night stay and all of them were very helpful and courteous. Elevators - no problems at all Room - South Tower, bay view, close to the water, nice balcony. Bathroom is small but the 4 of us managed just fine. I was told that the bathrooms in this tower are more favorable for a family of 4 and this worked for me. Toilet and shower are separate from the sink so very handy. Nice flat screen panel tv. Rooms are older and worn but comfortable and clean. Coffee maker, blow dryer. FREE Internet HOT water, nice shower Complimentary computer to print boarding passes!! I phoned down to the desk a few times...extra towels, extra bedding and received prompt efficient friendly service. Restaurant - Anthony's Fish Grotto across the street was great. We did the quick service and sat in a very casual setting on the water...beautiful and nice food. Close by - US Midway museum, Maritime museum, cruise terminal...we could see all of this from our balcony. Breakfast - we ate breakfast and snacks at the Elephant & Castle restaurant in the hotel and enjoyed it each time. good service and good food. Airport is close by so you hear the planes once and awhile but that didn't bother any of us...at all. I quite enjoyed watching the take off and landings.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and view”
Reviews.Author: cragel
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is top notch with a wonderful view of the bay from the upper floors. We stayed on the 10th floor in the North Tower. The room was very spacious and opened up to a large balcony overlooking San Diego Bay and the USS Midway aircraft carrier (museum). The beds however were hard and not very comfortable. Other than that, the room was modern and clean. We had 4 days of very active residents in the floor above us, which we had to complain to the front desk in the early morning hours. The front desk did send security up to quiet them down, but they would just strike it up again the next night. The lounge at the hotel is very nice, with decent food and plenty of beverages to choose from. The overall service at the hotel was friendly and I would give them very high marks.

Reviews.Title: “"Fantastic location almost offset poor service"”
Reviews.Author: NewJerseyLori
Reviews.Content: When I landed at San Diego International Airport around 7:00 PM, I called the hotel to ask about a shuttle. They told me it ran every half hour and where to go wait for it. I waited for 50 minutes and finally took a taxi. When I checked in there was one person at the desk and I was 5th in line--took nearly an hour to get checked in. The flight crew from several flights arrived and they got priority in the line--not that I mind! I want my pilots rested! My room was ok with a beautiful view of the harbor where, coincidentally, the America's Cup boats were all docked and/or practicing--what an extra bonus! Housekeeping never showed up the next day. I got a room on the 9th floor with great views but horrible water pressure in the shower! When I called to ask for conditioner, I was told there wasn't a single mini bottle in the entire hotel. Don't expect quiet --the airport is nearby. Don't expect to get the room you were promised. My colleague arrived the next day, was told she couldn't ride the shuttle because the flight crews were filling it and then was given a second floor room above the taxi stand despite having a 3-night harbor view, top floor room confirmed. Don't expect friendly staff at the desk or at the bar in the restaurant. Easy walking to convention center, Gaslight district. Free wi-fi in your rooms but if you want to log onto the lobby computer to print a boarding pass, you'll have to pay$6.95 for 15 minutes

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: Eileen31
Reviews.Content: My husband & I spent two days at this Holiday Inn before our Panama Canal Cruise. The hotel is right on the Boardwalk directly across the street from the Cruise Terminal, so all you have to do is walk across the street with luggage in hand to the terminal. The USS Midway Aircraft carrier Museum is half a block to your left from the hotel & the Hop On & Hop Off Tour Bus is less distance than that from the hotel. Anthony's Seafood Restaurant is also across the street to your right slightly. The Hotel itself is clean, excellent service,comfortable beds and the rooms are good size. If & when we go back to San Diego we will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Bayside Hotel”
Reviews.Author: crystalregnurse
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel while attending a convention in San Diego. It is very close to public transportation and the Gaslamp Quarter. There were two trolly stops that were within walking distance and many taxi's driving around for transportation. A shuttle bus was also availalbe to transport guests to and from the airport. Our return flight was a 10PM flight and a late check out was available for us to sleep in on our departure day and the hotel let us keep our luggage there until we came back for it later on our way to the airport (via their shuttle). This hotel is not close to the beach, but it does have a nice view of the bay. The hotel itself was average, the beds were comfortable and there was nice balcony in our room. One thing I must complain about was the elevators. There usually was only one elevator working at a time and it would stop at every floor, even if there was no one waiting for a ride. This went on for a few days, so I think it was legitimately malfunctioning and not a one time mistake. That got quite old, especially when it was during busy times when a bunch of people would have to fit into the one elevator that was working and then it would a long time to get to the first floor again. Other than that, the hotel was priced well and did offer a nice view. I did not try any of the restaurants attached to the hotel, although one morning we attempted to get breakfast sandwiches from the cafe that is attached to the hotel but were told they did not have "take-out", so we had to wait until we went into town for a nice breakfast. I would probably stay here again if I needed a room near the Gaslamp Quarter, but would not stay here if I intended to visit the beach often.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely recommend”
Reviews.Author: jowms
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 days there after getting off a cruise ship. We chose this hotel because it was directly opposite the cruise ship terminal and we very pleased with the room. Next door to the hotel is a pub called Elephant and Castle where we eat 2 nights and the food was very reasonable priced and good. Five minutes walk to Tourist Information Centre. Fifteen minutes walk to all the shops, restaurants Macy's etc. Directly opposite is a trolley tour stop. We bought a two day ticket and visited Coronado, San Diego Zoo, Old Town etc.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a little clean up.”
Reviews.Author: 36000ft
Reviews.Content: Third time staying at this hotel and it just needs a clean sweep. The hallways and room carpets are quite dirty and stained so I suggest bringing a pair of flip-flops. Pro's: Great location, nice restaurant/bar with happy hour and a great patio, front desk staff is knowledgeable about the area. Con's: Elevators are unreliable, carpets dirty, no desk in the room only a round table with no outlets, sink drainage problems, very tired room decor and balcony doors don't seal so noise and air rushes in. In summary if they just spent sometime taking care off the place it would be a pretty good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “O.K. hotel, no balconys or free breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: in0urtravels
Reviews.Content: The room we had was fine, clean enough, comfortable bed. The fan motor was loud enough to drown out the crying child next door. The pool was nice, and the restaurant adjacent to the hotel served a good breakfast. Overall it was a good value for a weekend in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Needs to be remodeled!”
Reviews.Author: FrqtTrvlr14
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nicely located near the cruise dock with longer walks for those wishing to go to the gaslight district. I have stayed here many times, but have noticed the room maintenance going downhill. They have somewhat large rooms, but the carpet and linens are well-worn and shabby. Also, many items in the room don't work. On my latest stay, the sink faucet leaked which would soak anything you placed on the counter. Also the sink stopper didn't work and the sink itself had rust coming through the porcelain. It was hard to sleep because the trains going by sounded like they were just outside my window. I thought maybe the sliding glass door was open, but when I checked the door seal was missing so there was an open half-inch gap which didn't block any noise. (The door/window was only single-pane so I'm not sure how much noise would be blocked with a working door seal). I travel often for work, and most hotels I stay at welcome guests bringing maintenance discrepancies to their attention. When I told the desk clerk about these problems, he shrugged his shoulders and told me that everyone has similar complaints, he passes them on, but nothing is ever done to fix problems. Having stayed here often, I can attest to that. Nice location, friendly staff, but please upgrade your rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal when cruising”
Reviews.Author: Exilelass
Reviews.Content: It can be no secret to cruisers that this is the place to stay in San Diego pre/post cruise. It is within walking distance of the ship, offers a shuttle to the airport and the zoo. What more could you want? Well I would want a comfortable bed, a well ventilated, clean room, good prices and somewhere great to eat within walking distance of the hotel. I got all of these here. The Karl Strauss Brew Pub is within an easy walk where the food and beer are fantastic. The Holiday Inn on the Bay is our first though when we know we are going to be in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints”
Reviews.Author: RSMike
Reviews.Content: OK first off, we got a bay view room on the 7th floor of the south Tower. Perfect view ( you can see the Midway, cruise terminal, Ship museum, the airport, harbor Island, shelter Island, the Naval Air station, the Coast Guard station nice balcony, so If you enjoy watching boats and planes coming and going, bring your binoculars) No complaints about train horns, heard vaguely in the distance at night but in no way disturbed our sleep. Hazelwood's on the ground floor is perfect for a nice and good value breakfast (nice coffee, lovely fresh orange juice). Elephant and Castle pub/restaurant also very good and Anthony's fish grotto right across the road on the waterfront has great seafood ( they also have a takeaway at the side which is also good an great value) Rooms are worn but everything worked, No complaints

Reviews.Title: “Second Good Stay on San Diego Bay”
Reviews.Author: HNRVancouver
Reviews.Content: This was my second one week stay at this Holiday Inn location. The 1st was a bit better because I was in the north tower which had been recently remodeled and was just nicer than the south tower. Customer comfort, like comfortable seating, was definetly taken into account when remodelling the north tower. Still, I had few complaints. When I mentioned to the young man checking me in that I was celebrating my 65 birthday with them and would appreciate a bay view, I felt he did his best to accommodate me with a nice room on the 5th floor facing the bay even though I was there on a pretty good Expedia rate. The views of the bay, cruise ships across the street, sunsets and people were truly a plus that I constantly enjoyed from my little balcony with two chairs and a little table. This a 100% non-smoking hotel and I would suggest that if you choose to smoke on your balcony, and some do, be very discreet and considerate about it. You don't want neighbors complaining about your smoking. I have no doubt that they would charge you the fees that you initial for upon checking in if caught. One morning I woke up to 3 cruise ships docked at the terminal right across the street. What a sight that was. All wasn't perfect though. Flights start leaving the closeby airport right at 06:30 every morning which can be a bit of an unpleasant wakeup. A lot of the airport noise seems to depend on wind direction but I always noticed those early morning flight departures and the jet noise. I found all of the staff that I had dealings with to be efficient and friendly. I very much liked the deli at the base of our building. I had breakfast there a couple times which was made even better sitting outside on their patio on a warm San Diego morning. Their sandwiches are excellent. Never failed to satisfy. My only real dissatisfaction with this hotel relates to their $1.50 charge for local phone calls and $22.00 per day for parking. My rental car didn't even cost that much per day. Parking can be a real hassle if you try to use the city meters which are everywhere outside the hotel and charge 25 cents for 12 minutes which adds up. If you get a ticket for an expired meter I've been told it's over $40.00. There is a pay lot south of the hotel with an entrance off Broadway Street which charges $10.00 for up to 10 hours with no in and out privilages and served my needs a few times when I had parked overnight at the meters which kick in at 08:00 everyday expect Sunday. The rooms are adequate and very clean. Mine had a nice, new flat screen TV which my room in the north tower didn't have when I stayed there 2 years ago. The maid was most sweet and accommodating. I would definitely go back to this hotel in the future. My first two experiences at this property have left me with a positive feeling about the place and fond memories.

Reviews.Title: “Weeks Stay”
Reviews.Author: TJF0810
Reviews.Content: Great view of the harbor if you get a room on the west side. The rooms are spacious but dated. Hotel could use a remodeling in the next couple years. The staff are super nice and provide excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Alnan101
Reviews.Content: The location is great and the free shuttle to & from the airport and attractions was very helpful. Internet was also free. The only issue we had was when we checked in - she sent us to a separate building a short hike from the main hotel. It was rather remote location with no lobby and the building was old and musty. We dragged our luggage back to the front desk and told the lady we did not want to be in that building. She asked if we wanted to cancel our reservation and we told her we just wanted to be in the main hotel. She seemed annoyed but changed our room and all was fine. The hotel is close to everything, including the San Diego trolley. You can get around pretty well using the trolley with bus combination and everyone we met was very helpful telling us what bus or trolley to use. I do wish we had paid to use the Old Town Trolley. It was everywhere we went and you can hop on and off all day. It even goes to Coronado Island. We took the Ferry and then had to take a cab to the Coronado Hotel and the beach. The Old Town Trolley passed by while we were waiting for a cab. If you don't know your way around (like us) I think that is the way to go. The pedicabs are a nice way to get around at night. We met a pedicab driver close to the Ferry and he took us to the Gaslamp Quarter that evening and gave us a tour of the area on the way ... look up Mr. Ed - he's wonderful. Ed dropped us off and came back to pick us up later that evening. We stayed four nights and had a nice time. The restaurant in the hotel was reasonable. We ate dinner there two evenings when we were too tired to go elsewhere and we were pleased with the food and service.

Reviews.Title: “A view to die for !!”
Reviews.Author: arubadebi
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 5 day stay at the Holiday Inn San Diego - On the Bay...from the minute I was picked up by the airport shuttle until they were kind enough to return me to the airport my trip was almost perfect. The staff was very accommodating and the view from my room was totally amazing. I was on the 12th floor facing the bay and could not have asked for a better view. My room was always clean and I liked the way it was set up. King sized bed with a lot of storage and a huge walk in shower. The only thing that could have made this room perfect would have been a small refrigerator. I never did ask if one could have been rented as I managed to live without but it would be the only negative I could comment on. I will definitely stay there again . As a solo traveler I felt very safe at the hotel and walking along the bay during the day....I even saw seals down along the waterfront near Sea Port Village...just the perfect spot to stay without a car. The Deli down the street was a nice change and a great spot to stop for breakfast or a great salad or sandwich . As you ate you could watch all the action on the bay....very peaceful and relaxing. I would give the Holiday Inn a 10 for 10. Thanks for making my vacation a memorable one :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ivan025
Reviews.Content: Location,location, so close to train system, free shuttle to zoo. two blocks from cruise terminal, Restraunts in and near, Seaport Village a short walk. etc. The free shuttle from airport is 10 minutes max. Rooms spacious and Quiet. Love it there

Reviews.Title: “Location”
Reviews.Author: s0uthpacific
Reviews.Content: Will stay again because of close proximity to cruise ship terminal and airport, plus all the other attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and Under Expectation”
Reviews.Author: EdenW
Reviews.Content: My husband was a Gold Member of Holiday Inn when we stayed here in May. Usually, that gets us a little extra customer service as well as a discounted price. Well, we did get the discounted price (which was still too high) for a room on the Bay Side. Usually those rooms are pretty expensive since you have a great view (and it really is great, it was one of the few good things). We arrived around 1 am after driving all night and I waited in the car while my husband went to check in. I waited 30 minutes and when he finally came out, I discovered that the Concierge had been sleeping (understandable) but when woken up did not immediately help my husband check in and when he finally got around to it, in the middle he walked off and was gone for 10 minutes or so before he came back and finished. No explanation was given. We found out that the guest parking was around the corner so we had to pull back out into the road to get to the garage and then discovered that we would get a ticket and would have to pay for parking when we checked out. We finally get into our section of the hotel and call up the elevator and I thought I was going to die. It was slow, shaky and smelled bad. We got to our room and were settling in when we then realized we had no refrigerator or microwave. I was a little ticked, needless to say. Also, when we went to find the ice machine it was missing. My husband called the Front Desk and they just said each floor had one. We ended up having to go up or down a floor to get ice. Another issue was the restaurants in the area; there was a Ruth's Chris, a British pub-like restaurant and a small deli. Not a lot of options. We decided to try Ruth's Chris because I knew someone who had eaten there once and liked it. I really wish my acquaintance had mentioned how expensive it was. We each got a magnificent steak for about $48 each then we ordered Asparagus for about $9-$12. Turns out each side item is a la carte. The food really was amazing but you can only eat there if you're not on a budget. British food is good, but I wasn't really feeling it during my trip. The Deli was good, but it was just your average Deli. The only really amazing thing was our view of the Bay. We were right there next to some large cruise ships and even being on the 8th floor, we felt dwarfed. It was gorgeous, but I wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not for business travelers”
Reviews.Author: rwjones52
