Reviews.Content: First, the good news... -Good location - near the airport - easy to get to the job (Coronado) -Good Internet connection -Nice view of the San Diego bay. But the bad news far outweighs the good... -They were not ready for me despite my having a reservation and being a Platinum Priority Club member. Three other people checked in while I waited and waited and waited for the desk clerk to get it figured out. -Parking is not free; it's $22 a night. -Breakfast was not included because I use government rates. This is the first time that has **EVER** happened. -The clothes closet was in the bathroom. Even though I travel with my wife when I don't travel alone, I think it's just a bit much to juggle someone trying to get dressed while someone else is using the bathroom in the morning. -They didn't leave the bill under the door. I had to go down to the desk and physically check out. -Finally, there was no hot water on the morning of departure. I had to take a cold shower. I won't be returning to this particular Holiday Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!”
Reviews.Author: JanetWK
Reviews.Content: I utilized this hotel prior to spending a week out of town. Because of its proximity to the airport and being able to leave my car here, I thought it would be a good choice. The hotel, while clean, has not been maintained well. All the rooms are dark, have not been modernized and the trains blow their whistles at all hours of the night. Since rooms have not been sound-proofed, the noise is constant. The elevators in the tower where I stayed were slow and one was shut down entirely. When I returned from my trip I proceeded to the hotel pickup area. After waiting for 35 minutes I called the hotel to find out where the van was. They claimed they were there. The van never did come by and I had to utilize different transportation. When I complained to the concierge, all she could do was ask what room I was in and tell me that they go by every 30 minutes. By this time 55 minutes had gone by and all the vans were locked up tight and sitting in the hotel's parking lot. In addition, when I got to the hotel I asked the parking attendant if he could watch my large bag while I got my car and he said that was not his job! I would never stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Service Without A Smile!”
Reviews.Author: katy1707
Reviews.Content: My partner and I spent a total of 4 nights at this hotel this month, over 2 stays. The location of this hotel cannot be faulted, close to the airport and within easy reach of Downtown. On our second stay we paid extra for a room with a view over the Bay (12th floor), which was wonderful, although we hadn't allowed for the loud noise from the air conditioning units on the low roof opposite us which made sleep almost impossible. The hotel also provides a really useful free shuttle bus service between the airport and a few other key tourist locations, like the zoo, which runs regularly. There were a few silly ommissions such as milk to go with the coffee in the room, another really useful facility by the way. And long waits for the elevators which are under repair. Unfortunately, our dissatisfaction lay with the surly and curt staff that we encountered on both stays. On the first occasion when we asked if the concierge had a local map, without a word he slapped one on the counter and turned his back on us before we could speak, and started a conversation with another guest. Any thoughts of asking for help were put to bed and we moved on. We pointed out that our bill included 2 days of the valet service instead of 1 (an expensive service at $28 per day), the emotionless Receptionist fumbled with her keyboard for a good five minutes in complete silence before printing of a new bill and leaving it on the counter - an apology was clearly out of the question. When we asked if we could keep our room for one extra hour beyond check out. The same Receptionist didn't consult with anyone or check her screen even, the answer was simply "no, that's not possible". After spending 4 reasonably expensive nights at the hotel and entertaining friends and family within the hotel restaurants, I didn't feel that one extra hour was a lot to ask for, and it would have made our transfer to the airport that much more comfortable as we could have used the time available in a more relaxed fashion. There was also an occasion when I stood infront of 2 chatting receptionists for about 2 minutes, waiting to ask a question, not once did they acknowledge me, look at me or of course stop talking. I moved to another counter to be served. What makes me laugh about all of this is that on check in they insist on thanking you for being a member of their Preferred Client scheme, but then after this you're on your own and nothing backs this up. On this same trip we stayed in several other hotels in California and received outstanding service from genuinely helpful staff. I nearly forgot, I don't like to complain after the event, so prior to check out I rang to speak to the Duty Manager to let her know what had gone on. I was assured she would call me back in 20 minutes. 3 hours later we checked out without any return call.

Reviews.Title: “OK- elevators were a pain!”
Reviews.Author: roadtripper10
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with 3 other colleagues. The prices we got were highly variable despite all booking under AAA discount. The airport shuttle: when I got in and got my luggage I called the hotel to get the shuttle. I was told they came every 1/2 hour so I waited in the designated place. The shuttle wizzed right by without stopping. I called the hotel and she sent the driver back. He said, "There was no one there." Huh? really? There were people standing all over by the curb at the designated hotel curtesey van place. The check in was fine. The lobby is clean, but spartan. The restaurant was good- had outdoor seating that we took advantage of. The room was good. Smaller room with pretty good use of space. Bathroom small with shower only- no tub. Hotel is older- but in good repair. My biggest complaint would have to be the elevators. There are 14 floors and three elevators. One was out of service. the glass elevator can only be called from the ground floor- leaving ONE to service the entire hotel when calling from your floor. Also, there seemed to be some sort of glitch because they stopped at essentially every floor even when no one was there calling for it (not once, not twice, all the time!). I think that the rate descrepency bothers me the most- more than $50/night in variance among our party of 4. I think that is a really high variance. I called the hotel and left a message, but as of yet the call has not been returned. The restaurant across the street was great Anthony's- fish place. Internet was free and was reliable. The "business center" was one computer and there was a charge of 6 or 7 dollars to use it. Pool was warm, exercise room was pretty big and had lots of equipment.

Reviews.Title: “Bad service,yet good location”
Reviews.Author: danece
Reviews.Content: With coin laundry but without coin exchange?? when asked the front desk about coin exchange , I got a contemptous look . Old building with great shuttles to zoo and airport in good location is the only benefit. Wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Service - Just Needs A "Makeover"”
Reviews.Author: LBW1795
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here the weekend of 09/09/11 - 09/12/11. The view of the bay from our 10th story room was fabulous. There is a Ruth's Chris steakhouse located on site, the "Elephant & Castle" in-house restaurant was very good indeed & the Anthony's Fish Grotto across the street was equally tasty. U.S.S. Midway, Maritime Museum, & Seaport Village are all within very easy walking distance - Little Itay & the Gas Lamp Districts only a bit further stretch. Hotel staff were all very friendly. That said - this place must date from the early 1960's and some very tired elevators are a testament to that along with smallish rooms and bathrooms. The decor is dated and a bit shabby. With an update, I'd rate this place another star and would still recommend it to other travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Great location before a cruise!”
Reviews.Author: Jabbers
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Holiday Inn on the Bay in San Diego a number of times. The hotel itself is your standard Holiday Inn fare. The Pub/ Restaurant has indoor and outdoor dining, which is good and convenient. The hotel is very busy with cruise travelers and it is no wonder! You can literally roll your luggage across the street and you are at the cruise check-in! This is a perfect before cruise hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great View”
Reviews.Author: jozsasz
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very good value as it has amazing view on both sides. We had an oceanfront room and even though the carriers were not in (they do add a lot to the view) while we were there we really enjoyed the sight. The staff was very friendly and helpful: we arrived at the time of the San Diego marathon and all rooms were full by the time we arrived, but next day they arranged a high floor room for us. Minor drawbacks: In overall the hotel is not the newest. I would not say it is rundown, but looks like every doorknob could tell a story. The restaurants closed quite early, so we had to go somewhere else for a drink. The coffee place is actually bad for European standards, but that is not uncommon in the states...

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and nasty”
Reviews.Author: ChloeOu
Reviews.Content: It's a budget hotel but this one is exceptionally bad. No safe , no fridge and no ice bucket in the rooms. It's old and run down, from door locks to the lift, everything is falling apart. If you're on the side that's facing town then expect none stop train and traffic noise all night long. Lots of young party goers who cant afford a proper hotel in town stay here. They come in and out of the rooms in the middle of the night and you can hear every word they say because of the paper thine walls. On the plus side, they offer free shuttle to the zoo, Gaslamp District and the airport. They also have free wifi which is very handy I have to say. But overall it's half a star at best. For the same price stay at the Hilton Gaslamp District, save yourself trouble from dealing with unhappy staff and slow moving queues at the lobby, and to have a good night sleep with real pillows.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful view of the bay”
Reviews.Author: travelcritic65
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed over Labor Day Weekend. We stayed in a room with city view on the 12th floor. During the third night there, around 9:30 p.m., we heard a commotion in the room two doors down. One man was yelling "Get out of my room!" and slammed the door several times. It continued and after the third incident hotel security was called. Two men opened the door to the couple's room staying two doors down three times! The couple inquired how the man could open the door and questioned the security there. Police were called by the couple, not hotel staff. After hearing the story from the couple, my daughter and I went to the hotel desk and asked to be moved. The doors in the hotel room do not have deadbolts but only locks and hookbars. We were moved to the tenth floor with a bay view. When we opened the door, the sliding glass door was wide open. The room smelled like cigarette smoke. We went back to the front desk and again asked for another room. We were given a room in the front building, fourth floor next to the elevator. The door to the slidling glass was unlocked in this room. This room was definately a step down. The deck was small with standing room only. The curtains and carpet were dirty. All during the night, we heard the elevator run. We did not sleep for two nights. When I asked the night staff how someone could open a door three times without a hotel key, she said the couple must not have had the door shut all the way. Hmmm... three times? Upside: The hotel is located right on the bay, walking distance to Sea Port Village, the Ferry, and downtown. It has breathtaking views of the bay. The hotel has shuttle to the zoo, Horton Plaza, Sea Port Village and the airport. The pool is clean and has nice deck area, good exercise area and the restaurant has good food.

Reviews.Title: “Great Pre-Cruise Hotel”
Reviews.Author: whistlerinseptember
Reviews.Content: We chose the Holiday Inn on the Bay in San Diego for our pre-cruise stay because of location and price. Location is excellent as it is not more than a 10 minute drive from the airport and the hotel is directly across the street from B Street Cruise Ship Terminal, allowing us to roll our luggage across the street and line up for embarking. Our arrival at the hotel was a couple of hours earlier than check-in but our room was ready which was nice. The room we had was a bay-view room with a large sliding glass door that lead onto a good sized balcony over looking the embarkado or bay area of San Diego, with views of the airport, and beautiful sunsets in the evenings. The room was very spacious and clean, not what I would consider high end, but a comfortable bed and adequate for the 2 days that we were there. The elevators in our building - the South Tower (there are 3 separate buildings that comprise this hotel) were slow and sometimes stopped at a floor that we had not chosen, which was odd! The hotel has a great gift shop, quite large, and we were pleased to see that they also had a nice selection of wines to choose from. We noticed that there are not a lot of convenience stores in the area of the hotel, so it was nice having the convenience of the shop that has a large range of goods from clothing, food /snack items to souveniers. We really enjoyed having meals at the Elephant & Castle Restaurant which is part of the hotel. Service was very good, excellent waiter who even remembered which wine we had ordered the night before! The food was high quality, loved the quesidillas and the house salad dressing. The restaurant also has an outdoor patio in front. Another plus for the location of the hotel is that the marine museum is also right there across the street, and a Hop on Hop off bus stop if you want to see the sights. Having said that, the hotel is on a main street and one of the nights we were there, a party event was going on across the street in one of the buildings on the water and we could hear the bass, if we had the sliding door open. The staff at the hotel were helpful in providing maps and information regarding transit and locations available for touring on our own. All in all we had a wonderful time there and would most definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic views of san diego bay”
Reviews.Author: tg2151
Reviews.Content: The service was great. The room was very clean and spacious. The bay views were spectacular and worth the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Just So So”
Reviews.Author: carol-in-colorado22
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel August 26 through August 30. The good points: across the street from the bay - great view! The restaurant in the hotel was good - food was always fresh and hot. Easy to walk most places and can catch the ferry to Coronado. The not so good: the rooms are dated, no refridgerator or microwave. Ice machine didn't work the entire time, and the same with one of the elevators (a problem with a 15 story hotel). The homeless problem is huge, and they camp close to the hotel - the smell of urine in the neighborhood was awful. (Don't get me wrong, I feel for them, but just letting you know the situation.) Also, I wouldn't rent a car if I was staying here again - too much for parking and didn't really need it. For the price I paid and the condition of the hotel, I'm not sure I would go back to this property. The staff was very nice, but I could have stayed a little further away for a lot less.

Reviews.Title: “Parking Costs Will Get You...”
Reviews.Author: RLLTraveler
Reviews.Content: Not a bad hotel at all -- a few minor grumbles, but the biggest issue is the parking cost. Even if you're a hotel guest, you're charged $22 per day, which even in San Diego is high. The parking was never full either, so I'm not sure how they justify that amount. The rooms were nice (though the carpet was a bit worn). The bathroom was clean and well-stocked with towels -- though they were skimpy with one little shampoo/soap/lotion bottle (tough for two people). Staff were courteous and attentive and sped us through check-in (and we checked-out by phone), though we didn't interact all that much during the stay. There was a drainage leak of some sort overnight and they sent up a technician to review/diagnose, but as we were checking out that morning it wasn't a big issue. Location is near the marina/bay as advertised, though you'd have to make sure you drive even to the Gaslamp area. Easy access to the various freeways. Balcony was nice. Elevators were a bit slow and always jam-packed, but not a major issue. Restaurants around and in the hotel are okay, but I'd encourage you to indulge in something downtown instead.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Escape224
Reviews.Content: Had stayed here on a travel agent famil somw years ago, so was keen to return as my experience back then was great. Unfortunately, not so much this visit. Porbably the most disappointing part of the stay was the staff. Front desk and concierge were very much there just to do their job and nothing more. I felt like "just another guest". Property is tired and in need of renovation. Had to move rooms as we were woken by the drone of the elevater at 4am each morning and the bath would not drain during showering and bed was uncomfortable. A positive is it's location for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: staley77
Reviews.Content: We had the best time here. Best hotel ever. We got room 1466, it was amazing. The city view was breathtaking! It was the last room on the corner so you could also see the bay view from the balcony. The rooms were comfortable and quiet. I'm a light sleeper to, and I didn't hear the trains, planes and city noise at night. On the balcony yes, not so much in the room. Pool was nice, hotel staff was great. The rooms were cleaned daily, super clean! I want to stay here again. Pool was nice. Shuttle service was excellent. Cabs were always waiting for you. I would recommend going to visit the Hotel Del Coronado. The hotel is breathtaking and the beach is amazing! Also recommend going to Sea World. It's truly amazing. It was the best vacation ever!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - Opposite the Marina”
Reviews.Author: strawmato
Reviews.Content: A really nice hotel. First hotel on a tour and was a good start. Arrived late at night (10pm) and wanted some food.Went the pub in the lobby area and the food there was good. The location is quiet and just across the road from the USS Midaway Museum. Shop in the lobby was good and reasonably priced for being in a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel but terrible housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: Eddie P
Reviews.Content: We celebrated our high school reunion in this hotel and it was well attended by almost 400 people. left my brand new La Coste T-shirt in room 857 and it disappeared! Informed the front desk and they told me "they'll wait until housekeeping turns it in to the lost and found". I am now back in Canada and I am still waiting for them to let me know if they found my shirt! If the maid took a liking on my shirt, would she still turn it in to the "lost and found"? I'd say "to hell with your hotel"!

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME JULY 4TH VIEW OF THE BAY!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: California Sun
Reviews.Content: I am always EXCITED when I get a great room with a view in California. We were bayside so we saw all the AWESOME fireworks all over the place. We ate at Ruth Chris next door, had drinks in the bar inside the hotel. Breakfast outside the next day. The staff waited on us hand and foot. The hotel is huge! I have stayed at other hotels in the area and for $200 bucks a night I felt like I got a great deal on a holiday to boot!!! Great view and right smack in the middle of all the fun. Lot's of things to do just right across the street with food and tourist attractions, Cruises of the bay, the navel ship thats retired you can tour, all kinds of stuff up and down the street. Take a taxi to the end if you can't walk it all. We had a BLAST!

Reviews.Title: “very well located”
Reviews.Author: Tarja-n18
Reviews.Content: Hotel located close to beach and that's the greatest advantage of this place. The staff is kind but did not make any impression on us. We felt like only next person to check in and that's it so if you want to feel more like a guest that a next client just look for another place. Very comfortable beds. Hotel generally fine but nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, but a bit dated”
Reviews.Author: Desertmadam
Reviews.Content: I found the location pretty handy as I had limited time in San Diego and being close to the airport and Trolley Tours terminal was handy for me. Rooms are a bit dated but clean and had no problems. In retrospect, I probably would have stayed in Coronado or La Jolla rather than downtown SD, but can't blame the hotel for that. All in all, fair, but I think there are better options available.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!!!!”
Reviews.Author: gcward2009
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at your hotel several times over the last decade. We keep coming back because everyone is sooooo accomodating, friendly, and pleasant. You have ALWAYS done your best to provide the room location that we prefer. Can't say enough of how pleasant all of our stays have been!

Reviews.Title: “Good location but not much more. Definitely won't be back.”
Reviews.Author: friendlytraveler35
Reviews.Content: Went to the hotel for a family vacation but was very dissapointed. We got a room in the back of the hotel that was a block or two from a train. The noise from the train made it extremely hard to sleep. The room was very tiny and the beds were also very small. The bathroom didn't have a bathtub which was also dissapointing because having children you would want a bathtub (especially after a day at the beach) The door to the bathroom was a sliding clear door that didn't lock and also let in light to the room. (also not a plus when you have children). After the first night of no sleep we asked the front desk if there were any other rooms available without the noise and possibly larger beds. They told us that we would have to pay $40 extra dollars a night and the beds would be the same. How's that for customer service?

Reviews.Title: “really great location!”
Reviews.Author: perf69
Reviews.Content: okay for price. the room was nice and quiet. beds were really small, didn't have 1-king available. the location was perfect. harbor drive has everything, restaurants along bay, seaport village, tours and close to downtown. went to wedding in balboa park and was conveniently close. would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Comicon 2011”
Reviews.Author: Time4
Reviews.Content: We recently attended the over crowed ComicCon Convention in San Diego. We booked the Holiday Inn On the Bay San Diego back in September 2010. The hotel is fairly close to the Center but a little farther than the website makes it sounds. Beds could use to be replaced. The view was fantastic. The valet out front could have been a little more friendly. Would definitely stay at this hotel again but pass on Comicon.

Reviews.Title: “I hate to write a negative review but....”
Reviews.Author: Journeystravel_11
Reviews.Content: This place was bad. Upon arrival, it started out with learning my reservation was cancelled due to my credit card being stolen and my card company cancelling the account. They gave away my room because I had a late arrival and said now they only had a "parlor room" available. Apparently that means there is only a pull-out couch and no real bed. Since I only had 5 hours to sleep before heading back to the airport, I took it. Wow, was it bad. Lumpiest mattress ever, very loud hotel...between the airport noise, street noise, and slamming of doors in the hall, no sleep! Place was dirty. And needless to say, they didn't follow through with the 4:30am wake up call I requested (but with all the other issues, I didn't sleep). The front desk clerk made me pay MORE than my original room because now she said I was a walk in (even though she could see they just cancelled my reservation made months before). Once seeing how bad the room was I did call the Manager who did reduce the rate to my original rate (but frankly, I shouldn't have had to pay for the terrible room without a real bed!!) Only good thing I can say is that the shuttle service was timely!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: itsbrown
Reviews.Content: Small rooms, old single pane Windows, noise from the street as well as room above made it really hard to sleep. although the Pub next door offered free food for kids, we did not like the food. We checked out a day early.

Reviews.Title: “will not be back”
Reviews.Author: socaltwo
Reviews.Content: As a Priority Club member I am supposed to get priority checkin (right!) but they had long slow lines in aFriday afternoon. Nice guy waited on me but did not know how to issue the "gas card" that was part of my package. We wer eon 7th floor but inside the elevator is showed "6". Clothes closet is in the bathroom and the bathroom door is a glass slider, very wierd. Room was City view and still $239 per night but was way too noisy from the train and trolly noises, especially the damn crossing signal bell that went off every 15 minutes. A/C in room was either on or off, as if the thermostat did not work. Back to room Saturday afternmoon and the "key:"did not work. Sunday morning bill under the door included parking but was supposed to be free in our package. Girl at news stand was not happy that I was giving her a $20 for an 84 cent newspaper, sorry ! Ttried the restaurant on Friday night but thetywere very short of help. Location is good for Midway, Star of India, etc. About a mile walk to end of Seaport Village (we loved it , especially after dininer there on Saturday but may be too long for many (like those who want the space closest to the front door of the grocery store). Guess I will stay at a Hilton next time.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel horribly overbooked for Comic-Con 2011 - Do not book rooms here”
Reviews.Author: ChuckB_042
Reviews.Content: We had confirmed reservations for 2 rooms (with a paid night's deposit) at this hotel for Comic-Con 2011. We even got an email from Travel Planners confirming our reservations a few days before. We got to the hotel early at 11:00 AM and tried to check in. The desk clerk said our rooms were not yet available, but to come back after 3:00 PM. He even offered to block our rooms together so we would be close to each other. When we returned at 3:00 PM, we were informed that our reservation had been transferred to the Kona Kai resort on shelter island. No reason was given, but we noticed other people at the check in desk being told the same thing. The manager told us that they 'randomly' chose which people would be bumped. They also told us that the Kona Kai resort was only 'about a mile' away, which was an outright lie. It was at least 4-5 miles away, and the directions they gave us were wrong to boot. During our stay at Kona Kai, we met several other folks who were there for Comic-Con, and every one of them said they had been bumped from the Holiday Inn as well. How can the Holiday Inn overbook that badly on a weekend they know they are going to be sold out? How can they bump people who have a prepaid room deposit? Why did the desk clerk not tell us that we were being bumped when we first tried to check in at 11:00 AM? We had stayed at this hotel our last several trips to Comic-Con, but we will not be trying to book a room here in the future, and I will hesitate to book a room at any Holiday Inn location based on this experience.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away, customer service is awful!”
Reviews.Author: MattnBrandi
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Holiday In San Diego-On the Bay with three colleagues including our CEO and was absolutelety shocked about the mismanagement and lack of customer service at check-in. Upon arrival, it appeared that the front desk staff were overstressed and incompetent. After checking in, each of us went to our rooms where we later realized three out of the four of us had been assigned to a room which already had been assigned to other individuals. The front desk was notified upon entry to the room and the issue was not resolved until each of us personally went down to the front desk to voice concern. From the beginning there was no apology, and we were assured that our rooms would be reassigned without an issue. One member of my party was assigned to three different rooms prior to arriving in the room he would be finally assigned too. After getting resolution for him, an apology was offered and the offer of covering our parking was made. To make matters worse, the parking fee showed up on one of our bills and when it was discussed the next day with the front desk staff, the clerk had the audacity to say "what makes you think you should receive free parking?" Avoid this property, spend a couple dollars more and stay in the Gas Lamp district.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but....”
Reviews.Author: Jbhes
Reviews.Content: We came on the train to San Diego so the Holiday Inn was very convenient to the train station, the water front, Little Italy and downtown. The deli in front had really good breakfasts. The hotel is average but the location is perfect. This would make a good location for a pre/post cruise stay because it is just across the street from the cruise ship terminal.

Reviews.Title: “Bad service and not what they advertise”
Reviews.Author: debjean68
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for our sons graduation of Marine boot camp and this Hotel was terrible, the people were rude to us and the rooms had nothing they said they had. the rooms werent clean and the shower was terrible ( no water pressure and no tub). wouldnt recommend to anyone and will not go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Old and decrepit”
Reviews.Author: crznhwy1_11
Reviews.Content: It's too bad this hotel is so old and decrepit. It has an incredible location, but is falling apart. Taking the elevator was an adventure each time. I never knew if I'd make it or not, the way it shook and shuddered. The HVAC is loud and made the room vibrate. The wallpaper is peeling off of the walls. I must say it was clean though. The restaurant has a limited menu of basically bar food. The staff was begrudgingly helpful. This place needs a total remodel to make it as nice as its location.

Reviews.Title: “Glad it was only for 1 night...”
Reviews.Author: kmorgan77
Reviews.Content: Started off having to run in and ask where the Valet Attendant was, while my husband waited in the car. He finally came out about 2-3 minutes later. THEN we waited at front desk to check-in for almost 5 minutes and not even acknowledged by woman there - then she just walked away! Waited another couple of minutes until another woman came back (the one that had to find the Valet for me) and checked us in. We drag our luggage to the South Tower and get in an elevator that was barely stable - which I also later got STUCK IN, and hear from two other guests they had been stuck in over the last 2 days! Lucky us, we got stuck with a room directly across from the ice machine - which through the paper thin door I hear people at dispensing ice regularly all night long... then lucky me - go downstairs, try to come back up and the elevator will not stop at the 3rd floor! So I have to ride up with the other people in the car to the 7th floor and try to take the stairs down, only to have every floor locked and dropped back outside at the bottom!!! Finally found a service elevator and used that from then on... Bed was tolerable, bathroom was small and cramped, but yeah for free WiFi. Ooohhh - and the train, do NOT stay here if you are a light sleeper (thank God I had my ear plugs with me), as you WILL hear the train, a LOT!! ONLY plus is location, we happened to stay here on July 4th to see the Fireworks, and were able to walk just outside of hotel and had a great view...but SO glad we were only there for one night! P.S. just in case you are a smoker - you can NOT smoke on your balcony (which is the only reason I got a balcony room), or they will charge you a $150 fine!

Reviews.Title: “Another one - fit for purpose”
Reviews.Author: t0mt0r
Reviews.Content: I went to San Diego to attend the Conference and this was one of the recommended hotels for delegates. I think the title of my revue says it all: clean rooms of good size, quite a few restaurants around (in side and off side), central location close to business district and airport. Overall really good choice for a short, business stay.

Reviews.Title: “Worth it”
Reviews.Author: ELPScorch
Reviews.Content: Reluctant to stay after reading reviews but we are glad we stayed there. Great view, friendly staff (let us check in at 10:30a.m.),nice room. Not sure what all the fuss was about with the other reviews and the pool was nice and warm. Pros: View (got to see aircraft carrier (#70) come into bay, rooms, staff Cons: Door in room to bathroom has fogged glass (but you can still see shadows), doesn't lock Repairs in other rooms started at 8:00a.m, could hear drilling and hammering..(they could have waited a little longer to start work). Parking (22.00 a day), but it was nice to come in and out and not have to feed the meter. Staff at restaurant wasn't help full, they just looked at us when we walked up, after telling them we wanted take out they pointed out where the take out menus were and never came back..so we left and went to Denny's. Would stay again...

Reviews.Title: “One of the best stays of our holiday”
Reviews.Author: corbie33
Reviews.Content: My wife and I thoroughly enjoy our stay here. The room was very plesant and the beautifull views out over the bay. The Elephant & Castle restaurant food was great. Cameron one of the waiters was extremely helpful and nothing was to much trouble. By the third night he would see us coming and have our drinks at our table by the time we were sitting down. We would thoroughly recommend the Holiday Inn on the Bay to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good trip, great views”
Reviews.Author: Tripreviewer08
Reviews.Content: Overall what makes this hotel great is its location. If you pay a little extra you can get a bayside view, and I would recommend that you do so because it is worth it. The Elephant and Castle and Hazelwood Cafe are both good places to get something to eat. It is within walking distance to many great restaurants and a cute shopping area called the seaport village. They provide shuttles to the airport, the seaport village and zoo. Taxi's are always waiting out front if you want to go to Sea World or anywhere else out of walking range. The pictures provided on the website are a little misleading, which we have all come to expect after staying in many hotels over the years. Most of the carpeting I saw in both of our rooms, in the hall and in the elevators had obvious water/soda stains. The bed, walls, and curtains in our rooms were not nearly as colorful as advertised on their site (see pictures below). However, the bathrooms were just re-done and look terrific! Our rooms were cleaned without anything stolen or messed with. All staff, including the maids, were nice and helpful. Overall, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable and good location”
Reviews.Author: stc33Usa
Reviews.Content: I got this thru Holiday Inn. Benita Skalada helped me book the room. On facebook they were offering 20% off and I couldn't get it to work so she and I emailed out and back repeatedly until she got it fixed. Kudos to her and her customer service. She was fantastic and it was easily remedied. CUstomer service upon arrival was great too. They were friendly and helpful with our question. I saw a lot of pilots and flight attendants, so I assume there is a deal with them to stay there on layovers. Anyway, great location. WE got a balcony room overlooking bay which i HIGHLY recommend. We didn't experience any noise problems. Actually I never even saw anyone else on our floor when coming and going. Evertime we encountered a staff member in hallway or elevator, they asked if we needed anything and said " Have a great day etc...". Rooms were roomy and loved balcony!! Comfy bed and overall a good experience. Would recommend for sightseeing visitors to SD. Not a luxury hotel so keep that in mind. Ate at restaurant downstairs. It was decent and ok priced for that kind of place in that area. WE ate at Ruth's Chris due at the hotel. VERY VERY good and FANTASTIC food!! Of course pricey, but all of them are. We had gift certificate but our total meal was $130. We had 2 entrees,2 sides, 4 drinks and 1 dessert. So not bad really. Well worth it

Reviews.Title: “Try to go somewhere Else”
Reviews.Author: jenjes2229
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately this is probably the worst hotel to stay at. Its very outdated. The restroom has a see thru door therefore you can see, hear them using restroom or taking a shower. Pool was very small. parking was good but overpriced. No microwave in bedroom. I would highly recommend you staying somewhere else! Location was great.

Reviews.Title: “treated badly”
Reviews.Author: travelforfun0000
Reviews.Content: I booked 3 rooms Priceline, We we checked in at 11:30 pm. They said all they had were rooms with single size beds. Priceline says that all rooms are with beds for 2 adults. I called Priceline they offered me a refund or get me a room at the priceI paid for the rooms at the Holiday Inn on the bay. 11:30 at night that meant a 1 star hotel. The hotel staff kept saying "you booked through Priceline and that's what you get." They had my prepaid money and did not care. That morning we left the hotel and I get a call from my son saying they charged him for the room. I had to go back to the hotel and straighten it out.

Reviews.Title: “A bit misleading but not a bad stay”
Reviews.Author: natedogg03
Reviews.Content: Well photoshop can work wonders, we stayed at the Holiday Inn San Diego 'On the Bay' because well we thought it was on the bay. I would say that is a bit misleading, while it was by the bay it was not on the bay at least from my perspective. That said it wasn't a bad stay for the first half of our trip. We got in later than expected and the staff was helpful in getting us in and letting us know where to find some tasty grub and letting us know where to avoid as a 'bad' area of town. One note the airport pick up guy wigged us out a little, I felt like I had stolen the queens jewels when we asked us to 'step away from the bags'...they were our bags, whatever. Alot of people complained about the noise here, we did notice it had thin walls and slept every night with the air conditioning fan on blast to cover it up. All in all not a bad place to stay if you plan to visit the zoo or maritime museum or the USS Midway. I would not however honey moon here.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and will recommend”
Reviews.Author: Trina_P
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a two-day pre-cruise site seeing trip. Staying at the hotel was myself, my husband and his service dog. We are both in wheelchairs and found the hotel to be VERY wheelchair accessible for our needs. Our room had a bathtub, large turnaround area in the bathroom area and plenty of well-placed grab bars. The sink/vanity and mirror were just outside the bathroom door. This was very handy for us both getting ready at the same time. The height of the bed was perfect for transferring in and out of our wheelchairs. The hotel also offers a courtesy shuttle which is equipped with a lift. There were plenty of grassy areas just outside the door for the service dog. Coming into the room we were pleasantly surprised to be placed on the bayside where we had a beatiful view. I also was not expecting the wonderful balcony which was large enough for my wheelchair to roll completely outside. The hotel itself has a bright sunny exterior color which fit perfectly on the bay environment. Interiror, its public areas and hallways do need a bit of sprucing up and cleaning. Nothing major and certainly nothing that would keep me from recommending it to anyone. Mainly I just remember ceiling tiles and vents being dirty and the hallways having a slight musty smell. Nothing a good cleaning and air freshener system would not cure. The rest of the hotel was spotless. Every employee we encountered was nothing but top notch and went out of their way to help. The first person we encountered was a very nice gentlemen who, after bringing our luggage, went as far as to offer my husband's service dog a fresh bowl of water and kept asking if anyting at all was needed. Shuttle drivers-nothing but helpful and very pleasant. Front desk employees were friendly and attended to the few requests we had with promptness. We used the shuttle to go to and from the airport and the zoo. Both easy and pleasant experiences. We ate our first night at Anthony's, a fish place just across the street. There is an outdoor area as well as a sitdown indoor area. We ate outdoors. Very reasonably priced. Good fresh seafood. We ate breakfast on the last morning at a deli just down the sidewalk. It was a full service breakfast with inside as well as outdoor seating. Again good food and very reasonably priced. Although it is the only meal we ate there, we noticed they did have a large menu offering all sort of deli sandwiches. Would definitely eat there again for a quick bite. The purpose of our trip was a cruise. This hotel is directly across from the pier where the ship was docked. Upon waking, the cruise ship was the first thing we saw when we opened the curtains. We spent both evenings leisurely strolling the bay. There are a couple ship museums to tour and several local vendors set up along the bay area. I would feel comfortable recommending this hotel to anyone I know without hesitation. Its location and staff made it a great memorable stay in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and will come back.”
Reviews.Author: lizzyrazzi
Reviews.Content: This was our thrid time here. Love the view of the bay. Able to get early check-in and room was very clean. Close to airport & did not wait long at airport for shuttle. Hotel has a shuttle to a few places but did not use it this time. They did charge an extra day of parking which I am sure will be taken care of. Close to Midway and love walking along the bay. Staff was friendly and once again enjoyed our stay and we will be back. Will not eat at Rest. that is attached, did not enjoy it at all last year. We stayed for 4 nights. Location is great for us. Close to zoo, Seaport Village, Point Loma, Midway. The Star of India is right there. We did eat at Anthonys, the Fish Market and Pardo's, and at The Del Corando.. All wonderful. Looks like they are re-doing the Port so it will be a great hotel for pre-crusing. That is how we first stayed here, we are enjoying coming back every year now to this Holiday Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Train, boats and planes”
Reviews.Author: MikeE0
Reviews.Content: If you like the sound of trains, boats and planes when you are trying to sleep then this is the place for you. The hotel is in a perfect location for local transport, good eateries and seafront views. The breakfast offered (costing $10) in the Elephant and Castle leaves something to be desired compared with other American breakfast food outlets. The eggs were great but the bacon and fried potatoes were cold and possibly cooked about 2 hours previous. We had to request a reheating of the food.

Reviews.Title: “Customer service is not the best. Worst parking area ever!”
Reviews.Author: maxandtigermommy
Reviews.Content: We called a week prior to check in to ask for a early check in, they told me no problem on the phone. We arrived at the hotel at 9 AM and they told me we could not check in until 3 PM. I explained that I called previously the lady at the front desk didn't seem to care. We came back at 3 to a huge line of people, 45 minutes later we were checked in. The front desk person pointed to where we will be staying ... NOT even close to where our room was. We had to haul our baggage across the entire hotel. The room was ok, it was clean, it could use a remodel. The bed was very hard and the water pressure was awful. The view from our room was fantastic though! We went out for dinner and when we came back the key to the room did not work. We had to go back down to the front desk to have this corrected. It was not very convientant and we were pretty tired from the long drive and what not. Once we got into the room the TV would not work. It kept saying that there was no connection. After turning it on and off several times we got it to work. This happened everytime we turned the TV on. I also have to tell you about the parking. It is awful! The spaces are on top of each other. There are not enough parking spaces for 1/2 of the hotel, you have to drive around and around and around looking for a space that hopefully your car can fit in and get that you can out of your car. You pay $22 per day for this. They would really use more parking for this hotel. Our experiance was not horrible but I will definately think twice before staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Another visit to San Diego - another visit to the Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: JanokBritishColumbia
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here before but its the first place that comes to mind when we decide on another visit to one of our favorite cities. Its so convenient to be picked up at the airport in their shuttle. When we were leaving at 6:15am they took us to the train station. We find the location very convenient - we used public transportation and had no problem going to Old Town, La Jolla, Balboa Park and a baseball game at Petco. It's also close to Anthony's Fish Grotto which is always a must when we visit San Diego. Not so fussy on the doors going into the bathroom but since it is just the two of us its not a big deal. It would have been a problem when our kids were vacationing with us a few years ago. Had a dinner and a couple of breakfasts at the Elephant & Castle and they were all very good. We love San Diego and the Holiday Inn just seems to make the vacation perfect.

Reviews.Title: “If you can get a bayfront room - stay here. If not, stay elsewhere.”
Reviews.Author: buckeye97
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 3 days in a bayfront room. The hotel itself is quite average and showing it's age a little. But, and this is a big but, the view from a bayfront room with the large balcony is more than worth it. I believe this is the only hotel in the downtown SD area where you can sit in a hotel room balcony this close to the bay. It was great waking up, opening the curtains, and having the big bay there to stare at. Rest of the hotel is average at best - some stained carpets, wierd running elevators as previously mentioned, etc.. Pool area was pretty good - deep 8 ft pool that was nicely heated. Not sure about noises others talked about - I slept like a rock for 3 nights, but never turned on the AC/heat, as the outdoor temp was great

Reviews.Title: “Good location for pre-cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: bart_1963
Reviews.Content: Made the reservation online, requesting a harbour view, called the hotel directly to confirm this, and was put through to a world wide reservation centre. Arrived in the afternoon, check in was a breeze, but my 12th floor room was on the back of the building, no harbour view. Not a big deal, but I had explained that I was cruising the following day, and would like a harbour view. The hotel is large, and they were in the process of changing over old TV to new flat screen LED TV's. When I turned it on around 8, it didn't work, went down to the front desk, told them it wasn't working, they sent a maintenance man to meet me back at my room, who quickly discovered that the data cable wasn't connected. The room was clean, ample products in the washroom. Standard Holiday Inn, I choose the hotel because of the location, as you can see from one of the pictures it really is across the street from the cruise terminal, other than that, San Diego has much better hotels, at better prices. The hotel is directly in front of the main trail terminal, with a room on the back of the hotel, the nose from the trains will keep most people awake.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: Thedailysave
Reviews.Content: I believe the property is very clean, well put together. You have almost 600 guest rooms, many with a nice city view or bay view. Location is great with Seaport Village, Star of India, Embarcadero, Hornblower and a lot of activity. Pool is nice too.

Reviews.Title: “Don't get sucked in by the location”
Reviews.Author: thealbertaguy
Reviews.Content: Wow. I thought to myself "How bad could it be?" It was "Holiday Inn" after all. You know, I'm not one to complain very often and this is also my first review of any hotel. I thought I owed it to everyone out there trying to decide what to do because I'd actually feel guilty if I didn't. With that said, here goes. I'm from Alberta, Canada and we were taken a Cruise out from San Diego and flew in a few days prior and we needed to stay somewhere for a day after the cruise was over. It seemed like a logical choice being right across the street from where the ship ports. We got into our room on the 8th floor in the South Tower. The room was clean but seemed to have gone through much wear and tear. No big Deal. Just not really nice in my opinion. (i.e. scratches and chips on the furniture, carpets in so-so shape, old t.v.'s, poorly conditioned sitting chairs etc. etc.) The Next thing, which everyone check's out is the bed. The bed was very uncomfortable, lumpy, and the pillows weren't that great and seemed somewhat small for a King. If you are someone who needs a comfortable sleep, I would think twice. Onward. It was rather hot the first day in and the next thing we did was turn on the Air Conditioner. It turned on and hot air came out. We gave it about 15 minutes and still only hot air blowing out. We called the front desk and the guy came out and said it needed to be turned on. He turned it on and the Air Conditioner started to work. "Great" we thought.. Until later that night we heard a "drip, drip, drip" in a pool on the floor. We called up the Front Desk a second time. They sent the maintenance guy again. He said, "Oh, this one has had issues and it's actually been draining in a "temporary bucket" and the bucket is now over flowing". I'm going "peachy". So, he goes an empties the bucket of water and on we go with the night. Well, we start to get to sleep around 11pm on our not so comfortable bed and all of a sudden we hear a "drip, drip drip" again in double time drips. I'm a patient guy but this time I'm just a little bit cranky and they gave us a choice to move rooms. We did of course. We moved to the North Tower and the air conditioner worked but the bed still sucked. We went on the cruise. Came Back and got our room again. This time on the 7th floor in the South Tower again. Bed was STILL was not very comfortable for the third time.. The air conditioner worked, which we didn't need because it was a cooler night but we just need to make the night. I REALLY wanted to sleep in because of all the days were doing excursions on our cruise we stayed really busy and were up early for one reason or another. Well, we got into bed, turned off the t.v. and then realized you could hear water running through the walls from somewhere. It wasn't just a little bit and it wasn't someone just turning on the tap or something. This was constant from the time we went to bed to the time we got up in the morning. I stayed in the room because I thought it would go off soon enough and it kept on waking me up all night. I was so bitter the next morning. I didn't complain because I just wanted to get out of there. Let's Recap: Uncomfortable, Water Leaks, Running Water in the Walls, Much Wear and Tear, and Generally not that nice. The Pro: Right Next to Ship Port Tip: Don't be afraid to use the Shuttle at a Different Hotel to make it to the port if you're taking a cruise for instance. The extra 15 - 30 minutes it'll take you to get ready in the morning and get there will be worth it if you get a good sleep somewhere else. P.S. - Did I mentioned the elevators seemed a little off? Seemed old and not very smooth running. (i.e. loud and/or bumpy) When you reached the floor on one of them the door took forever to open and it left you thinking you might be stuck for a split second. I'm sure they're fine by certain standards but it's one of those things you'd have to ride in and judge for yourself. Just my opinion. Again, this review isn't exaggerated. It's just my view of the experience and hope it helps you in making your decision.

Reviews.Title: “Blah, if you can afford better go there”
Reviews.Author: Babaramdass
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent - close to the airport, cruise ships, harbor. The rooms are outdated and felt like a road trip highway motel. Noisy rooms - had a dog somewhere close to us that was howling and barking for hours on a friday night. Then when the dog stopped barking, a couple started loudly arguing and you could almost hear word for word what they were saying (yelling). With the added noise of the city (airport, trains, harbor, cars) which is to be expected, we were disappointed. I should have spoken to the hotel whilst there however we were busy and knew that we would never stay there again. Lived across the street until a few months ago so we have eaten at Elephant and Castle and Ruth's Chris frequently. Both good food and service. When you book, ask for a harbor facing room - ours faced the street which enhanced the noise and isn't very exciting to look at.

Reviews.Title: “San Diego on the Bay”
Reviews.Author: elle464
Reviews.Content: This was a great find! We got this hotel for $99/night in August. The weather was beautiful. This hotel is only a 10 minute ride from LAX and very close downtown and the Gaslamp Quarter. Free shuttles are available from the airport. The hotel is within walking distance to the public transportation and bike rentals right downstairs. We took the "red train" to Old Sacramento. Purchase a pass for $5 and ride all day on public transportation. I even transferred to the bus line and went out to Ocean Beach. Many beaches, PETKO park, great restaurants, shopping nearby. Really good restaurants in the hotel. There is also a great little market downstairs for snacks, yogurt, salads, fresh fruit, etc., if you are on a budget. They even make breakfasts in the morning, quite reasonable and very good. This is an older hotel...not big on frills but the location and the price was awesome to be right on the water. We had a king room. The room itself was not huge but was ample. It was not in the main tower. The main tower is the one with the restaurants and lobby. Our tower was closer to the parking garage which was fine. Self parking was around $22. It's a short walk to the MIDWAY and a great place for a morning run along the water. Bring a jacket, though...it gets windy here and also quite humid.

Reviews.Title: “Location and Views AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: dalexbanda
Reviews.Content: I was an Internet customer as some have mentioned being considered for this hotel. HOWEVER, I was not treated that way by the hotel staff. Jose, Olga, and Arsenio all were polite and accomodating. They were very respectful. I did get a great deal on the room through priceline and before arriving at the hotel I had made arrangements through Jose to upgrade the room. Let me say this.. The upgrade fee is well worth it!!. The views we had were amazing at times breathtaking. You can see some photos attached. Parking was $22 a day, which most complain about, but what decent hotel doesn't charge parking, so we were well prepared for that. The beds seemed smaller than average but were very comfortable. The location was great, very close to lots of shops, restaurants, amuzement parks. Everyday was busy for us so it was nice going back to the room looking out over the harbor and feeling refreshed just from the views we took in. The tv's could definitely be updated as they are still the old big box style. The room would have been complete if a refridgerator was in the room. We stayed at a cheap hotel on the spur of the moment at the end of our trip and they furnished rooms with refridgerators. But nothing to lose sleep about. I would definitely stay here again and would recommend this hotel to others. The north tower seems more updated but for a family this worked for us having a bathtub in the bathroom rather than just a shower. I would stay in the south tower as there is nothing really to obstruct the view.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean & Updated”
Reviews.Author: BRRRRMinneapolis_MN
Reviews.Content: We were put up in this hotel by our airlines after our flight was cancelled. The location was great--right across from the bay and walking distance to many restaurants & attractions. And less than 10 mins from the airport. The rooms were newly remodeled and were very clean & spacious. I felt like we were at a high-end, contemporary downtown hotel. The beds were extremely comfortable. Each room had a nice balcony; we were on the 2nd floor, so the views were mostly of the roof & noisy air units, but it looks like the floors above us had great views (we didn't care; we were happy to just be put up in a nice place for the night). To me, Holiday Inn makes me think of a decent hotel, but nothing special. This particular Holiday Inn exceeded my expectations & pre-conceived notions. The only thing I can't comment on is the value, as our room was paid for by the airlines. However, I would pay a fair amount to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location shame about the night trai noise!!!”
Reviews.Author: mlperkins
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights before flying home after a 3 week USA road trip Parking is chargeable but there is plenty of it and I felt it was secure an undercover. 3 restaurants on site. we ate at the irish pub which had good hearty food at reasonable rates. breakfast wasnt included. The hotel is right on the bay and opposite the SEAL (half boat half bus) tours depart twice daily. Easy walk into town for shoping and food. Within 2 mins of the hotel is the trolley station which can take you to Mexico or aorund town. The biggest problem with this hotel would be the night trains that come thorugh twon slowly in the middle of the night sounding their horn. Its extremelloud and lasts for ages!!! SAdly i therefore didnt get a good nights sleep Hotel room was small but functional Nice large pool but this was shaded by the hotel so was cold. includes free towels and sunbeds

Reviews.Title: “Great location and would stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: Ryan1964
Reviews.Content: Not a glitz and glamor type place, but wonderful location. An average or above average place. Room was comfortable and clean. I slept well, it's a short 5- 10 minute trip from the airport with free hotel trolley pickup every 30 minutes. Free trolley service to the San Diego Zoo which I found time to enjoy, by extending my business trip into a longer personal trip. Some of the staff was more than helpful some were not, bacically typical of most places any more. I wasn't able to enjoy the pool but it look clean and well taken care of. The location is very convient to everything. There was no need to rent a car, which save me and the company several hundred dollars. Right across from shopping, restaurants and the ferry to Coronado Island. I look forward to going back and bring a few family & friends.

Reviews.Title: “Very poor service”
Reviews.Author: Darla313
Reviews.Content: 40 minutes to check in & I had a reserved room & am a Priority Club member. Internet never wooked for me either, had to pay for parking & not even free coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful 39th Anniversary Trip!”
Reviews.Author: sosborne98
Reviews.Content: We are locals, and we have staycationed here before, so we already knew the details, but we both felt that the evening was an incredible value, included parking and breakfast, a 10th floor bayfront king room looking onto the bridge of the Oosterdam cruise ship when we arrived. The room was quite clean and exactly what we had hoped for. We had one small problem with the AC, I called the desk and within 5 minutes two maintenance techs were at the door and knew exactly what the issue was, 10 minutes later the room was at the temp we wanted. Everyone at this hotel is so friendly and helpful and we both felt the cost was a bargain! Thank you for another memorable weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Good location. Hotel a bit tired”
Reviews.Author: FamilyTravelJunkkie
Reviews.Content: We often stay at Holiday Inn. This hotel was close to the harbour and a cruise we were taking. Very convenient. However, rooms need refreshing and beds need to be bigger. I would stay again if it was cheap but I wouldnt pay big money.

Reviews.Title: “OK room, great location”
Reviews.Author: doggone31
Reviews.Content: The big plus for this hotel is its location - you're right across from the waterfront walk, and within walking distance of the trolley, Amtrak, restaurants in Little Italy and the fabulous Extraordinary Desserts cafe. You're also about a 10-15 minute walk from the Westfield Shopping Center, Gaslamp Quarter and a Ralph's/Kroger supermarket. You could almost walk to airport, it's that close. Front desk staff and housekeeping staff were all exceptionally pleasant. Parking is expensive, at $22 day, but if you're lucky, there's half a block of unrestricted free street parking on the north side of the hotel. Of course, the downside to being close to the Amtrak station is that you will hear the train horns. The first night we stayed, our room faced the back of the hotel (overlooking Pacific Highway) and we heard trains all night; we switched rooms for the remaining 3 nights of our stay. If you request a room that faces Harbor Drive, or overlooks the pool, then you should be fine. Pool is big enough to do laps; we never saw anyone in it the whole time we were there, but I imagine it is well-used by kids in the summer. The exercise room is well-equipped. Complimentary PC to quickly check email or print a boarding pass in the lobby. Rooms are OK - clean, reasonably sized with 2 full/double (not queen) beds, nice balcony with chairs, but starting to look a little scuffed and tired in places. Mattress was comfortable and there was an adequate array of soft and firm pillows on each bed. Thermostat was easy to use and worked fine. As other reviewers have noted, there's a sliding, frosted glass panel to the bathroom that doesn't lock. If you're travelling with someone, such as a work colleague, who you don't know well (or who you don't want to know well), you will probably find this room uncomfortable. It would be fine though for families, or those who need assistance with using the bathroom. No tub, but a large walk-in shower, with a great shower head. I got the room through priceline and was reasonably satisfied with the price I paid for the room quality.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE sleep quality! Nobody could pay me to stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: OkiFamily
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night and it was the worst experience I've ever had sleeping in a hotel. I've traveled to many countries, stayed in many different classes of hotel, and also have a BS in hotel management. I don't understand how this hotel could ever have a repeat guest. The bed was soo hard and uncomfortable, sleeping on the floor would have felt the same. I actually piled all of the pillows on the bed and slept on them to make it bearable. There is a train that runs directly behind the hotel. Every 30 minutes ALL night long the train came blaring through with its loud horn. I got maybe 2 hours of sleep all night. The rooms were fairly large but incredibly basic. The bathroom doors slide, which means there is always an inch gap on either side of the door. The bathroom doors are glazed glass, meaning if you are travelling with an early riser (or midnight bathroom user), the light will illuminate the entire room. The location of this hotel is NOT worth having to put up with a miserable room. There are many other hotels within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “It was the perfect way to end our travels in San Diego!”
Reviews.Author: trishmarieluke
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a perfect location and has a great views of the harbor and ships. It's a short walk or drive from the hotel to many attractions. The staff was helpful and attentive. The rooms were spacious and had a large balcony for us to enjoy the sunrise and sunsets together on as a small family.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel -great location”
Reviews.Author: TonyW1961
Reviews.Content: A typical Holiday Inn - clean and comfortable - this one had bigger rooms than normal. I had a room overlooking the Bay which presented some stunning views from the Balcony across the Bay. The sunsets were stunning and a great views of cruise liners and the USS Enterprise. Always ask for a sea view rather than a room facing the City. The hotel is also close to the Italian quarter which offers a good selection of bars and restaurants (although not as good as the Gaslamp quarter which is about a 20 minute walk away). A nice little outdoor pool.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION! RIGHT IN THE MIX OF SAN DIEGO!”
Reviews.Author: twopookies
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at this hotel, it is right on the bay and next to the Core-Columbia district. At first glance I thought this place looked a little dated sitting right in front of all the new high rises, but the entire inside has been updated. We were looking for a bay view but alas all were taken so we went with the skyline view. I was glad we did! The city is absolutely stunning to see at night! The rooms all have balconies and the street noise isn't too bad, but the train can get a little annoying sometimes. So close to so much! Walking distance to the Midway carrier, Maritime museum, bay ferry, and trolley stop. (Highly recommend the trolley!), Let me also add that I don't normally give hotel restaurants much cred, but the restaurant at this Holiday Inn is excellent. Oh yea, and its next door to Ruth Criss Steaks and across the street from the best seafood in town!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, poor rooms, over priced”
Reviews.Author: bitmaster20
Reviews.Content: Even after considering the location factor, the hotel is way overpriced. We paid $120 for a double bed room overlooking the bay. I was expecting a spacious room with a nice decor, a good view. The first letdown was their $22/day parking fee. The view from the room reinforced the negative vibe I was beginning to get about the hotel. Yes, you can see the harbor from your room. But you also see the rooftops of the the two smaller buildings of the hotel in front of you. The room was very crowded with the two beds, TV armoire and a small table. The bathroom door was the sliding kind, with no lock on the inside. The proximity to the airport, seaport and train station added significantly to the noise factor. The only redeeming factor is the convenient location. However, the parking charges, the pricey room charge and the tiny room are too much to overcome that factor. Would definitely not recommend this hotel to a friend. I would rather drive a few extra miles and have a nice room where I would like to spend some time and relax then stay in such a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location - Not a Vacation Hotel”
Reviews.Author: smc698
Reviews.Content: Purchased reservation through Priceline.com for $55 - surely wasn't worth more - parking cost was $22/day. Staff was friendly. Not a place where you want to return to your room and sip a glass of wine. Although across from the ocean, it wasn't a resort - close to airport and train station with associated noise factor. Airline personnel stay here - good for a night but not much more and the priceline price was about what it was worth. Billed as a 3 star hotel - it wasn't

Reviews.Title: “An above average hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: KSchm26136
Reviews.Content: I had upgraded to a bay view when booking our room. Glad I did. We had a balcony over looking San Diego Bay. The hotel was clean, the managment accomodating and friendly. The room was fine with a comfortable bed. Within walking distance of the Intrepid Aircraft carrier. Also very close to the San Diego Zoo, and a stones throw from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Location good but that is about it!”
Reviews.Author: ediejeep
Reviews.Content: There is not much to write about that is positive. The rooms need an update,they are small and poorly decorated. The bathroom was not at all good. So small, showers moldy, sink tap barely worked. The beds are so so very thin you can feel every lump. The best feature was the restaurant downstairs. Oh and if you do not like noise do not stay here. You can hear planes, trains, and automobiles all night long.

Reviews.Title: “nice surprise for a return trip”
Reviews.Author: Lighthouseguy
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel some times ago, upon return it was a nice surprise the people is just as friendly as i remember from the last time, i spoke to a couple of desk clerk I remember from last time, They said they remember me. If they do or not, they really make me feel welcome. the view is still as nice as I can remember. I will be back

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay before a cruise”
Reviews.Author: haynathrt
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights before our 7-day Mexican Riviera cruise set sail out of San Diego. Great location to the cruise ship terminal - we walked with our 4 bags of luggage - very easy. Room was small but very nicely appointed and comfortable. Had everything we needed. Caught the ferry across the street to Coronado Island. Took the free hotel shuttle from the airport to the hotel and from the hotel to the San Diego zoo (very convenient). Ate breakfast and had cocktails at Elephant and Castle on-site which was great. Staff was friendly (aside from the female concierge we encountered who we'll just say must have been having a bad day). Worth the price for the convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay - room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: BudSanders
Reviews.Content: This is an adequate hotel. Wife and I had a nice "one-night-without-the-kids". I'd stay again if the price was right. The Good: The location is excellent - close to downtown and the Coronado ferry The view was spectacular on the bay side - worth a few extra bucks Balcony was a great place to hang out Staff seemed friendly and professional to me - we did not make any special requests The room looked up to date and the bed was comfortable We brought our bikes and the concierge said it was OK to bring them into the room Did I mention the view was spectacular? Great for viewing the sunset. The not so good: The room smelled like stale air conditioning - musty Parking is $22 a day for self park. Perhaps that's market rate, but we made other arrangements Although refrigerators are available, the charge is $10/night Internet connection, though free, was painfully slow We got a bay view 11th floor room facing the bay so we were high and away from most of the noise except one car alarm that went off a few times. You can expect some noise due to the downtown location. We did not hear the train at all. The Strange: The closet was located inside the bathroom. I've never seen this one before and I travel for business

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but parking is a rip.”
Reviews.Author: gotravel_like_me
Reviews.Content: I didn't realize that parking was so costly at this location. I made the mistake of assuming that parking was included. Beyond that, the room was really nice. I had a balcony facing the city with good view of all city lights. We enjoyed that. Later in the night though, it got quite noisy when a train or trolley (not sure which) came through the city. It gave off a loud screaching metal on metal sound. There were other industrial creepy sounds as well throughout the evening in downtown San Diego. Definitely would not live in that urban setting. Back to the room, the bed was super comfy, the bathroom nicely decorated and adequately equipped with plenty of towels and what not. I recommend this hotel if you want a taste of downtown SD for a decent price. We booked through Hotwire and saved some money.

Reviews.Title: “Not too shabby”
Reviews.Author: JeanaBoBeena
Reviews.Content: This was an ok stay for the money. We had a wedding to go to just down the street so it was convenient. It's an older building and could use some updating, but overall it's not too shabby. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: BethPittsburgh
Reviews.Content: I am spending four nights at the San Diego On the Bay hotel. Unfortunately, I am staying in the South Tower, which is an older building. There is no hot water at the sink, the bed has a thin mattress which seriously dips on one side, and there is no screen on the sliding glass door to the balcony. Also, we were offered free wireless but it is very s-l-o-w...Unfortunately, my colleagues were able to book at a much nicer hotel closer to the convention center and are spending about $60 less per night.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service is a Joke - Extremely Rude Employees!”
Reviews.Author: Gray25
Reviews.Content: We had a terrible experience with one of the employees working at the front desk. Let me preface by saying that this place has 3 different towers and apparantly you're supposed to know what each tower is called before you get there otherwise they get furious! We asked to move to the same tower as the rest of our party which we thought was the "main tower" since it is the tallest one connected to the lobby and they accomodated this change but once we realized that this was still not the correct tower we went back down to the front desk and politely asked the same overnight shift employee if they had any availability in the tower where the rest of our group was. once we asked this question, this employee treated us in such a rude and disrepectful manner I could not believe what was coming out of his mouth. To quote him he said: "You said the main tower! You gotta get your towers right!" He proceeded to say this a few times as if we should should know their lingo for what they call the towers. I have to mention they have various names for each tower as well so it's not like there is a definite name for each one! He stubbornly looked at what they had in the tower we requested and as he is doing this, my girlfriend is even apologizing for any incovenience that we caused him, even though she didn't have to and he just completely ignored her! Once he is about done giving us keys for a new room in a threatening sarcastic way says multiple times "Are you going to be happy with this?!" This guy apparantly has no idea what customer service is and left a bad taste in our mouth for the rest of our stay in this hotel. On a side note, the elevators at this hotel are terrible as they shake and we even got stuck in one for a few minutes. The only positive thing about this hotel is a nice view of the city in the north tower aka tower 2 aka not the "main tower". The location is decent too. If you want a hotel with employees who care about your experience and don't take out their pent up anger on you I would look elsewhere. Holiday Inn needs to rethink their hiring practices or at least tell their employees that they can't lash out at customers for no reason! Such a joke. We will never stay at a Holiday Inn ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Not Reccomended”
Reviews.Author: SummerGirl066
Reviews.Content: Our stay here was a very stressful experience. If you are traveling for the MCRD (Marine graduation), think twice before staying here. The location is perfectly located in downtown SD and it ends there. The shuttle service that is offered is limited to 20 people and you are not guarrenteed a ride to or from the base, especially beware of Friday many are bringing their new Marines back with them. The Mr. Wu and his staff are not accommodating at all, when we expressed our concern over the lack of transportation, we were offered to check out free of charge, it was 3 pm and we had not even stayed there yet. They do not stand good on their promise of hospitality. The rooms are on the small side and the bathroom door is glass, not at all private and when the lbathroom ight is on it lights the entire room up for those still sleeping.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location but a little over-priced!”
Reviews.Author: daniel122
Reviews.Content: This motel was very nice and clean and has a great location right across the street from the bay. We stayed here the night before we went on a cruise. The cruise ship terminal is basically just across the street (down to the left about a block maybe). Can't really complain about this motel with the exception that it seems to be a little overpriced. A free breakfast would improve my thoughts. (bias notice - We do not normally stay at this chain so are experience with it is very limited).

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with Great Location”
Reviews.Author: tamccann
Reviews.Content: Service, room, amenities and concierge desk were all great. I had a King room with bay view on the 11th floor - it was really spectacular, especially at night. Bed was very comfortable, shower/bath was small but adequate. Easy walk across the street to Anthony's for dinner and an after dinner stroll took me next door to the San Diego Maritime Museum (Russian sub, steamboats, etc.). The next day I walked a couple blocks down the street to the USS Midway Museum and took the self-guided tour which was a great value and lasted 2.5 hours - but could have been longer except my schedule did not allow it : ( The Elephant & Castle Pub in the hotel was excellent as was breakfast at the little deli place next to the bike rental shop (don't recall the name). Upon checkout I left my PC adapter/power cord in the room which I did not discover until I was home the next day. I called the hotel and it is being shipped to me via FedEx. Altogether an excellent place to stay with a killer location! Be advised that the hotel is located on a working harbor, so expect some noise occasionally.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: sconroy26
Reviews.Content: Overall it was a nice place to stay, the location was great and it has a really nice bar/restaurant. The rooms were clean, they could use a little updating (no flat screen TV's). Only downside, if your looking to lay around by the pool, not the place to do it. Pool was small and surrounded by towers so very little direct sunlight..

Reviews.Title: “If it's location that makes your stay, choose the HI on the Bay”
Reviews.Author: WestCoastBH925
Reviews.Content: That's a really cheesy title, but it stresses the point- this Holiday Inn's greatest strength is it's location. It sits right on Harbor drive- across the street from docking stations of all the sightseeing & cruise ships, the Maritime Museum, the Coronado Ferry, and is down the road from Seaport Village.
