Reviews.Content: I arrived to find out that parking would be $22 a day. I was not happy from the start. I tried to check in. Over an hour later, after getting my reservation sorted out with two front desk clerks and a manager who refused to emerge from his cozy office (the desk clerk kept going back to the manager every two minutes because he had no authority), I got into my room. It was so hot I could barely breathe. Spent 20 minutes in the room changing my clothes, went out to dinner with my friends, and came back to my room a few hours later. The air was so thick and humid in the room I could not even breathe. I packed my bag, checked out before midnight, was refused a refund of the Holiday Inn Reward Points I used to book the room, paid my huge parking fee, and drove the 3 hours home rather than stay overnight there. Stay anywhere but this place!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but not much else”
Reviews.Author: iagainsti
Reviews.Content: Okay, let's get the good out of the way right off the bat: this hotel is in just about the best location there is. If you are taking a cruise out of San Diego, you'll be able to basically walk out of your hotel room and on to the ship. I think this is where this hotel gets a lot of its business. Moreover, the hotel is within walking distance to some great things to do. The Midway aircraft carrier, Seaport Village, the old sailing ships, not too far from the Gaslamp Quarter. And, you're only a few miles from Old Town. Now for the bad. I'm no snob, but this hotel needs some serious updating. We rec'd a room on the second floor, right next to the elevator and ice machine. Needless to say, some in our family didn't get a very good night's sleep. There was a bunch of young kids across the hall partying it up into the wee hours, yelling and carrying on. Did the hotel staff just not care? The two beds in our room were small. I thought it would be two queens but it was more like two fulls or doubles. The room itself was very small. I also have little doubt that we rec'd such a poor location due to the fact that we booked on priceline. I've heard that this is common. Finally, be prepared to pay $22 to park your car. That's right! $22!! Amazing. This is somewhat common in this part of San Diego as you're basically in the city. But, given that I only paid $64 for the room, what can you expect? Next time, I'll just spend a few more bucks and go the the Marriott or the Hilton. In this case, I booked at the last minute and took what I could get.

Reviews.Title: “took my family with me on a business trip”
Reviews.Author: jpk35
Reviews.Content: we picked the Holiday Inn On the Bay because we have 2 small children and the location is perfect. I had a conference at the convention center and it is only a mile away. We went to the zoo, Midway, Old Town, the pool. Great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great View & Location but can be noisy”
Reviews.Author: HBBear
Reviews.Content: This Holida Inn is in a great location right in downtown San Diego right on the bay. It is right across the street from the San Diego Cruise Terminal so cruise ships are coming and going daily. Get a room with a bay view on a high floor and you won't be disappointed. All rooms have balcanies so you can sit outside and watch the boats in the bay as well as seeing the planes coming and going from the airport. The rooms are very nice and completely updated. Everything was comfy and clean. The only thing that was kind of weird was that the bathroom had a frosted glass sliding door which doesn't give much privacy. My only concern was that you could hear noises from other rooms as well as the balcanies from other people talking and partying on their balcanies. Since this is an older hotel, the noise insulation is very poor. But, all in all, this was a great location and easy to get around without the feeling of a busy crammed in downtown hotel. Lots of parking but about $22 per day. Good British Pub style restaurant in the hotel with a Ruth's Chris Steakhouse right on the property also. I would definately stay here again. But again, make sure you get a bay view room on a high floor and you will just love the view.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: trixie33
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel pre and post a Mexican riviera cruise. It was great as it is right across the street from the cruise dock. However as we are elderly and had a lot of luggage we asked for a shuttle ride to the ship and were accommodated. We had a bay front room and it was great looking across the harbor and we could see the airplanes coming and going from the airport. Staff were all friendly and helpful. Someone mentioned the trains. They are nearby, however they did not wake us up during the night. Maybe we are heavy sleepers. We did hear them early in the morning. We did hear a couple of dogs but they didn't wake us either... i mention this if you are adverse to pets in hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Got the OPPOSITE of What We Asked For”
Reviews.Author: BarclayNewEngland
Reviews.Content: What a difference it makes when hotel staff listen. Both prior to our trip and at the desk we requested a very quiet room, and instead got: a room directly over the entrance, above a noisy bunch of large military trucks, DIRECTLY ACROSS FROM A CONSTRUCTION SITE, and on busy Pacific Highway. Construction noise began at 7AM. Spent the four nights wishing for a room over the pool which would have been much quieter. Quite possibly will never stay at a Holiday Inn again due to the complete indifference of staff members. Advice: if you make a request prior to your stay, get a promise in writing. These staff members just don't try. Television set, very old and cheap, several channels did not work, plus one of three lamps did not work. The TV cable system is very limited and the decor is 1950's blonde with very old, not very clean carpets (due to age.) Weather unseasonably cold and damp and we had to request extra blankets, which were threadbare cotton. Loads of conventioneers. Our business associate got an even worse room across from the bar. He described this hotel as "the pit." We were all delighted to leave, never to return.

Reviews.Title: “Not perfect, but good”
Reviews.Author: buddy_00
Reviews.Content: Great location - close to Little Italy, other restaurants, and the trains, and a long walk or short (<$10) cab ride to the Gaslamp district. Rooms were clean, staff was friendly. The only thing I didn't like was that my room (a double) had a sliding, semi-transparent bathroom door. If I'd been travelling with a friend, the fact that you can hear and (sort of) see the inside of the bathroom through the door would have been uncomfortable, to say the least.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, a bit noisy”
Reviews.Author: msladyk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this very clean hotel for one night before our Mexican cruise. Hotel is much nicer on the inside then the out. Location is right across the street from the cruise port with beautiful bay views and nicely updated rooms. It was exciting to see our ship in port, but beware that it is also a noisy area as the hotel is also situated near the train station. You could hear ships and trains blowing their horns in the early hours of the morning. It didn't bother us that much, but if you are a light sleeper, you could easily get annoyed. They also have a courtesy shuttle that takes you to/from the airport and also to the cruise port which was very convenient. There is a Ruth Chris Steakhouse just steps away and a nice bar/pub in the lobby as well. All in all, would stay here again before our next cruise out of San Diego. The gaslamp quarter is also less than a 5 minute cab drive away for anyone looking to book near this area.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: LCroft64
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, right on the harbour.Great views and easy location the town and transport.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy hotel with poor staff”
Reviews.Author: Der_Finger
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights on the way back home from Hawaii. The location overlooking the bay is quite nice, so we booked a room with a bay view. On arrival, the receptionist could not find our reservation, left for the back office for five minutes and finally found a room for us. However, there was no apology or explanation for leaving without a word. As we arrived late in the evening, we wanted something to eat. The hotel bar did´t offer any food and all the restaurants in the vicinity of the hotel were closed. Our room was in the annex to the main building and faced the bay with a nice view and balcony. However, it was right next to the lifts and there was quite a bit of noise from the lifts´ wires. I didn´t sleep well for two nights due to the noise from the lifts. The room itself was large enough and clean, the bathroom had a tub and a sink and was rather small. On the day of our departure we planned to use the free airport shuttle. As we arrived at the entrance two minutes before the scheduled departure we only saw the shuttle leaving. I went to reception to tell them about the shuttle leaving early (even before the sound of the harbour bell!) and they couldn´t care less, let alone apologise. Even the duty manager was no help. In the end we took the public city bus which got us to the airport in time for our flight. All in all, I cannot recommend this hotel. Staff do not seem to care about customers and the level of noise next to the lifts was unbearable.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: 10wink
Reviews.Content: Visited San Diego for the first time in September 2008 - We spent ages going through all the web sites for hotels and looking at all the reviews. It would appear that hotels in San Diego are quite expensive and not of a great standard compared to other parts of the states. Good Points :- Fantastic Location - just across the road from the cruise liners, star of india (old sailing clipper) uss midway (aircraft carrier) museum seaport village a bout 10 mins walk along the bay downtown shopping (horton plaza) and the gas lamp quarter (restaurants etc) 10 -15 mins walk away airport 5 miles - very easy to drive from if picking up a car rental at the airport - if not it is right on the bus route (catch outside the terminal) bus about every 10 mins (around a dollar 50) safe area fantastic views of san diego bay train station and tram stop for all destinations in san diego 5 mins walk. hotel rooms are clean and functional - clean bath room with good shower and comfy beds and cable tv staff polite and helpful - never had any issues so didnt need to test there customer service skills pub next door - sells good bar snacks and drinks and restaurant Bad Points Daily charge for parking at the hotel is $20 per night (2 minutes walk down the road is the cruise ship parking terminal - $15 for a full 24 hours) - beware the on street parking - it says its free between 6pm - 6am but cars were towed if parked there after midnight. there i a quite a lot of noise from the outside of the hotel (the windows are very thin) - but this dies down around 11pm - but can be noisy again around 6am - I read lots of reviews saying that it was very noisy - but it was not to bad. The pub next door (elephant and castle) tries to be a british pub - with food on a american / british theme - the bar is ok gets quite full and is fine for a few drinks after a long day or prior to going out into the gas lamp area. The restaurant is very very slow - it can take an hour to get your food once ordered and dont think of orderig a drink as sometimes they just dont appear but you do get charge. Although our food was ok (once arriving) many people did complain about the quality of the food. For some reason if you sat at the bar - your drinks and food arrived very quickly and was excellent. There is a ruth/chris steak house next door - very pricy - never saw that many people eat there. Overall this hotel is very good - fantastic location - very central to get to most places - the rooms are comfy and welcoming and clean. San diego is a fantastic place to visit - people are friendly and the city and area beautiful - be aware that san diego is spread out and you will need to travel to get to most areas. for balboa park fashion valley mall down town old town can easily be reached using the metro system (bus and tram system) very cheap and reliable To get to the beaches or legoland and sea world you really need a car.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Welshtotty
Reviews.Content: I ended up staying here unexpectantly last week for 2 nights, they managed to fit me in, i had a room on the 11th floor of the main tower facing the town. Rooms were spotless, and were very comfortable, yes there was a bit of noise from the trains/planes but not with the balcony doors shut fully. The Elephant and Castle (the pub attached to the hotel) was fantastic, and i spent 2 nights there drinking and meeting some great people. All in all great value for money, and also the free shuttle took me to the airport at 6am, a real bonus! I would definately recommend this hotel, its close to downdown/seaport village etc, and great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “The city-view side is also nice”
Reviews.Author: Forest20851
Reviews.Content: You can't get much closer to downtown San Diego. But as a business traveler, there were just a few things I wish this hotel had. I stayed in tower #1 (there are actually three towers) and my room faced the new, expanding San Diego cityscape. Rooms in the first tower are on the smallish side, and the closet / wardrobe is actually in the bathroom--the first time I've seen that--anywhere. The beds were comfortable, and I got great sleep. But just don't leave the balcony door open at night. Aircraft taking off from nearby San Diego Airport can clearly be heard. Also, there is some traffic noise and some train noise from the nearby Amtrak Station, which is a block away. However, with the balcony door *closed,* all was quiet. If I had my wish, there would have been a real desk in my room at which I could have done my paper work . A reading chair would also have been nice too, though my room was so small, I don't know where it could have been put. I took a few photos which should be attached.

Reviews.Title: “As good as we remembered”
Reviews.Author: Desbub
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the hotel, the first being six years ago. The hotel was as we remembered. Its location is ideal for visitors to San Diego. We had a bay view room in the South tower. It was very comfortable and clean. Yes, you can hear the planes but that is only during the day. The free wi-fi was a real bonus. We took a wine tour with Destination Temecula - highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect as a cruise hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bazilu
Reviews.Content: Recently returned from this hotel which is literally kitty-corner from the cruise ship terminal. It is definitely the closest hotel to the terminal. It is safe and friendly; have no complaints. Easy to get to Coronado from the hotel too — just walk past the cruise ship terminal and you get the ferry.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable”
Reviews.Author: snarkyinla
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 1 night over labor day weekend. The outside was definitely old, but the room inside was perfectly fine. We had a room overlooking the parking lot and didn't hear a lot of noise. The only real negative was when returning to the hotel at 11pm on Saturday night, the parking lots were completely full (in part because of a bunch of wankers took up multiple spots per car and the management didn't seem to care). Eventually the lot attendent directed the bunch of cars waiting for spots to a remote lot a few blocks away. The problem came when leaving the next day. We schlepped with our bags to our car and the attendent of that lot said our daily parking fee to the hotel wouldn't work for his lot. Eventually he let us leave without paying, but it was a bit of a hassle. He seemed like a nice guy, actually, and I don't think was trying to scam us. I really think there was not clear communication between the hotel and his lot.

Reviews.Title: “Initial Teething Problems But Great Otherwise”
Reviews.Author: Andrew-Beaumont
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights and really enjoyed it. On checking in, we were told that, despite booking both rooms at the same time, they wern't going to be near each other although they would be on the same floor. However, when we got to the rooms, the previous guests hadnt checked out of one of them and consequently we ended up on 2 different floors. This was the only issue we had and other than that, the hotel was excellent. Both rooms were really nice with 2 double beds, good size and lovely balconies overlooking the water. Despite the noise of the cruise ships, the road and the airport - which you could see from the balcony, we slept well every night and the noise was not an issue. Excellent Irish pub on site in the hotel which did free breakfasts for kids. It was a 10 minute walk from the hotel to Gaslamp Quarter and Horton Plaza, 20 minute walk to the Convention Centre and 15 minute drive to Sea World. Excellent pool at the hotel as well. Would recommend visiting Star Of India Maritime Museum opposite hotel - great for kids.

Reviews.Title: “Reservation problems”
Reviews.Author: caseyuno
Reviews.Content: Warning - be wary of reservation commitments. In February 2008 I reserved a block of five rooms for August. By July, reservations had been changed....some rooms downgraded, some prices raised. Handicap room deleted entirely. I had to go to SD a day early to argue my case with the manager on duty who reluctantly changed the reservations back to the original commitment . Finally, names were reversed on two rooms, final bill bills were submitted with wrong names. Once the battle was over, the rooms were pleasant, the view beautiful, the location excellent. But I would be leery of trusting them with further business.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: AKaroundtheworld
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a double room which had a fantastic view of the bay! The room was very clean, with down pillows and comforters. We stayed four nights and each day housekeeping did a marvelous job. There were never any problems with noise, faulty elevators, climate control, or any other problems travelers often encounter. There was a coffee maker, iron and ironing board, and blowdryer in the room. The only thing we could have wished for was a small fridge, as there were several places on-site where we could buy beverages and keep them in our room. The staff were very courteous, and helpful if you asked them directly for help or information. There are three convenient places on-site where you can get simple food, or have a nice meal. We did not enjoy the deli as much as we had hoped,(but you could buy any beverage you wanted - like a small convenience store) but the pub and restuarant in the main building was outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Dated but a great stay”
Reviews.Author: MrSpeyk
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights earlier in August. A 9th floor bay facing room in the first tower. Just as well it was on the ninth, weird bathroom setup, the door is glass and faces the window. Great views for all who do not face the bay.... Nice clean room with a little balcony. The seciurity for the room seems a little bad but nothing happened. Great views! The service in the hotel was great. On the downside yes it is a little older and dated than alternative hotels in the area. The pool is on the small side and parking is far too expensive. The pub in the lobby is great and the location is also great for a stoll into 'little Italy' some other good bars. I would stay here again but only if I got a similar room, high floor bay view. Oh, yes, reports of the noise are true but I quite like the train noise through the night.....

Reviews.Title: “It was alright!”
Reviews.Author: catlovertina
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn , San Diego was alright . We were in the South tower on the 11th floor . In our room we had a balcony which had breathtaking views of San Diego bay. The first night was fine . But then we were accused TWICE by a certain member of staff of shouting out over the balcony but how would we do that when the whole family was in bed!! They really need to get double glazed windows!! But they made up for it by taking the meal and drinks off the bill and credited us aswell. .

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: gothepanthers
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect, especially for afternoon strolls along the bay. The pool and gym facilities were good. Staff were very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: keithsam
Reviews.Content: Last minute booking on Priceline. We arrived a little late on the drive from LA. The room was a little smaller than we expected but it was OK, I think we are just a little spoiled. We had a great view from our balcony and the people there were really, really nice. If you are in San Diego that's a great place to stay, I wish we had more time there!

Reviews.Title: “Nice view of the air duct”
Reviews.Author: omg4real
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay based on some of the great reviews but we were terribly disappointed. The air conditioner did not work, the bed was very uncomfortable, no refrigerator, one-cup coffee maker, view of air duct and opposing tower-not the bay as we requested, extremely NOISY! We actually checked out a day early. We would advise not staying in Tower 2 and get confirmation of which Tower you will be in, room #, and what view before making your reservations.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay at Holiday Inn on the Bay!!”
Reviews.Author: palmtreesandcoconuts
Reviews.Content: My husband and I live in San Diego and often like to try out some of the local hotels for a night or two. This hotel is at the top of our list of favorites! Clean, ocean-inspired decor definitely captures the feel of the bay, and the views are excellent! The bed is comfortable, as are the pillows. Holiday Inn's pillow menu is definitely a huge plus - no more flat pillows!! Housekeeping took about 15 minutes to bring us our pillows, pretty fair timing if you ask me. The bathroom was spacious and beautifully tiled, but the shower has very low water-pressure and it takes a while for the water to heat up. Housekeeping could have cleaned the bathtub a little better, as there was shaving cream left behind from the previous occupants. It wasn't much and easily rinsed away, so we overlooked it, considering the rest of our room was immaculate. The mint amenities were refreshing and of decent quality Our balcony was rather small (we were in the north tower) - you could barely fit two people standing on it - but it was definitely better than not having one! The restaurant has good food, but seems to be poorly managed and understaffed. The poor hostess was so overwhelmed I thought she was going to cry! We ordered the food to go and enjoyed a sunset dinner from our hotel room - it added a very nice touch to our experience! Just outside and to the right of the hotel entrance (when you're looking at the hotel), there's a little deli on the property - you can get excellent salads, among other deli items and they have the best cobb salad I've ever had. Prices aren't bad - about $8.00 for a salad that could easily feed two people. Check-in/out were easy and the staff are friendly. Overall, we really enjoyed our stay and plan on going back soon. It definitely offers a laid-back, southern California feel at a good price!

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn was just fine”
Reviews.Author: cili_padi_nz
Reviews.Content: I was booked into the Holiday Inn on the Bay through work. I was a bit apprehensive, but it was totally unfounded. The hotel provides airport shuttles, a service which I did not realise but gratefully tagged along other guests of the hotel. The hotel also provides complimentary shuttles to town and the zoo. There is also free wifi, which came in very handy. I had a Priority Club rewards card which upgraded me to a king room with an excellent bay view. The service was fast and courteous. The room was large and very clean. There is no minibar (which I didn't miss). My only complaint is that there is noise from the trains and cruise ships which took some getting used to. The hotel really needs to double glaze the windows. Apart from this, it was a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: ProudCVN74Wife
Reviews.Content: I was extremely pleased with my stay. I had the prefect view. From my balcony I could see my husband's ship pulling in. What a sight. The room was very clean, large and enjoyed the comfort. I thought the staff was extremely pleasant and made our stay worth-while.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Weekend Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: wrs1106
Reviews.Content: Had the opportunity to stay here one night in October 2007, and wanted to return for the "full experience." Definitely not disappointed, as we had requested a room in the South Tower, 10th floor or above, and got exactly what we asked for from the friendly desk clerk named Brian. The bay view is gorgeous (pictures submitted) and our room was very comfortable and clean. Any requests we made were granted with a smile. Our in-room coffee maker didn't work the first morning, but it was replaced promptly. That was the only "problem" we had! This was my 5th trip to San Diego, and having stayed at three different hotels, this is definitely my favorite! Would highly recommend it for anyone wanting to experience San Diego. It is obviously right on the harbor front, so the USS Midway aircraft carrier museum is right across the street, and Seaport Village is a short walk. The Gaslamp District is within walking distance, and we walked to Petco Park for a Padres game (about 1.5 miles). We wouldn't have needed a car, except for a day trip to La Jolla. The hotel has a complimentary airport shuttle, so if you want to stay in the downtown area, you don't need to rent a car! All in all, the Holiday Inn San Diego - On The Bay is about as close to perfect as it gets! Oh yes, and for the ultimate steak dinner overlooking the harbor, you have to try Ruth's Chris!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Mrqcace
Reviews.Content: We stayed here May 4, 2009 one night precruise. As so many others have indicated, the location can't be beat for cruisers or others who want to join in the activities around the ships. Only 10 minutes or less from the airport, they have a shuttle that works both ways. We had a balcony overlooking the bay, rooms very clean but definitely dated somewhat. The AC works great, almost too good, we had to turn it off and open the windows because it was freezing us out. Had lunch at the diner on site, very good and price was reasonable. HOHO and trolley stops near the front of the hotel. Easy access to many attractions. Staff very helpful when we arrived early, took care of our luggage and expedited an early check in. We would stay here again and hope to do so next time we are in San Diego. The views from the bay facing balconies are awesome, we caught part of the air show from ours.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Needs some upgrades”
Reviews.Author: mikelan6
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn On the Bay in San Diego for one night prior to our cruise in late April. We used the complimentary hotel transportation from the airport, for which we waited about 20 minutes for the van to arrive. Check in was quick and easy and were given rooms in the 5 story tower right off the lobby. We had reserved and received two rooms facing the bay. When we got into our room, it was very warm and we noticed that the sliding glass door was partially opened behind the closed drapes. We tried to turn on the air conditioner, but had to play around with the controls before it would turn on as it was not installed correctly. Cool air did come out of the vent, but the room would not cool down. We called the front desk, who sent an engineer up. He explained that the thermostat was installed incorrectly, but the A/C would still work ... just keep the drapes closed. Indeed, it was a warm day and the afternoon sun was heating the west facing room. The king size bed and other furnishings were fine - nothing fancy. The bathroom was also simple and functional. We returned to the room after lunch at Anthony's restaurant (very nice) across the street and found that the room had still not cooled enough. We again called the front desk and the manager offered to move us to a room on the 5th floor. The air conditioner here worked a little better. The furnishings and view were almost identical. I believe that if the hotel changed and modernized their sliding glass doors, the heat and street noise problems would be taken care of. It was a treat to watch the cruise ships in the terminal across the street. The location of the hotel can't be beat. Right across the street is the Maritime museum and about a block to the south is the Midway Aircraft carrier museum. It's also a nice stroll to the Seaport Village with lots of parks and monuments along the way. Downtown is also very close by. We walked to Horton Plaza in the evening. Getting to the cruise ship after checking out the next day could not have been easier ... we simply crossed the street.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NEborn
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here while on a mini vacation. We stayed three nights and it was great. The rooms were really nice. It was always clean when we got back from sightseeing at lunchtime. The shower was awesome. We never used the pool, but it looked nice. We had a great view of the waterfront. We heard planes going overhead, but not much else. I would highly recommend this hotel as the location is superb! You can walk to many of the attractions and restaurants. It was a fun experience.

Reviews.Title: “great view”
Reviews.Author: mshilly
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great. the people were very nice and helpful. We had a room with a view of the ocean. The room did kind of smell. but we kept the door open. went to the pool and played. small pool, but liked it. We would go there again and stay there for week.

Reviews.Title: “The location is terrific but you have to travel back to 1970's”
Reviews.Author: Travelinggamie
Reviews.Content: Needed accomodations near the airport for 1 night before flying out early the next day. Booked the room on the internet and received a fair rate by prepaying with a non-refundable clause. Had time for sightseeing on the day we checked in and was able to check in early. The location is terrific for visiting the sites on the waterfront, you can walk to the Midway museum and all the other attractions nearby but be warned the hotel looks like a 1970's movie set. The free airport shuttle elimiinates the need for a rental car and parking fees if you plan to visit sights near this location (did notice airline employees using this hotel). No complaints on the front desk staff on checking in or out. We received a free upgrade from an east facing room (train and construction noise) ) to the South Tower with a bay facing balcony from the front desk clerk without asking. Room was so-so and the bathroom was clean. The walls are thin and you do hear the other guests; the traffic noise comes through closed balcony doors and yes, you do hear the boat horns in the harbor & airport noise, but didn't hear any trains. All noises did quiet down after midnight. The view of the waterfront and the location are the highlights of this Holiday Inn. The English style restaurant next to the lobby is fine if you want a moderate priced lunch or dinner and they have outdoor seating - the portions were too large for us. Plenty of new construction nearby of highrisers which makes the hotel look desperate for a complete renovation. If you want location and are willing to scarifice on the accomodations, this works okay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: 92Karen
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in March and can honestly say it was a great choice. We couldn't have asked for a better location. It is right on the bay, directly opposite the cruise terminal and the maritime museum. It's within walking distance to Horton Plaza shopping mall. The old town trolley stops virtually opposite the hotel and the train station is just around the corner. The hotel has parking at a reduced rate for residents. The hotel compises several different buildings, all surrounded by nice gardens. We ate in the hotel's restaurant every day for breakfast and 2 evenings and the food was great and at a reasonable cost, children were well catered for. We can higly reccomend the Chris Steakhouse also (although a bit pricey). There is a small shop in the lobby selling the essentials and souveniers. The rooms were a good size and very clean. Our only complaint was that we had a noisy air conditioner, however when we reported it to reception they fixed it the same day which was good. Service at reception was friendly. Safes are available free of charge in reception. The hotel has a small outside pool. All in all good value for money but with a good level of quality.

Reviews.Title: “breathtaking views, maddening noise”
Reviews.Author: polosaka
Reviews.Content: I should have read the reviews before I booked it! We stayed for 8 nights for the convention. Pros: -breathtaking views of the bay or the city if you are not facing a brick wall or a roof with air conditioning equipment on it -nice location, close to public transport -balconies -remodeled bathroom, sliding glass door in the shower. No disgusting shower curtains! However opaque bathroom door is really weird, especially if you share a room with the coworker -computer in the lobby to check your email -rooms are nice size Cons: noise!!! If you want to experience city living in its fullest, go for it. Trolley rings, clanks, squawks; Amtrack trains whistle and blow their horns as if the apocalypse is near in addition to the regular train noise while riding the tracks , railroad/ trolley gates on the street open and close with a lot of ringing and clanking, plus street traffic adds to the cacophony. There is also a high-rise construction across the street with jackhammering and all the appropriate noises imaginable. You can sleep there only if you are dead; all of this is called "room with city view". There is a few hours at night, when you can get a little shut-eye, but this is it. -staff is not very knowledgeable or friendly; they lost my reservation couple of times, had to call the hotel 5 times! to straighten this out. Even then, they messed up. Please remember, that room with 2 beds DOES NOT allow pull out bed, contrary to what they told me 3 times on the phone. Hence a big inconvenience for the family with a teenager. -manager agreed to switch us to the bay-facing room, only if we pay extra 50 dollars a night! This was not in budget, so we stayed. Management is nasty, but the maids, the cleaning workers etc are nice. -Blankets are nice and thick; pillows are OK. but the do not have down pillows as they claim. If you ask for the down pillow as the sign says, you will get another one of this stone-hard pillows -no breakfast is included, which you would expect for the price. You can eat at the deli next door, the food is really good there, but it adds to the bill. -

Reviews.Title: “A Great Location....but maybe they needed a better architect!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sheg
Reviews.Content: Expected the worst after reading some of the reviews, and instead was quite pleasantly surprised. The room was in the back (5th floor) overlooking condo construction and the infamous railroad. At certain times of the day the noise from the trains was pretty annoying. Never heard the planes. The trains don't run at night....but maybe I slept too well in their very comfortable bed. The room was nicely appointed and obviously had been remodeled. Thought the opaque sliding bathroom door with no lock was a bit wierd but got used to it (was there with a co-worker). The gym (there are two rooms) was ok. Definitely clean but small. In the morning it was packed. Pool was too cold to swim in for me. The restaurant downstairs was ok, not great. More like a sports bar with average food. Went across the street to Anthony's Fishette and found that interesting.....Ruth's Chris looked fab but not on the expense account radar. For a great meal head over to Little Italy or to Hillcrest. Horton Plaza/gaslamp is about a 20-25 minute walk or you could take the shuttle. By the way the shuttle took FOREVER to pick us up from the airport. Next time I would probably just pay for the cab. It was quite convenient to call from the airport but the wait was around 45 minutes! Considering the hotel was less than two miles away that was pretty ridiculous. Did take Amtrak up to LA and it was awfully easy to walk the three blocks to the station. Even the convention center and Seaport Village was a very pleasant walk. Definitely would recommend but you can tell from the different buildings some rooms are bad news.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: sk_denny
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights. Hotel with superb location, close to everything. It was very nice to jog along the harbor. Didn't have time to use the pool and gym, but they looked nice and clean. Food was tasty and at the reasonable price. My room had awesome view of the San Diego Bay (see photo). Loved watching the sun set from my big balcony. Staff was the best - extremelly friendly, empathetic, and helpful in a genuine way.

Reviews.Title: “Just Satisfactory”
Reviews.Author: MCDMAN
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for $79/night for 1 night before our Carnival Cruise. The hotel offers free pickup from the airport and free transportation to the Cruise Pier. This is worth it just for the transportation. However, the room we got was very old and tired and smelled. It was decent enough but I would not stay there again. There rooms in another section of the hotel were either just remodelled or new. The only reason we stayed here was because of the rate and the transportation to the pier. Otherwise, we would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Balcony!”
Reviews.Author: wicheese
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience at the Holiday Inn on the Bay. We booked the room for one night because we were leaving on a cruise the next day. The hotel was right across the street from the ship and was very convenient. It was also close to the airport. There was a shuttle that picked us up from the airport and took us to the hotel. The balcony was great!! We had a room that faced the city but the other side of the hotel overlooked the bay. The room was spacious and comfortable. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was large. We ate at the restaurant twice and the food was excellent. Conveniently located near restaurants and drug stores. The only downside was that it was a little pricey. $210.00 for a room with a king bed.

Reviews.Title: “noisy but nice”
Reviews.Author: ArthurNewJersey
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the Holiday Inn by the Bay in San Diego (Mar. 6,2008-Mar 10,2008) and were basically pleased. Prior to making our reservations I had read other reviews listed on Tripadvisor and I want to confirm it sure is a noisy environment. We were upgraded to a bay facing room in the back section of the hotel. Considering we were about 3 miles from the airport we expected to hear planes taking off and we did. When we heard the train in the back of the hotel my wife and I just laughed since we knew it was only a matter of time before they passed by our hotel. We found the hotel clean, the service great, the food excellent and the location where we could walk to almost anything. Yes I would stay there again but not as my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Be warned !”
Reviews.Author: lonestar64
Reviews.Content: I guess I should have known better ! I did not check this hotel on Trip Advisor before booking. I was at San Diego for a convention, wanted to be walking distance to the convention centre and downtown, and wanted to collect points... The back of the hotel overlooks the Amtrak line/station, about one block away. The trains blow their whstle everytime they approach the station, which is about every half and hour. At first we thought how quaint ! But when this continues though the middle of the night and starts at about 4am in the morning, it will drive you insane !!! The hotel doesn't even fit double glazing even it must have been like this since the hotel was first build. Totally unforgivable. My wife tried to change our room the next morning, the reception just ignored her. I was more forceful when I got back from the convetion and they moved us to a room overloking the bay, which I must admit the view was very nice. The hotel charges $20/night parking while the convention centre charges $7, think about it. Another warning to Priority Club members. I am their Platinum member and when I asked about upgrade at check-in, they just ignored my request, even the hotel seemed half-full when we got back after dinner with less than half of the rooms with light on. It was only when I strongly complained about the noise thet they moved us to a bay view room which was available all along. The InterContinnental should inspect this hotel and sort out the management as they are giving Holiday Inn a bad name !

Reviews.Title: “The noise will drive you nuts - don't stay there”
Reviews.Author: lcdb60
Reviews.Content: The biggest problem with this hotel is the noise. We checked in around 10pm on a Saturday night after a long day, and went to bed soon after. We were in the first building facing the harbor, but our room on the 9th floor faced the back buildings. From about 11pm to 2am, there were at least 6 trains that passed by, each sounding their horn continuously. The sound was so loud, it is as if we were sleeping on the platform of the train station! Each time I am about to fall asleep, another train came. Early in the morning the cruise ships near by also sounded their horns (or whatever you call it). There was just no way to get a good night's rest. We could also hear the toilet flush and sound of TV from the next room. I had never wished for earplugs this badly in my entire life! But then, I doubt earplugs would stop the noise because it was just way too loud. The room itself is clean enough but it is really old, I can't tell where the money they spent on renovation went. This was the worst stay ever. Never again!

Reviews.Title: “Look before you stay!”
Reviews.Author: Libra2u
Reviews.Content: Luckily, we asked to look BEFORE booking 14 rooms @$230/ea. for a wedding party. All six rooms we previewed were supposedly non-smoking but smelled like old ashtrays with a perfumey overtone. Evidently, they don't really have exclusively non-smoking rooms or they have a really poor ventilation system. The two rooms facing the bay that we saw were a little nicer, but one had a pet odor smell and the other had a lingering cigarette odor. If the rooms didn't smell like cigarettes, were clean and modern, and weren't near a major rail line, they might be worth $200+. Like all the hotels in that area, they charge $26/day to park. In all fairness, all of the hotels near the pier are expensive. If you smoke, are a heavy sleeper, and travel with large dogs, this is your kind of place.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: bezoCalifornia
Reviews.Content: I stayed their because of the Fires, the room was dirty, the bathroom was dirty, parking was terrible, and the window latch was busted, the room was small and this stay was way over priced. The people were friendly and the area is nice but that was the only positive. Parking was $20 a day!

Reviews.Title: “Best Holiday Inn I ever stay in”
Reviews.Author: Lighthouseguy
Reviews.Content: WOW, I booked this hotel on line not knowing what to expect since it's my first trip to San Diego. When I walk into the hotel I was greeted by the nice checkin staff, they make me feel like I am a visiting family member. They gave me a nice room facing the bay on the 12 floor, what a view, I can enjoy my coffee out in the balcony sitting for hours looking out to the ocean and the cruise ship coming in. The room was clean and nicely decorated with a moden bathroom with nice showers. This Holiday have three restaurant on site incluing Ruth Chris steak house, best Holiday Inn I ever stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Sneaky overcharges!!!”
Reviews.Author: HappyBelly
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a convention. They charge $20/night for parking. I parked for one night and the hotel charged me $20. A couple of days later, I was doing reimbursements and I couldn’t find my receipt so asked them to fax my receipt again to me. Apparently, AFTER I checked out and signed everything, they decided to charge me for parking for every … single … night – despite me only parking for one night. They didn’t tell me this – they just charged it without my permission. The only reason why I found out is because I lost my original receipt and asked them to send me a receipt again. Tricky, tricky, tricky – BEWARE! If you stay here, be on your toes – compare it to your credit card bill to see that the amounts match – because they will add charges without your permission. Half the rooms are crap, facing seedy parking lots. The other half of the rooms could be nice, facing the water, but I only got the rooms that were crap (without a bay view). The first room I stayed in was abnormally loud – there must have been a broken fan or something. They transferred me – and in the second room, the bed post broke – we didn’t do anything to break it, it was already broken, they just never fixed it. Both rooms were right next to the train station so I could hear the train swoosh by every 15 minutes (with complimentary bells and whistles). This is a terrible hotel for business travelers attending a conference at the Convention Center. It’s a half an hour walk to the Convention Center, and you have to walk through an area with homeless people. The trolley doesn’t run that often – it takes the same amount of time to take the trolley as it is to walk. It’s really a pain to get to and from the convention center, especially for those painful 8 am sessions. And good luck during the night sessions – I wouldn’t recommend walking through this area if you’re alone.

Reviews.Title: “agree- not good”
Reviews.Author: thegreatunknown
Reviews.Content: I was at CCI in 2006. I booked my hotel thru the convention the second it opened. I was able to get all but the last day at Best Western and the last at HI. BW was great with a couch for friends to crash on and a fridge. HI was dissapointing compared to BW. the room was small and cost more. The only advantage was that it was right across the bay.

Reviews.Title: “noisy and rude staff”
Reviews.Author: dancingtrip
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there for 2 nights in Oct. 2007. When we 1st. checked in, they gave us a 2 beds room, which is only 2 full size beds and the room is quite small and dirty. We had to go down to the lobby to exchange to a 1 bed room. Unfortunately, they only have smoking room. We took it, but regreat it as we opened the door. I couldn't stand the smell at all. Then, we checked in to another 1 bed room in the main tower 3rd. floor. The carpet is not clean, but the room size is acceptable. Ice machine is not working. Train noise was running at night. On next morning, the construction began at around 9:30am, and it's so loud that we could barely sleep. We didn't exchange the room, since this is the 3rd. room we got so far. On last morning, the construction began even earlier at 7-8am. The worst, our bathroom started drizzling w/ water leaking from the ceiling. As we checked out and complained to the manager, the front desk just said there's nothing they can do since we booked it through priceline.com. The manager didn't even come out to apologize. We'll never stay here again, nor book anything through priceline.

Reviews.Title: “Great at a good price”
Reviews.Author: camambert
Reviews.Content: Wonderful view on the Bay from our 10th floor. Great staff and great service. Avoid rooms facing the city as they are priced the same !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: iceprincess1204
Reviews.Content: My family and fiance stayed at the Holiday-Inn on the bay this past May before leaving on a cruise up the California Coast. The location of the hotel is perfect. Its about 5 minutes away from the airport, the cruise ship terminal is right across the street and its only a ten minute walk from Seaport Village. My fiance and I were coming in from a different state and got in earlier than my family, and were able to check into the room by just using my credit card, even though the reservation was in my moms name. Once my mom arrived she switched the credit card on the account to her own. It all worked out perfectly. The room was a 2 bedroom suite, with two queen beds in one room and a pull out couch in the other. The couch wasnt the most comfortable, but since we were only there for one night, it wasnt a problem. When we got to the room, we realized that we had an amazing view of the harbor, and were right across the street from where we would be getting on the ship. My fiance and I walked to the Seaport Village, which was only a ten minute walk, and had dinner at the Pier Cafe. Make sure you get the clam chowder. Its the best we have ever had. We watched the cruise ship come into port the next morning and after breakfast, we walked around and went on the pirate ship. When it was time to board the ship, we just packed up our luggage and walked right across the street. There is no complimentary breakfast, and the restuarants breakfast buffet is overpriced. We decided to walk to the Dennys, which was about ten minutes away. It was very good, and of course, the prices were great. Overall, it was an excellent choice for a one night stay before leaving for a cruise. I will certianly stay here again if we are leaving port from San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: OllieMonster
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay. We had South tower rooms on the top floor overlooking the bay and the view was spectacular. Shuttle service to the airport and Zoo was useful. The Deli on the front is very good for breakfast and cheap too. We liked the location, because we could use the shuttle or walk to the train/tram station - can understand other people complaining about the trains if you were on North tower though, as there is a lot of construction in the area. You can walk to Little Italy and to the Gaslight quarter - although I wouldnt walk back from Gaslight area again with young children. If we visit San Diego again we will stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in the United States!”
Reviews.Author: JulieAppleValley
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel in the United States. We stayed at the Holiday Inn San Diego on the Bay (for our second time) in mid-July, for a family vacation. This hotel is superb in all aspects: great location, spectacular views, friendly staff, quaint and clean rooms, accommodating front desk, helpful concierge. If I had to pick a place to get married again, it would be here. It doesn't have the amenities of a luxury hotel like the Radisson or Hyatt -- but it has the charm and accessibility (easy access to San Diego's top attractions) that make it an A+ hotel. The rates are high (the most I've ever paid for a hotel) but it was worth the splurge! Upon arrival, the Priority Club check-in attendant took extra special time to make sure we received a room that would meet or exceed our satisfaction. Our room was fabulous! We stayed in the South Tower with a breathtaking Bay View. This was an exceptionally special trip for me, as I was vacationing with my children, who are teens, and growing up quickly. The Holiday Inn San Diego on the Bay played a big role in making our summer vacation such a wonderful experience and huge success. Thank you Holiday Inn -- you're the best hotel in the United States, and I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Need Rest!”
Reviews.Author: jbigwater
Reviews.Content: I stayed at tis hotel due to the great location. The reason for my trip was business related. I had a city view room in the main tower and thought the room was OK. As mentioned the location is great for viewing the sites around the bay area. Once back in my room I was awakened by the train at 5:20am, I finally fell back to sleep around 6:30am then was woken again by a hammering noise in the room above me. It sounded like they were removing tiles. I got in late the night before due to travel and wound up with a couple hours of sleep. Also, the TV remote and coffee maker did not work. I requested a new room for the next night and was pleased by the accomodating front desk. The room I stayed at next was in the south tower and nice. I was out late with a customer this night. I settled in and thought that I would get a good nights sleep, unfortunately the air conditioning had a terrible rattle so the good night sleep was out of the question. I could not wait until I got on my airplane so I could finally sleep. The location is great and the staff was nice.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: OCTraveler64
Reviews.Content: Not sure what I was thinking, but I did not read the reviews for this hotel before I booked it. Finally, I did read them, but only after it was too late to cancel my reservations. So, I prepared myself accordingly. I used the self-parking ($20). One part of the parking structure was filled with construction material (they are still updating their rooms). The structure could have been cleaner (floor and smell). The front desk was friendly and helpful. I reserved a bay view room. After I inquired, they were able to move my room from the 2nd floor to the 4th floor in the main building, however, both rooms were next to the elevator (which I read was extremely noisy). The room was small, but clean, with a neutral decor (and popcorn ceiling). No refrigerator or microwave. The bathroom was a fair size, but the vanity area was very small. The shower head had adequate pressure. As for noise, throughout my two-night stay, I heard the elevator only twice. I found the walls to be thick and insulating, however, the front door, although sturdy, did not stop much of the hallway noise (not sure if this is by design). The sliding glass door needed to be upgraded. It did an OK job at reducing the street traffic noise and most of the bay horns, but I had to lean a chair against it to make a good seal against the fixed part of the window. Being on the bay side of the main building, I did not hear the train horns; but outside of the building, they are loud; also the cruise line horn is very loud (but does not blast much and not at night), and there is a tall ship that shoots its cannons during its tour around the bay (actually, very cool to see). Housekeeping was responsive for a call for extra bath towels. The hotel pub's food was good, and little expensive. And Ruth's Chris Steak House had very friendly service and great food, although it was very expensive. Within walking distance were my destination, USS Midway (about a 7 minute walk), and Seaport Village (about a 12 minute walk). I had a good experience at this hotel; it has a good location and good view of the bay. I would stay there again, depending on my needs, but I would probably try another hotel nearby first (just to see what it was like). Also, Anthony's Fish Grotto restaurant partially blocks the view of the bay, especially from the main building, so the higher room, the better the view.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: meharizona
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn on The Bay for one night Aug 5th. We were concerned after we read the reviews about the condition of the rooms, the staff and noise. We found the staff to be very friendly and helpful. My husband was celebrating a birthday and they greeted him with a song, wine and bought us breakfast. We had a bay view which was beautiful. We could hear the train when we where on the balcony but found the room to be quiet. We would definately staff at this property in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Good, not Great!”
Reviews.Author: golfbear
Reviews.Content: We are Priority Club Members and we stayed in the main hotel on the 14th floor. All of the rooms were recently refurbished which was nice. Why spend all that money on refurbishing the rooms and leave popcorn celings? It still looked outdated. We paid $239.00 a night and had a beautiful view of the harbor. The first two nights were fine, then we came back after a day at the zoo and noticed the maid didnt dust or vacuum the carpeting, then we noticed coffee cups were dirty, a dirty cup wasnt taken out of our room to be cleaned. They didnt replace toilet paper. My husband complained and the hotel staff were on it. They seemed quite mortified that the room wasnt cleaned properly. We were given one nights stay free. As for the noise level, I can't complain, it didnt bother us one bit. If you decide to stay here, I would not recommend the south tower, we had to do some laundry and the tower has not been refurbished and it is unsightly to say the least. Avoid it if you can. Stay in the main tower. The pool area is small, but nice and the pool is heated. Staff were very helpful, hats off to William! They have movies on demand, and because my husband and I are not nightlife people, we watched a movie every night while having cocktails. The movies are expensive, but worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Stay for the $$”
Reviews.Author: Califunia
Reviews.Content: This is a pretty nice Holiday Inn. The rooms were nice and clean, the shower/tub worked great ( I have been in some where this was awful and with two kids that really blows). Everything in the room worked great, no complaints. The view was really nice, we had a bay view in the tower. It is a little noisy but to be expected when facing a harbor where ships dock. We liked listening to the ship horns. When you close your sliding door and drapes the noise was not bad, we all slept fine. The lobby is nice, the staff was very helpful. They were right on it when we asked for extra towels, etc. The room service however is not that great. Would not recommend you spend your money there! It got there in average time but the kids milk was room temperature (yuk!) the salad looked and tasted like it had been set out for three days. The pub in the lobby was not good either. The staff dosen't seem to care much about serving you unless you get up and talk to the manager. Not only was that the case with us but we took note of several other tables having the same issue. There is a little bakery by the South Tower that has great breakfast food and good prices. Much better deal than the hotel pub. Even though the kids eat free at the hotel, we spent over $10 less at this place. Parking cost is a bummer but that is the same everywhere. The pool looked nice and well maintained but we didn't have time to use it. The decor of the rooms is a little outdated but this is easily overlooked. They even comped us a day of parking cost because of our problems with the food service. There is a Ruth Chris Steakhouse on the grounds that was a definite +! They may be pricey but are worth it! Overall we had a great time and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good experience”
Reviews.Author: cookieladyMesa
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel over the 4th of July. I was getting ready to get in the shower and realized that there was no soap or shampoo. Thank goodness we had some. I complained that morning when we were checking out and was asked why we did not call down and have them bring us some up. You would figure when you pay $250.00 a night for a room you should not have to do that. I told her I was ready to get in the shower. Why should I have to get dressed call down to the desk and wait till someone brought it up to me. There was no compensation of any type given not even "I am sorry". I did email the corp office and never even got a reply from them. It looks like I will be spending my money on any other hotel but the ones connected to the Holiday Inn Chain Cheryl Misch Mesa AZ

Reviews.Title: “Ok, not a great experience”
Reviews.Author: Travelwithmum
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Holiday Inn for 3 nights at the end of June, beg of July. Our stay was ok, the hotel is large and in 3 separate towers, one of which that our room was located in, is not connected to the main hotel at all, its across a courtyard next to the car park and this did feel a little unsafe at night, for 2 women alone. The room was dated and our lavatory also broke on the first day. We had to ask twice and wait a good few hours for it to be fixed, they were apologetic though, in fact most of the staff were very helpful and friendly. However one of the concierge whom I'm not sure I should name, is quite possibly in the wrong job, she took personal offence to us not asking her advice when we were looking for a restaurant to book and was very rude to us, with a general air of disdain. The hotel is in a good location, although quite a long walk to the main shops and restaurants in the Gaslamp District. If I happen to be in San Diego in the future I would not choose to stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Location can't be beat”
Reviews.Author: Handoverfist11
Reviews.Content: I loved this place and my stay there was great! The location and view of the bay was amazing. The staff was always very helpful, The Elephant Castle pub was great and the rooms have a sorta retro cool about them. They were very clean and comfortable. The hotel is close to almost everything (walking distance to the Gaslamp, Seaport Village, etc.) Trolley access is also closeby. Overall, it was well worth the semi-high price of the room.

Reviews.Title: “unsafe and noisy!!”
Reviews.Author: OCRecruiters
Reviews.Content: The noise was horrible. The train was loud and you could hear other guests in the hotel as if they were in your room. The worst expierence was the pizza delivery man pounding on my childrens room at 1:30 in the moning. On recomendation from the hotel we ordered pizza from Broadway Pizza for our kids while we went out. They took our credit card info over the phone and delivered the pizza at 7:00. Apparently they wanted a copy of our drivers license as well as the credit card. The driver decided to come and get a copy after all his deliveries at 1:30 AM. He wouldn't leave until we called security. How did he get in, all entrances are supposed to be secured entrances. Needless to say our kids were so frightened they ended up sleeping in our room. So we ended up paying for 2 rooms and using 1. I wouldn't recomend this hotel for kids or anybody that wants to sleep!

Reviews.Title: “The best view in town”
Reviews.Author: stephanie07
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel... i stayed for more than a week, it has a great location next to the Bay, i mean really next to it, the best view in town, everybody keep saying that and now i know why, it was true, very beautiful... next to Santa Fe Train Station, Seaport Village, Horton Plaza, the Trolley stop, next to the best restaurant ever Ruth's Chris Stakehouse, also has anothers restuarants The Elephant and Hazelwoods Deli, very nice both of them... Also the Maritime Museum, i loved it! and the Harbor Cruises... In the concierge desk, the two ladies are very nice, i took a couple of tours there, i enjoyed soo mucH!! Also the hotel has a shuttle service to airport, and places like San Diego Zoo!! AmazinG! AwesomE! If you are in SD you have to go there, you'll love iT!! And if you get the chance go to Sea World too... Soo i liked very much the hotel, the people were really nice, the lobby, the lady that cleaned, room service, everybodY!! Very nice hoteL! Beautiful vieww! Excellent locatioN!! :D LOVE IT!! SAN DIEGO ROCKS! Great cityyy... Best vacations ever....

Reviews.Title: “noisy!”
Reviews.Author: anonPortland
Reviews.Content: I went to San Diego with my boyfriend, who was attending a conference at the Holiday Inn. When we attempted to check in at 2:30 pm, they said we couldn't check in until 3:00 pm. Staff was curt and didn't seem to care. We returned later that night and checked in. Indifferent treatment from staff. All in the all it was what I expected from the Holiday Inn, generally clean and pretty basic. But the noise was insane. The trains do go by during the night, as well as during the day. There is no way you can possibly sleep through it. While there were ear plugs in the bathroom (one pair), they are not sufficient to allow you a good night's sleep. The location is convenient, but you'll wind up spending some of your sight seeing time trying to catch up on your sleep. We were both exhausted after 3 nights at the Holiday Inn. If the conference wasn't being held there we would have switched hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Ok if you are going on a cruise, but...”
Reviews.Author: justloveholidays
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn prior to joining a cruise. I had read the previous reviews so had an idea that certain sides/towers were to be avoided, and thought I had paid extra for a bay view. We ended up with a room directly over the entrance canopy, next to the lifts, and the bay was indeed visible through the flags and buses pulling up - just. When I asked if there was a room higher up, I was met with the indifference mentioned so often in these reviews - in short, no way. We then went across the road for dinner in a fish restaurant which was hugely popular (although we couldn't for the life of us see why). However, somewhat jet lagged after our 11 hour flight, we left and headed for bed. Now, I would have thought we could have slept through most things that night, but this place IS REALLY NOISY. There was some horrendous and regular booming noise which at first sounded like a ship's fog horn, but after repeated opportunities to guess the source, sounded more like some kind of electric pump coming from inside the hotel. Add to this the lift noise, the outside noise from people arriving, airplanes, women screaming in delight at meeting each other in the coridor at 1.00pm and general air conditioning, toilet flushing, ... OK, you get the picture. Breakfast was a very strange affair in a mock British pub. For those of you familiar with the real thing, you will know they are not conducive to 'in the cold light of day' breakfasting. In fact, most British pubs should be avoided until well after mid-day, and preferebaly visited only in subdued lighting. The ambiance and decor was matched by the food. We became very British indeed (after all, it purported to be a British establishment) and exclaimed loudly when told they had no ordinary tea. Thistle, raspberry, dahlia cuttings, but no real tea. Fortunately, I recalled we had been left 2 tea bags by the coffee pot in the room (??) so I retrieved those and eeked them out in war-time fashion. The only good thing I have to say about this hotel is after breakfast, we were able to wheel our cases across the road and walk straight on to the ship, which we had seen arriving earlier. That part at least was very convenient. Though why on earth anyone would stay here who wasn't going on a cruise is beyond me. On our way home, we were delayed due to the late arrival of the ship. We missed our flights and had to stay a further night in San Diego. Needless to say we avoided the Holiday Inn like the plague. We ended up staying at the Sheraton ,closer to the airport. Other people in the same situation stayed at the Embassy Suites, Days Inn, etc - all equally convenient although perhaps a little more money in some cases, but worth the short taxi ride to the cruise pier and ten times nicer than this hotel. Take my advice - if you like to sleep at night, look elsewhere - there are loads of better options in walking distance of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great view, staff, price and location, but hard bed and very noisy”
Reviews.Author: judodude
Reviews.Content: This is a difficult review to write because this hotel had some GREAT positives and some BAD negatives. First the positives: 1. The price was very reasonable for the location. 2. The hotel was within walking distance of the train and trolley 3. The view from our bayside room was AWESOME. It's especially great if you're a boat-watcher and like to see all kinds of ships (military and civilian). 4. The staff was VERY friendly. 5. The room service breakfast was excellent. Now the negatives: 1. At about 3 AM, a train comes by the hotel and blows its horn and it sounds like it's right outside your window. We were on the opposite side of the tower away from the train and it still woke me up. 2. The building is NOISY. It's old, so the walls must not have been built with the latest soundproofing, so you can hear EVERY noise that's going on around you, especially at 3 AM when the train wakes you up and you're having a hard time falling back asleep. 3. The bed was HARD AS A ROCK. My back actually hurt after sleeping on it. The price, location, staff and view made this hotel nice, but the hard bed and bad soundproofing really detracted from the experience. Although I'll miss the great view, I'll probably not come to this hotel again just because my back couldn't take the bed again. PS - As I was checking out I found earplugs in the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location/Standard Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_Lady_2004
Reviews.Content: The location is the Best! It is right across the street from the Cruise Ships stand, Ferries, Tours and other attractions on the Bay. You can take the Ferry to Coronado Island cost is $6.00 round trip and then take the free shuttle to the Coronado Hotel to visit. .....Near the HI on the Bay on the corner maybe about half block away is a visitor’s center with lots of good information. If you like to walk early in the morning; Walking along the pier is great. Around the hotel are many restraints, Ruth Chris Steak House, Seafood Restaurant and other small eating places. You can walk to see the USS Midway and on to the Seaport Village with cute shop and restaurants. The hotel also offers free shuttle to many of these places, check with the concierge. The hotel also has a shuttle to and from the airport every 30 minutes (I think) The HI at the Bay is a standard Holiday Inn. Our room was cleaned but you could see the wear and tear on it .Our room on the 8th floor looked over the Bay. Many rooms have a balcony with 2 chairs and table for sitting. That along made the hotel alright for me. The view of the sun setting on the Bay was wonderful. I understand that there is renovation going on at the hotel........ The hotel staff was friendly and helpful,. all questions were answered courteously. There is free internet service at the hotel. It is located at the concierge’s desk, which is a good idea to me. You have to stand to use it. Therefore you don’t stay as long as if you were sitting. Others don’t have to wait as long to use computer. The lobby area was a little dark but a pleasant sitting area. This is family hotel also; because of the children eat free breakfast in the restaurant. We had a great time! I would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Super location & excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: ManinCharlotteNC
Reviews.Content: The room was very clean and comfortable. The elevators were quick. Pleasant staff. Super location near a lot of things. This place is just a short drive from the airport, and that is a plus because it did not take long to ride the free shuttle provided by the hotel. Valet parking was courteous and prompt. The hotel exceeded expectations. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location for Cruise”
Reviews.Author: JA/IRBolton
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights prior to going on a cruise to Mexico. It is a great location to get the ship, just in front of terminal and this was the reason we stayed here. The free hotel shuttle worked well from the airport. The hotel offers good basic rooms. very comfy bed. The downside to the hotel is the noise levels, ear plugs provided!! WIFI did not work very well, either poor signals or down totally. Hotel very 1960's could do with some serious money spending updating sound proofing etc. If you get a good rate worth staying however do feel a little overpriced. San Diego very compact city easy to get around and a great place to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: travelwiz13
Reviews.Content: My review will sound very similar to previous reviews. I booked through Priceline for a Friday and Saturday night weekend stay and got a $99 rate for a standard two double bed room with a city view. Check-in was ok, but staff was rather curt. Had trouble with priority club membership. Other staff throughout rest of stay was OK to good. Was placed in "North Tower." City facing rooms are probably as good as the $40 extra bayside rooms. At night, the view of the bay is unimpressive and because there are no walls separating each balcony, the city view is expansive and nice. Also, train noise will wake you up on the city side, but so will cruise ship horns on BOTH sides (they place one pair of earplugs in each room in the bathroom). My room was very worn. The handle on the bed stand fell off when I first tried opening it--making opening and shutting the drawer a real challenge. Wallpaper was patched in several places and stained in several places (quite visible). Carpeting was also stained in several places. Blankets had some crusty stains as well. Sheets were clean. Beds were OK---nothing like the high quality beds most chains have put in their hotels. Free wireless internet is one plus--especially given Holiday Inn still proves no free breakfast. Parking was rather outrageous at 20/night for self-parking. In a nutshell, this Holiday Inn is an example of why many people are abandoning the chain for Hampton Inns and Courtyards. It is old, worn and tired.

Reviews.Title: “Find somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: Gatorjmh
Reviews.Content: This place was a big disappointment. It is conveniently located, but for the price we paid ($210 a night) find somewhere else. There are many hotels in the area. Holiday Inn said they updated two years ago, but I don't know what they updated. The rooms are small and sparse. The best thing that happened there was that they let us leave after one night and not have to stay for the the two we originally booked.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic sunset view”
Reviews.Author: Delalma
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location. That's about it. This older hotel has seen better days. We got a non-smoking room that smelled of smoke as soon as we walked in. There was even a small cigarette burn on the floor. The wallpaper was scratched and dated. The bedding was not so clean (lipstick on the over-worn bedspread). The mattresses were saggy and the pillows were hard as rocks. The front desk was way too understaffed and, as a result, were not so eager to please. When I reported the conditions of the room, the response was like, "Oh, well."

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly average 2.5 star experience”
Reviews.Author: GoodPlanet
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn on the Bay had everything we needed for our three night stay in San Diego... it was clean, secure, convenient and had the added convenience of free WiFi internet. The only negatives that come to mind are that the property doesn't in my experience deserve three stars.... two and a half stars would be generous! The $18 parking is insanely expensive, and the location... unless you are boarding a cruise ship ... is not too convenient. The walk to the gaslamp quarter is a good six blocks walk through an endless expanse of train tracks and parking lots. However, the staff were polite and efficient without exception, and I might consider this property again at Priceline rates.

Reviews.Title: “Front Office/staff need to learn more.”
Reviews.Author: CHSJakarta
Reviews.Content: Iam from Jakarta-Indonesia and come here for holiday. The location of the Hotel is great, near 2 everywhere. At the time we check-in, the font staff give me a room at the main hotel 3rd floor with a harbour view. Ops...the room is small and old. Then i asked to move into the clean and higher room but they only can provide it on the 2nd day. We moved on the wing side hotel 11th floor. What make me surprised is when we checked out, the additional charges of US$ 40/night have to be paid (???) whereas it was not informed before. If i know i have to pay more for US$ 40/each nite,of course i would not stay at this Hotel because the service is not good at all and nothing special at this hotel. The front office/staff need to learn more how to make guest enjoy stay at this Hotel because Hotel is a place for fun & take a rest.

Reviews.Title: “sad case for holiday inn”
Reviews.Author: leyrad
Reviews.Content: Spent new years eve 2006. For price, I should have gone to a cheap motel. Cleanliness is not a premium. Carpet stains throughout hotel. Employees only pride is 600 rooms. The tiny bathroom has molds. Lobby restroom you have to close door to stall before you can turn around. Eighteen dollars to self park with anyone off the street having access to vehicles. With the amount of dogs in hotel it was like a pet shop. This is a total embarrassment to the chain.

Reviews.Title: “Not recomended as a Comic Con Hotel”
Reviews.Author: luv2trav
Reviews.Content: First off, this in not the worst hotel ever, that honor goes to the Allen Lee in Washington DC, go ahead read the reviews for a laugh. Anyways, we stayed here 5 days for the Comic Con convention last July. All in all, not too bad. We got a room with a sea view when our first room had a food tray outside of it and someone's things inside when we opened the door. If you plan to use the self-park as we did, be careful where you step. The entire lower self-park garage is covered with cat feces, and had an unbelievable smell. I hope they took care of the problem, because the pressure wash we saw did not. Also, if you plan to avoid the cats by parking upstairs, exposed to the sun, be sure you can go down stairs as the only safe way down is the stairs. We had our two children asleep in strollers and were not happy about the lack of a pedestrian ramp. For future comic con attendees, be careful about the shuttle. There is a stop right outside the hotel and it worked great for two days. On Friday, Saturday, and Sunday however the shuttles were too full to pick up passengers and just drove by. We missed the Lost panel waiting for a bus for 40 minutes before we decided to drive and park at the Petco stadium lot. VERY disappointing. We had to drive and use the Petco lot for three days. It was that or pay a pedicab because the trolleys were also full and did not pick up passengers. These were just our experiences and should not be taken as a complete diss of this hotel. The location and view were very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff & good shuttle service”
Reviews.Author: Bernie73
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Holiday Inn On The Bay for 4 nights. Some of the reviews are right about the noise levels (if you get a room at the back of the hotel)...tooting train horns in the early hours of the morning so make sure you bring some ear plugs! The location of the hotel was ideal and very scenic with the Maritime museum almost opposite.
