The Sante Fe station is within walking distance and Horton Plaza and Seaport Village around 10 minutes from the hotel. The hotel staff were friendly especially the staff in the Elephant & Castle pub which serves great food! The hotel offers a free shuttle service to and from the airport as well as the main attractions which saved us alot of money. Ou hotel room was clean and housekeeping was very efficient. We would definitely stay at this hotel again for it's location but maybe request a room at the front of the hotel for the views and reduced noise levels!

Reviews.Title: “DON'T STAY HERE!!!”
Reviews.Author: GMS123
Reviews.Content: I have to admit this was probably the worst hotel I have ever stayed at. (1) At check-in my priority club reservation was lost and it took nearly 30 minutes to locate my reservation using other means. (2)On the hotel website there is no mention of the hotels proximity to the nearby rail line that woke me up every morning at 4am since this is when the Amtrak pulls into town blaring its horn several dozen times. (3) Called for room service two nights in a row and no one ever answered the phone, thus no food for me. (4) pulled into the valet parking area and was met with blank stares from the valet staff as I stepped out of my vehicle, I actually had to wait several seconds and then ask if someone was going to park my car.(5) Wi-Fi in the room is not a convenience since not everyone has Wi-Fi internet access, a hardline hookup would be preferred and I beleive would better serve your guests. (6) At the bar "Elephant and Castle" that is attached to the hotel, I sat down at the bar and waited 15 minutes and was never served, is it typical to not approach customers when they sit down for service. (7) And the topper... on the day I checked out a crazy woman was lurking around the valet area and hotel lobby yelling at people in Korean and the staff seemed "unconcerned".

Reviews.Title: “The Best Location!”
Reviews.Author: tamtrouble
Reviews.Content: I was really scared when I booked this hotel and then read the latest reviews of the Holiday Inn on the Bay. I was so careful to call the hotel directly and request a quiet, bayside room, double beds (as we were traveling with our boys ages 9, 7 and 2yrs) non-smoking. The reviews were accurate about the front desk help. The lady that checked us in was not friendly AT ALL. Despite our smiles and happy demeanor. (maybe she had a really bad day, who knows.) But, our room was GREAT! Now, there are 3 buildings at the Holiday Inn. The main tower (5 levels), the North Tower (behind the main tower & further away from the bay) and the south tower which is directly south of the main building. We were told that the south tower is the best because of ocean views, and quiet from the trains. They were right. We had the 5th floor #581 right next to the Elevator. The elevator got a bit noisy, so we did use earplugs. Other than that, there was no sound from the trains. We heard an occasional airplane, but the view made it so worth it. The room was clean....on the small side, but we were still able to fit a crib (provided by the hotel free of charge) without a problem. The bathroom is tiny, but sufficient. We basically slept in our rooms and admired the sunsets from our balcony...other than that...we were too busy sightseeing because so much is within walking distance! Ralphs supermarket was on G St. & 1st Ave. (5 min drive) 7-eleven was in Little Italy just 3 blocks away on India St., Transit Trolley to Old Town was 3 blocks away on Kettner and Broadway ($2 each way per person), Seaport Village 1/2 mile south on Harbor Dr. Check out the pics I've included after this review. We would definitely consider staying here again because of the location. (but wouldn't pay more than $130 a night) because parking is $18 a day. (although, metered parking on the street is free from 6pm-8a.m.) I hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “What a location, What a view”
Reviews.Author: JZKUERVO
Reviews.Content: Stayed for the weekend in September. We stayed here in August and I see why other people may have had problems. The hotel was extremely busy during our first stay. September was a lot quieter. Not to mention the weather was a lot more pleasant. We have never experienced such a hot stay in San Diego during August. We like this place because they have free wireless internet--this let's me catch up on some work while my wife naps. We always take morning walks along the bay and walk to a new restaurant each meal. The Gaslamp and Little Italy both have a variety of great restaurants. Make sure you take advantage of the free hotel shuttle to and from the Airport. We didn't do this the first time and had to pay $18 to park our rental car. This time we walked, used the Trolley system, and the hotels free shuttle service to the Zoo. Oh yes, make sure you spend the extra dollars for a Bay view room. We did this on our second visit and it was well worth it. Next time we're going to try the Ruth Chris Steakhouse next door. I think they purposely pump out the smoke from their kitchen....It smells delicious. Anyway give this place a try. I think you'll be surprised. By the way the pictures that other people have posted on this site give this place more justice than those on the hotel web site.

Reviews.Title: “Bad service”
Reviews.Author: j3llyb3an
Reviews.Content: Three of us stayed here for one night. The location seemed great as the hotel overlooked the bay. However, once we got into the hotel lobby to check in, we were disappointed with the staff's unfriendly and unhospitable attitude. But that didn't dampen our spirits as much as the treatment we received when we asked the concierge woman for help with navigating the city for a good restaurant to go to that evening. She was very rude and snobbish with her response and didn't seem to care what we wanted. Terrible attitude! The overall decor of the hotel was below average for the price and class we were expecting. The bed mattresses were too old and soft and the rooms were smaller than we expected. Didn't have a good night's sleep. As for convenience, there are only 3 restaurants around the hotel, which were either too pricey or too crowded. This hotel was not as good as expected for the location and the price that we had paid. Better off staying somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Not happy”
Reviews.Author: TWATSONCT
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I stayed here and the hotel was ok, not like the picture pool was not very good, had to pay $22.00per night to park valea which was not listed on website. $18.00 a night self park. The attendant night time was not very accomadating he was nasty and it seemed that we were bothering him to have our vehicle parked when we returned in early morning hours to the hotel when it specificaly states 24 hour partking. Hotel restaraunt very expensive as well as room service. Pool area very plain, cannot bring food or drink in makes for a problem if you want to stay at the pool for the day. Not a place i would recommend for a long stay for the price you can do better. TERRY WATSON CONNECTICUT

Reviews.Title: “No worries”
Reviews.Author: FamilyTravelers3
Reviews.Content: I almost cancelled our reservation after reading a few bad reviews on this site. If you're visiting for only a few nights, the Holiday Inn On the Bay is perfectly fine. I would recommend only reserving a room with a bay view. We did not hear the trains at all during the night. The bed was very comfortable. We reserved a room with a bay view and this is what we received. It was clean, comfortable, the staff was pleasant, and the location is great. Both the cafe and restaurant offer casual dining with patio seating. Kids of guests eat free. If you're planning to simply visit the downtown area, it's a twenty minute walk along the boardwalk to Seaport Village. The Coronado Ferry departs every twenty minutes or so right across from the hotel (nominal fee). You can also catch the trolley ($5/day kids under 6 free) or bus (sdcommute.com) within 3 blocks and make your way to the zoo or Seaworld, Mission Beach, as an example. We rented a deuce coupe(2 seater low rider where two small children can sit off the back side) from Wheels of Fun located within the same property. Don't bother renting a car unless you plan to venture beyond Mission Beach. You'll only end up paying for gas and parking. Check in with any housekeeping needs before 6pm. Airport shuttle included. Perfect for cruise departures--right across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away”
Reviews.Author: mamoun_l
Reviews.Content: I won't go back to this Holiday Inn, it had a very unpleasant experience while I stayed there for a conference. The good location is the only factor for this hotel, service was terrible not mentioning that they charge $$$ for the rooms. The rooms are pretty basic, no refrigirator, basic cable TV nothing exceptional. The hotel lobby is dirty with poor decor and bad customer service. My room was located in the south tower, to get there I had to get out of the hotel and walk with my suitcases to another building outside, it wasn't fun at all.

Reviews.Title: “Location good, everything else bad!”
Reviews.Author: Brillo51
Reviews.Content: I am normally very satisfied with Holiday Inns but this is an exception! The hotel is well located but has no other points in its favour. Reception staff were rude and unhelpful, we were originally allocated a room which was occupied when we entered and when we returmed to reception we were clearly regarded as an inconvenience. Noise from traffic, the railway line, the nearby airport and the naval air station is very intrusive. Rooms are in need of updating, car parking is scandalously expensive and many rooms are a long way from reception and other facilities. A hotel to avoid and one which the Holiday Inn chain should be ashamed to be associated with!

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at the Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: wepagirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from a 7 day stay at the Holiday Inn. We arrived on a Friday night and the Hotel was completely booked for the weekend. We had requested a bayview room in the north tower when we made the reservation. Having stayed there 3 years ago we knew that the higher you are on the north tower the better the view. However, since they were booked for the weekend they told us to check again on Sunday morning. In the meantime, we had a south tower room on the 5th floor. It wasn't bad but the bayview was not as great. The hotel has complimentary wireless internet connection which worked great for us. On Sunday we were able to move to room 1463 in the north tower which had spectacular views of the bay. It was a corner room and more updated than the first one we had but it was smaller. We experienced great service from the front desk and our housekeeping maid. Our only complaint was the room service. We had to call twice to get softer pillows and twice to get more hangers never received the hangers. The noise from the airport did not bother us but we are used to living near the airport so I can see how this might bother some people. You must reserve a bayview if you want to avoid the train noise since the cityview rooms all face the train station. We recommend the following places for meals: Elephant & Castle if you want waiter service but the best bet for breakfast in my opinion is Hazelwoods Deli right underneath the south tower and next to Ruth Chris'. They serve breakfast from 6 to 11 a.m. and it's very affordable especially for large families. We had dinner several times at Anthony's Fishette and once at Anthony's Fish Grotto right across the street. We also recommend Old Town Mexican Cafe. They have the best Margaritas and good food. Overall, we enjoyed our second stay at the Holiday Inn and would recommend to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Beware-- Trains”
Reviews.Author: McArthur3
Reviews.Content: This was the 7th and last hotel we used during our holiday in California, and it was way and above the worst. Despite paying for a room with an ocean view we were allocated a room to the back of the hotel over looking the parking lot. The room was on the 7th floor and designated a smoking floor -- this despite our booking for a non-smoking floor. Complaining gets you nowhere in this hotel- you'd be better talking to the wall. The bathroom was tiny, one of the lights in the bathroom did not work so it was dark and the toilet was blocked.The room smelled of cigarettes and was in deperate need of re-decoration. However the best bit was still to come -- the back of the hotel backs onto the Railway, and a crossing, so every night and during the night you get woken up with the warning bells of the crossing and then the blaring warning horns of the Amtrack train -- what a joke expecting people to sleep through this. The front of the hotel may have beautiful views but the people allocated to the back are treated like second class citizens. The 'British' style pub at the entrance is tacky and over done. To top it off when we received our chek out bill they tried to charge us for the room again, this despite it being paid for up front!! All in all we would not use this place again or recommend this hotel to anyone. Given the great holiday we had and the rooms allocated in other hotels it was a pity we had end with this one as it did not match up in any form.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Terrible Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Holiday Inn on the Bay as the last stop of a long road trip. What a disappointment! The layout of the hotel is bizarre (multiple buildings), parking is expensive, and worst of all, the customer service is terrible. Everyone, from the valet to the restaurant staff was unfriendly. After sitting down in the restaurant, we left because of the incompetent waiter, and then tried to order room service. I called to order, but the phone rang continuously for several minutes without anyone answering! I complained to the front desk, whose solution was giving the number of a local pizza place for delivery, which took 90 minutes to arrive. Also, the ATM was not in service, but the staff didn't seem to care. The only saving grace of the hotel is the location, which is on Bay and less than ten minutes from the airport. Overall, this hotel was a tremendous let down. You can do much better for the price in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: bertha3
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from San Diego. We stayed 5 days with friends in La Jolla and wanted to stay in the city for a couple of days. After reading reviews of all hotels and not sure which area we wanted to stay we decided on the Holiday Inn on the Bay. It was the perfect location. We did not want to rent a car but wanted to see the sights. We walked eveywhere or took the shuttle. We felt safe and the view from our 12th floor room was spectacular. The staff was very helpful and our room was very comfortable. When we return next year we will again stay here. t

Reviews.Title: “Great before a cruise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Holiday Inn at the cruise port in San Deigo before our cruise in April. The location was wonderful. I requested an ocean view room and we woke on the morning of our cruise to our ship practially in our room. We were able to just walk across the street at boarding time although the hotel provided a shuttle service. We have never stayed at a more convientient place before a cruise. The hotel was just a hotel but certainly clean and convient to places to eat. Would stay there again and recommend it to anyone cruising out of that port for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location and Friendly Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Roofie
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 4-night stay at the Holiday Inn on the Bay with my two teenage sons. As some of the reviews indicate, the hotel rooms are pretty basic and could do with a bit of an update -- but overall, the stay was great. We checked in on Thursday night before the Memorial Day Weekend -- and it didn't start out great -- they couldn't find our reservation. I'm a Priority Club Member (Holiday Inn rewards program) -- so thankfully, they were able to pull my reservation from their cancelled reservations (somehow, when I called to confirm, their new reservation department thought I was cancelling). No problem -- they checked us in and actually gave us an upgrade (sign up for the reward program -- I received a bayview room on the 10th Floor of the tower [connected to the lobby] for $145 night.) Every single person that worked at the hotel from the front desk folks to the valet parking attendants to the cleaning crew at the pool were friendly and helpful. The parking cost is $18/day for self-park or $22/day for valet parking. All with in/out service. We did have an issue with our drain in the shower (didn't work properly) -- fixed promptly, and an issue with our front door -- you had to pull really hard to make it shut. I met others at the hotel who were complaining about their room locks as well -- so just be careful and double check that it's locked when you leave. There is a restaurant in the hotel lobby -- the Elephant and Castle -- very good food, reasonable prices and fast. The kids loved that they could play pool in the bar area until 9:00pm. There is also a well-stocked gift shop that is open from 6:00am until 11:00pm each day. The location of the hotel is ideal. You are right on the harbor -- with easy access to I-5 and downtown via city streets. The view is spectacular and although you can notice the noise if you're sitting on the balcony (yes, the planes and trains do make noise pretty regularly) I didn't notice too much interruption during the night (plus the hotel provides ear plugs, if you're inclined.) Also, one strange thing was that the balconies of the hotel are interrconnected -- hard to explain, except that there is no real divider between them and what does divide them could be easily climbed over, so you need to be conscious of this and not leave your balcony door unlocked and also make sure you are dressed appropriately if you go out on the balcony and don't want to be surprised by your neighbor sitting two feet away with a very small fence separating you. The pool was heated, although not enough for me! The kids loved it. It was clean and plenty of towels. Mainly populated with business folks. Also, there is free internet service throughout the hotel, and a computer with a printer in the lobby for $5.95/15 minutes. Although we had a rental car, there was numerous shuttles to the airport, zoo, Horton Plaza and the Seaport Village -- we didn't use them, but the shuttles were always around and others seemed to be using them. Also an exercise room that was open the same hours as the gift shop. We would definitely return to the Holiday Inn on the Bay -- I had no complaints and you couldn't ask for a better location.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms need some updating - But you can't get any closer to the pier!”
Reviews.Author: hardingk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night pre-cruise. The location was great as the hotel was literally right across the street from the pier. We checked out of our room and just crossed the street & boarded the ship. The rooms however are another story. We requested a bayview non-smoking double. We were given a room in the south tower on the third floor. We were right behind the elevator shaft and could hear them all the time. We were also given an adjoining room which spefically said that I did not want. There was a 1 inch crack under the door and the person in the other room was smoking (in a non-smoking room!) and it came into our room. We had to put the bedspread on the floor to block it. The rooms could use a lot of updating and the south tower is not adjacent to the main building. One positive though was the Elephant & Castle Pub was the restaurant in the hotel. I highly recommend you eat there if you stay at this hotel. The food was great & reasonable! We ended up eating lunch there both the day we checked in and before we boarded the ship!

Reviews.Title: “Great location - average hotel”
Reviews.Author: mjpileggi
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel April 21-22nd. I arrived at the hotel around 1pm, which check-in was pretty fast and easy. I was unable to get a room facing the bay, so I got a room facing the city (#1084). I still had some nice views, but man, those Amtrak trains are noisy in the middle of the night! This hotel is located just a few miles from the airport. My room (and probably most others) needs updating. The carpet needs replacing, but it wasn't disgusting to walk on. I had a nice, comfortable king bed (brough my own pillow), with the regular hotel amenities. It was nice to sit on the balcony, although it was a little chilly. I would have prefered to stay in the main building, but I believe the hotel was fully booked. The cruise ship terminal is directly across the street from the building I stayed in, so it's perfect for cruisers (pre or post cruise). Next to the lobby is a bar/restaurant, which I had a drink one night. Pretty nice place. If you want to splurge, there's Ruth Chris Steakhouse. That place was filled everytime I walked by it. I liked the location in that it's a short walk to the Midayway for touring, the Seaport village and a few good restaurants (Fish Market, San Diego Pier Cafe, Busters, and Anthony's Fish Grotto - Busters is good for breakfast, Pier Cafe for seafood at reasonable prices). I also had the opportunity to take the ferry over to Coronado, then the shuttle bus to the hotel. I was able to walk from the hotel to the Gaslamp quarter (about 25 minutes) but took a taxi back to the hotel. Service was great, both with those at the reception desk, as well as housekeeping. Overall, I would stay here again if I could get a room facing the bay. There are lots of other hotels in the area too. Monica

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad stay”
Reviews.Author: liketotravel89
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for one night April 20th. We arrived at around 2 and checedk in. The hotel had a nice restaurant(we did not eat there, so can't comment on food quality). When we checked in we were given a room on I believe it was the 9th floor. The 4 elevators were all working, but dated. The room was an alright room, nice for 1 night, but not sure i would stay there for a week. Nothing wrong with the room other then being kind of plain. We had a view of the city from our nice bay window, with slider. We could see planes landing at San Diego airport from our balcony. The noise from the trains was noticable during the night, as was the city noise. The pool area was nice, full of sunlight. No jucuzzi in the pool area which was about the only downside of the pool area. The beds were somewhat comfy but not as comfy as others I've slept in. The staff was pretty nice, the guy who checked us in was great, ut the lady at the consiarge desk, who we asked a question to later that day wasn't the friendliest person ever, but wasn't mean. Great if you're staying in the city for a ballgame. alking distance to Petco park, nd lots of restaurants in the Gaslamp district. Good for a 1 or 2 night stay, ut I wouldn't stay there for a week.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the San Diego-On The Bay”
Reviews.Author: PhilaFan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the SD Holiday Inn on the Bay for six nights. Check in was great we arrived at 11:30 am and they let us check in right away. Our room was perfect!! We had a Bay Room which was right in the middle of the cruise ships and the Star of India Museum. Our room was on the tenth floor (1051). Everyone in the hotel was so nice. The pool was great after a long day of site seeing. We ate at the Elephant Castle restaurant good menu, and very tasty food, plus kids eat free. I have read many reviews on this hotel and can see where some noise from the train can be a factor but not in our case. I would recommend this hotel to all. The location was very convenient. We did not need a car the shuttle bus took us to most of our locations, and if we did have to take a taxi it was always cheap. I can’t wait to book this hotel for next year!!

Reviews.Title: “It's a Holiday Inn, all right”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you like train horns at 1:00 in the morning, this is the place for you. While this hotel has a great location right in downtown San Diego, the noise, the $22 a night parking, and the somewhat run down condition of the hotel really turned me off. For not much more money, you could stay at the Hyatt five blocks down the street and be in the lap of luxury. This place is definitely not worth the money, even with the deal we got from Priceline. I don't think this place is any worse than other Holiday Inns, but there are much better choices in downtown San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “old smelly rooms”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: the rooms smelled old and the covers and sheets looked like they were from the 70s way too expensive for the type of room

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: G8R
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location for visiting downtown San Diego. I was there for business near Horton Plaza. The walk up Broadway was brisk and a good wake-up before business meetings. The view of San Diego Bay was wonderful from my ninth floor room. I did not visit any tourist attractions, but it is very easy to get around San Diego by car, so this would still be a good location for that kind of visit. The room was not anything special, but it was adequate. There seemed to be a constant whine from air-conditioning equipment outside, but I got used to it after the first night. The valet parking folks were very helpful even though I told them I would park my own car. And I hated the $18.00 daily parking fee even though my company paid it.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel for a San Diego Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Virginislanddreams
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights pre-cruise. The hotel is a great starting point for all the local attractions. There is also a lot of great food within walking distance. The cruise port is across the street and the hotel offers free shuttle service. We stayed on the city side and had to contend with a train and common city noise. A room on the bay side would most likely be quieter and of course offer better views. The staff was kind and helpful, especially the valet parking staff. Next time we are in SD we will be booking our stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Room Smelled of Urine”
Reviews.Author: SmartGuy475
Reviews.Content: The occasional waft of the smell of urine/ammonia would occur when the A/C was on. They came in to deodorize it, but it did not work. I finally had to switch rooms as my eyes were burning. I asked for a room credit for one night, and never heard anything from the GM. Beware---

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Loved the Holiday Inn on the Bay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great. Staff was so helpful and friendly. We arrived late in the evening, around 10:30 or so, and were quickly picked up at the airport by the complementary hotel shuttle. Shuttle driver was great, took over with our luggage and we arrived at the hotel quickly, as it is only about 10 minutes away. Once at the hotel we were greeted with smiles and helpful information and checked in quickly. Since we had been traveling for about 6 hours they kindly gave us information on restaurants that were still open and gave us a booklet with coupons for numerous restaurants that would deliver. Room was nearly spotless and staff responded almost immediately when we asked for extra pillows. Beds were very comfortable. Towels were plentiful and snowy white and a large number of personal items were provided. We had a bay view room on the 10th floor with a balcony and the view was great. Hotel provides shuttle service to a couple of shopping areas and to the Zoo. Schedule is more than adequate to accommodate needs. Hotel far surpassed our expectations. Would stay there again if in San Diego. Food at the Elephant and Castle Restaurant/Bar at the hotel was first rate and reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Lorrie2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is certainly not the Hilton but has a lot of positive aspects. The rooms are clean and on the larger side. Rooms facing the bay have a great view up and down Harbor Drive, the U.S.S Midway south, the cruise ships directly in front and the airport north one mile. The glass elevator adds a special touch to the scenery. The Seaport Village (shops) is within walking distance (about 1/2 mile south). The Old Town Trolley (and information center) are about 1/4 mile south and provide a great tour for $30 pp ($29 pp at the information center). Some great dinner places include The Fish Market next to the Midway and Anthony's just across the street. Restaurants on the hotel grounds include Ruth Chris Steakhouse (expensive - dinner), and a pub-like restaurant(breakfast, lunch and dinner) called The Elephante and the Castle. There is also a deli serving an inexpensive breakfast and nice sandwiches. Negative aspects include the cost of the room and parking ($18 per day) but the convenience was worth it. This is an ideal hotel for pre and post cruise stays since the port is just across the street. Watching cruise ships come and go was actually very entertaining. Shopping for wine, beer and snacks was easily done at the Ralph's supermarket located on Market Street and 1st Ave. (free parking underneath). Horton Plaza is a shopping mall located behind Ralph's between Market Street and Broadway.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Koda
Reviews.Content: I took my mom down here for her 75th birthday. We had a 12th floor bay view room w/balcony and it was lovely. The room was very well decorated and comfortable and the view was terrific. I had informed the front desk about mom's bday and when we got back to the room from dinner we found that they had sent up a complimentary fruit basket! Service was great and we couldn't have had a better time. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, quiet”
Reviews.Author: Jekyll
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for 11/9,11/10 prior to going on a cruise. It could not have been more convenient as we were directly across the street from the pier where the ship docked and were able to walk there. It is across from Anthony's Grotto, a nice seafood restaurant and within walking distance of The Fish Market, another seafood restaurant. It was only a short walk to little Italy, which has a number of fine restaurants. We found the service to and from the airport to be excellent and as we arrived early, we were able to store our luggage at the hotel, prior to exploring San Diego. The hotel is close to the stop for the Old Town trolley, which is a very good way to orient one's self to San Diego. When returned from our cruise, we stayed an additional night and although we were at the hotel around 9:00 am we were able to check into our room. Altogether, a very good experience.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent choice.”
Reviews.Author: joolzb
Reviews.Content: After several forays into the hotels of San Diego on Trip Advisor we finally settled for the Holiday Inn on the Bay. We were so glad we did, it was first class all the way. Our room had the most fantastic view of the bay and the Star of India. The rooms where very comfortable and quite large enough for our 10 night stay. The Elephant & Castle was quite a home from home for us(an English style pub). We also ate at Ruths Chris Steak House, which though expensive was an enjoyable night out, with top class service. The hotel was clean and the staff courteous and attentive. We had room service several times and it was always speedy and of good quality. The hotel is in an excellent situation for all the tourist destinations. We got cabs for quite reasonable prices to both the zoo and Seaworld. Seaport Village is just along the road and a joy to visit. All in all we had a fantastic stay in a hotel that was perfect for our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Four Great Days”
Reviews.Author: Butterfly28613
Reviews.Content: Coming from North Carolina to combine a visit with an 88 year-old friend and to see the city in which he loves, we were pleasantly surprised at the friendliness of the staff and the convenience of location at the Holiday Inn on the Bay. Staff excels in service, helpfulness. The rooms were clean, although not overly large. Ask for a bay view room. South Tower, 5th. floor bay view with balcony afforded a magnificent view, day and night. Breakfast in the hotel Elephant & Castle Pub is outstanding...omlets and potatoes, french toast...best I'm ever eaten. Easy walking to tour posts, the ship Midway, and sailer Star of India. Near airport and easy access to all major attactions. Parking was $18 per day but for the convenience of location, location, I'd pay it again. On our next visit to San Diego, we will again stay at the Holiday Inn on the Bay.

Reviews.Title: “Cruisers delight! ”
Reviews.Author: siestaclaud
Reviews.Content: I had read many reviews about this hotel and was pleasantly surprised with this Holiday Inn. The best surprise was the location: VERY close to the cruise ships. We were closer to our ship than we were to the lobby of the hotel. We walked to Seaport Village for breakfast outside. The Old Town Trolley was right across the street. Bikes to rent in our building. Just a beautiful view of Coronado as well. This hotel is not posh. It is a pretty basic Holiday Inn. Front desk was nice and quick. Our room was actually very small. But it was clean with a great view/balcony and the location was perfect for cruisers. I highly recommend this location for a pre-cruise stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, good quality !! surprised !!”
Reviews.Author: maxxp
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Holiday Inn on the Bay for 2 nights in late July. Paid $85 plus fees on Priceline. Was VERY impressed at what we got for the price. Expected a regular Holiday Inn quality hotel, but got a very good hotel. The room was very spacious, clean and fairly modern. A nice balcony facing the pool with all basic amenities plus. Fitness facilities lacked a little, equipment was old and not that great but still fine for a breif workout. Basic pool, nothing special but fine for the little ones. Free internet in the lobby at the concierge desk for 5 mins or less. $18 for parking was a little steep but s little cheaper that the $22 at the Sheraton the nights before. did not eat at the hotel, but it has a decent looking and active Elephant and Castle pub, and a Ruth Chris right next door. Can't complain about the location, close to downtown and easy to drive around. Not sure if the same can be said if you don't have a car and using cabs/public transit, but with a car, it's a good location to Gaslamp, and much of San Diego. I would recommend this hotel and would rate it around a 7+ out of 10 stars. It's a good value hotel !! Enjoy !

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised how nice this hotel was given many negative reviews I had read about it. Yes, it is true that light rail and Amtrak both run about a block away from the hotel and during the day will hear them, but that was part of what was great about this location. San Diego has a very nice, vibrant downtown area. Gaslamp, Horton Plaza and Seaport Village are all within a mile of the hotel. The cruise ship terminal, the Midway Aircraft Carrier, historic ships port museum, cruise ship terminal and San Diego Bay Tour ships are all within walking distance. Let's talk about the service. I was treated great by everyone from the valets, front desk, housekeeping, ectt.. I arrived having car troubles. The concierge desk went over and beyond to try to solve my problem. The restaurant offered free meals to my young children and never treated me differently even though I was the only paying adult with three kids gettting free meals. The front desk treated me no differently even though I booked a discounted room on the internet. They even gave me a nicer room than I asked for with a great city view. If I have a negative about the hotel, it would probably be the plain and undersized pool and no hot tub. The parking charge of $18/day is obscene, although there is a large parking lot directly north of the hotel that only charges $5 a day on the weekend. This is a very nice hotel and is worth the $150 the hotel's website wants for it, but is a steal if you can get it for less than $100 a night on Priceline or Hotwire.

Reviews.Title: “San Diego Local review”
Reviews.Author: cm1000
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were able to get away from the kids for one night to celebrate our 15th wedding anniversary (thanks gma and gpa!). Being a busy holiday weekend, we decided to visit our own San Diego backyard. I am a native. I have always seen this hotel, but never stayed here. We checked in on Thursday, and were given a room on the 7th floor. I mentioned our anniversary, and next thing I knew, we were given a room on the TOP floor (14th) in the main tower over looking the bay - we had the corner room. Big thanks to the Hotel Regisrar! About 10 minutes after check in, the hotel sent us a complimentary bottle of sparkeling wine (Cal version of champagne). The view was AMAZING - we sat on the balcony, sipping our wine and watched the boats and ships sail across the bay, the planes land and take off at Lindburgh Field (San Diego Int'l Airport), and people walking along the boardwalk. The Star of India is right across the street, next to one of our favorite restaurants, Anthony's, where we ate dinner later that night. We did not use the pool, the parking is $18 per night, which may seem steep, but you have in and out priveledges. You can walk to 7-11, many restaurants (Jack in the Box, Anthony's, Little Italy) -there are numerous pedicabs to take you anywhere in Downtown - most of the pedicabbers work just on tips and will give you a great tour. We had a great time. The street traffic and airport add some "noise" but it is a white noise that didn't bother us at all. The view was worth the bayside price increase. Try to get above the 9th floor. Our room was CLEAN and had very new furnishings, carpet, curtains. We are already talking about our next visit. There was no noise coming from the other guest rooms (just the normal comings and goings). If you want peace and quiet, go camping. If you like walking and running along the boardwalk of the bay, eating seafood, visiting San Diego's great Maritime museums, and being close to many San Diego activities, this was a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your time!”
Reviews.Author: surfmama3
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn on the Bay, was very disappointing. The front desk was rude and unaccomidating. You pay a ridiculous fee to park, which is so vaguely mentioned in the description, you don't realize they mean over $100 for 5 days!! Our room had a foul odor, not very clean, and VERY small. Elevator took forever! The in-house resturants were horrible. The "elephant" room, (unsure of exact name) had the worst breakfast buffet I have ever had! Phone fees were unusually high and unlisted in the hotel info. Room Service was fresh, and about the only posotive point about staying there. Not recommended for children!! POOL was very COLD and SMALL!! *Request an ocean view, (at least a $40 per day upgrade), or else you will have a balcony over looking the boiler room and the garbage. Nowhere near a beach, although the board walk is beautiful. No nearby shopping. The only resturants within walking distance are over priced and over rated. I will never stay at another Holiday inn after my experience with this.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here following our cruise. Hotel is right across from the cruise terminal. Staff was friendly and efficient. Our room was large, clean, and decor was fairly new. Comfortable bed. Good water pressure (we were on the 14th floor). We could hear the train that passes behind the hotel but didn't hear it after midnight. It didn't bother us. We enjoyed the warm pool and the high speed internet access. Easy walk to Little Italy. Plenty of dining within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: roeslers
Reviews.Content: I'm a native San Diegan, displaced, who travels back to SD often. This is one of my two favorite hotels in San Diego, because of the great location. And if you get an odd-numbered room in the Tower, the view is SIMPLY SPECTACULAR. Other than that it's just a normal, ho-hum hotel; nice, clean, nothing too fancy but truly nice enough. The room service has odd hours but because there are so many great restauarants in walking distance, it's no big deal. Especially try the restaurant "The Fish Market", about a 3-block stroll south on Harbor Dr. Also, in Little Italy, try both Filippi's (great food cheap) and Indigo Grill (great food with modern twists, not real cheap, but an appetizer is a meal). The other great hotel is the Radisson in La Jolla, which has beautiful grounds. It's far away from the main part of San Diego but near UCSD, La Jolla, La Jolla Beaches, etc. Be sure to try the La Valencia hotel's Sunday brunch but most important, get reservations (and directions) to the well-hidden (and a bit hard to find) but amazing Marine Room. Great ambiance and food (if a trifle pricey), it has a small jazz band for dancing but it is RIGHT ON THE OCEAN. The waves literally lap at it. Just go for a sunset drink and appetizer instead of splurging on a full dinner: you will be SO GLAD YOU DID. It's adjacent to the La Jolla Beach and Tennis Club. Anyway, depending on what you're looking for (spectacular view and good location are top in my book), I disagree that there are nicer hotels to be had for the money, if you get any kind of break at all on the room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: JosieCat-MN
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the Holiday Inn on the Bay. I stayed there for 6 nights for a conference, 3-4-10/2005. The hotel has a great location. If you can afford it, get a room with a bay view. The hotel staff was always very helpful and friendly. They had a wireless network and even had wireless cards that you could check out for several hours at no cost. I was on the 10th floor and although I didn't have a bay view, I had a nice view of downtown and a balcony.

HotelInfo.Name: Holiday Inn San Diego - On The Bay
HotelInfo.Address: 1355 North Harbor Drive, San Diego, CA 92101
